Title: Programmes and Administrative Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job

We're looking for team players with a passion for sustainable environment change to join our team on a full-time internship. The ideal candidate is someone who loves the environment, enjoys being outdoors but also able to function in an office environment.




The society operates on weekends, so applicants must be able to commit a half-day to work during weekends (either Saturday or Sunday). In essence, it will be a 5.5 day work week. We are flexible with regards to the weekend day the applicant is more comfortable with. We are also open to part-time internships of at least 5 days a week. The remuneration will be pro-rated accordingly.




Our team is lean and the successful candidate will be taking on multiple roles across different job functions which include:




Business development
Administration
Marketing
Education and outreach
Volunteer management




Job description

Conduct environmental programmes (on Foot, Bicycle, Kayak, Pedal-boat, Boat etc) to various corporates and schools (from pre-schools to large corporates, MNCs etc)
Administrative work which includes but is not limited to coordinating and managing volunteers with various background and age groups; update various systems (Salesforce CRM system, Excel, PowerPoint, etc).
Present at educational talks and exhibitions
Handles communication with staff, volunteers and public
Leadership quality to lead patrols and educational programmes on foot, bicycles and kayaks would be an advantage.




Required skills




Proficient in written and spoken English to liaise with businesses, schools and members of the public
Able to cycle to lead cycling patrols and activities
Able to multi-task and work independently where required, High EQ
A plus if you are able to produce video content and well versed with social media skills
A plus if you do hold a 1 Star kayaking certification

Posted on Jan 28, 2024.

Title: Algorithm Development Internship ‚Äì Summer 2024
Description Snippet:
About the job
Please only apply to one job posting. We recommend you apply for the position/office you are most interested in. Upon review of your application, if your skill sets are better suited for another position, we will reach out and let you know. If you are interested in multiple offices, you will have the opportunity to indicate that below in the application questions. 

HRT is seeking exceptional full-time students to join our Algorithm Development summer internship program. Algorithm Developers at HRT focus on the research and implementation of automated trading strategies. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to rotate between our high-frequency trading, multi-frequency trading, and/or machine learning teams. In close collaboration with your mentors, you will apply sophisticated quantitative modeling techniques to understand and predict market behavior and write software to improve our trading strategies.

We are looking for quantitatively-driven and practically-minded programmers, scientists, and mathematicians who are excited to collaborate with others to solve the most challenging problems in our field.

What To Expect


Leverage our proprietary infrastructure (Python/C++) in conjunction with third-party tools to conduct quantitative research and data analysis
Use machine learning and time series techniques to derive novel insights regarding market behavior from large and complex datasets
Work on real projects in close collaboration with experienced researchers, traders, and developers
Use our world-class compute cluster to run simulations and crunch data
Build predictive models for financial markets using a combination of market and non-market data
Attend and participate in Tech Talks that provide an overview of markets and HRT‚Äôs trading philosophy
Enjoy a curriculum of speakers, trading games, mentorships, and social events throughout the summer


Requirements


You are a full-time undergraduate, masters, or PhD student in a quantitative discipline (math, physics, computer science, statistics, or a related program) who is eligible for full-time roles in 2025
Experience programming in Python is a must; C++ is a plus for those interested in high-frequency trading
Experience with statistical analysis, numerical programming, or machine learning in Python, Pandas/Numpy, R, and/or MATLAB
A passion for applying quantitative models and technology toward solving real-world problems
Strong communication skills


Culture

Hudson River Trading (HRT) brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

At HRT we welcome a variety of expertise: mathematics and computer science, physics and engineering, media and tech. We‚Äôre a community of self-starters who are motivated by the excitement of being at the cutting edge of automation in every part of our organization‚Äîfrom trading, to business operations, to recruiting and beyond. We value openness and transparency, and celebrate great ideas from HRT veterans and new hires alike. At HRT we‚Äôre friends and colleagues ‚Äì whether we are sharing a meal, playing the latest board game, or writing elegant code. We embrace a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Feel like you belong at HRT? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. HRT is proud of our diverse staff; we have offices all over the globe and benefit from our varied and unique perspectives. HRT is an equal opportunity employer; so whoever you are we‚Äôd love to get to know you.

Title: News Desk Intern (CNBC) (Jun 2024 - Jan 2025)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Company Description

NBCUNIVERSAL INTERNATIONAL

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we‚Äôll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

CNBC INTERNATIONAL

CNBC is the world‚Äôs number one business and financial news network. Its mission is to help the influential and aspirational make astute decisions to get ahead by providing live market updates, breaking news, in-depth analysis and exclusive interviews.

CNBC‚Äôs vast portfolio includes CNBC.com, the online destination for global business; CNBC PRO, the network‚Äôs premium subscription service that provides real-time global market data and market analysis, as well as a growing slate of live and virtual events where consumers can experience CNBC‚Äôs award-winning journalism, live.

With headquarters in New Jersey, London, Singapore, and Abu Dhabi, CNBC provides a truly global 24-hour business briefing for senior business leaders, the financial community and those with assets to invest or protect. Today the channel is available in more than 392 million homes worldwide. CNBC also boasts a growing audience across its social media and digital video platforms.

Visit www.cnbc.com for more information.

NBCUniversal is the parent company of CNBC.

Job Description

The News Desk Intern supports the News Desk to ensure CNBC offers world-class content on global business and finance through guest interviews. You will learn how to ask intelligent, tough and balanced questions to high profile key stakeholders in the global business and finance industry. This role is ideal for university undergraduates aspiring to explore a career in TV news production and journalism. You enjoy interacting with people, and have keen interests and passion in business, economics, and financial markets and international relations. There will also be opportunities to learn about business and markets, as well as the fundamentals of journalism.

Your Responsibilities Include, But Not Limited To


Meet and greet C-suite guests and key industry stakeholders at CNBC Studio located at SGX Centre
Set guests up and interact with them prior to their interview segments on the TV shows
Create daily highlights and send them to key clients and affiliates
Learn how major global news networks react to breaking news and cover them with guests professionally
Learn how to pitch to news makers and market movers to come on to CNBC TV shows for interviews
Assist the News Desk to grow and build relationships with guests, companies, PR agencies and financial institutions in APAC


Qualifications


University undergraduates majoring in business, economics, mass communication and/or media production
Keen interest in business news, economics, financial markets & current affairs
Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational and interpersonal skills to engage and interact with both internal and external stakeholders at varying levels
Ability to prioritize a variety of tasks while operating under tight deadlines
Ability to work in a face-paced, high-tension live news environment
Willingness to learn and pro-actively take initiative
Fluency in English language is essential
Flexible to work early morning shifts


Additional Information

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable.

Title: Human Resources Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job

Kacific is a next-generation broadband satellite operator. We are committed to providing universal, fast, high-quality broadband access at an affordable cost using robust technologies and an agile business model. 

 

Founded in 2013 by a core team of senior satellite professionals, Kacific is backed by investors with global telecommunications and infrastructure experience. Our first Ka-band high throughput satellite, Kacific1, launched in 2019 to stream high-speed, low-cost, ultra-reliable broadband to rural and suburban areas of the Pacific and Southeast Asia.

 

The HR & Admin team at Kacific manages and delivers core HR operations functions across the organization, covering the full employee life cycle, such as recruitment, onboarding and offboarding, employment relations, compensation and benefits, learning and development, and human capital matters.

 

The HR Intern should have strong communication and writing skills and keep abreast of the latest developments in employment legislation to determine how the company‚Äôs HR policies may be affected. The role does not require technical skills and could include managing internal data, developing creative solutions to improve processes, and accessing relevant information for the team.




Job Description: 

Assist in reviewing, drafting, and enhancing people policies, including Employee Leave Benefits, Staff Benefits Policy, and HR Policies, ensuring alignment with best practices and regulatory requirements.
Manage employment-related agreements and documents, such as letters, to ensure accuracy, compliance, and efficient documentation processes.
Support employee engagement and communications projects within Singapore and the Southeast/Pacific Region. Promote staff activities in accordance with Kacific‚Äôs core values, involving effective liaison with vendors.
Contribute to Learning & Development initiatives, conducting skill-gap analyses, researching training programs/courses, and collaborating with vendors. Maintain an updated tracking list to monitor progress.
Provide support for End-to-End Internship Recruitment processes, including sourcing, screening, and interviewing job candidates. Ensure a seamless and positive candidate experience.
Develop communication materials that articulate the company‚Äôs culture, values, and expected behaviors, fostering a cohesive and inclusive work environment.
Establish and maintain administrative systems and processes for effective management of correspondences, documentation, compliance, reporting requirements, and budget and expense management.
Assist in organising and executing internal wellness and engagement activities, (e.g. National Day, Deepavali, etc).
Undertake other ad-hoc projects as assigned, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability in handling diverse tasks.




Qualifications:

Currently pursuing a degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite.
Proactive and self-motivated.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
Team player with a positive attitude.
Willingness to learn and contribute to various HR functions.

Title: APAC Channel Operations - Business Analyst Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we're guided by a shared purpose - helping people be their best in the moments that matter - and we live up to our purpose every day by solving for safer. Because people can only be their best when they not only feel safe, but are safe. We're solving for safer by building the best possible technologies across every part of our safety and security ecosystem. That's mission -critical communications devices and networks, AI-powered video security & access control and the ability to unite voice, video and data in a single command center view. We're solving for safer by connecting public safety agencies and enterprises, enabling the collaboration that's critical to connect those in need with those who can help. The work we do here matters.

Department Overview

Key responsibility to ensure operational excellence in the Channel Operations function which includes the following:

Channel Program


Drive the key partner program across International. These include the implementation and evolution of the program framework and also ensure the program has the tool, processes and incentive to drive channel business. 
Standardize on core program requirements and deliverables. 


Channel Behaviour


Drive scalability improvements regarding data management and data control as well as by transforming the data into high-quality insights to improve channel processes and programs. 
Drive reseller engagement across PartnerEmpower (& outside program)
Drive Weeks of Inventory


Channel Development


Support partners with the proper training, materials, and information to execute sales process and sell product or service. i.e. Safety Reimagined Radio Alert & Orchestrate. 
Align with Worldwide Education team changes to channel training model
Drive adoption of global tools & dashboards


Operations Excellence


Digital Transformation for channel partners and internal operations, standardize International Reporting & Simplify International Processes. 


Job Description


Business analytics of technology mix (unit, sales and revenue) trend. 
Performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data. 
Assist in developing visualizations and tools to improve the data analytics capabilities via automation and process to improve decision making cycle time. 
Data analytics ‚Äì provide insights on business intelligence to management and Sales team to make prompt and key decisions. 
Work across channels and functions to deliver reliable and timely information on leading sales indicators (sell-in, sell-thru, inventory and sell-out). 
Drive and implement regional/ global projects. 
Provide recommendations of improvement of key business processes and tools. 
Work with cross functional teams to support the implementation of proposed processes that include creating the training/ support materials and developing business rules & monitoring their effectiveness. 


Basic Requirements


Knowledge in Tableau and other analytics related programming is an added advantage. 
High analytic skills, with advanced knowledge in Excel. 
Good with numbers and attention to details
Ability to present and articulate through process and data analytics
Strong communications, presentation and influencing skills. 
Proven PM skills in managing multiple projects. 


At Motorola we value the diversity of our people. Motorola is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and is a proud sponsor of Females in Information Technology & Telecommunications.

None

Intern

Title: Membership Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Role Overview

This is a Membership Intern position, based out of Mandala Club premises in Singapore.

The Membership Department Intern will play a crucial role in supporting the operations of the Membership Department within a Mandala Club private members club. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in membership management, customer service, and administration within an exclusive and dynamic club environment. The intern will work closely with the membership team to assist in various tasks related to membership acquisition, retention, and engagement.

Responsibilities

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES


Assist in membership acquisition efforts by participating in outreach campaigns, including email correspondence, phone calls, and follow-ups with prospective members.
Support the membership application process by accurately inputting member information into the club's database and ensuring all required documentation is complete.

Title: Leadership Development Program Summer Internship 2024 (Singapore)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Restaurant Brands International

Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with more than $35 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 28,000 restaurants in more than 100 countries. RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands ‚Äì TIM HORTONS¬Æ, BURGER KING¬Æ, POPEYES¬Æ and FIREHOUSE SUBS¬Æ. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.

Leadership Development Program Summer Internship

Be bold. Dream Big.

Our 10-week internships for undergraduates give top-performing individuals an early taste of real business challenges. During your summer with us, you‚Äôll get to own at least one key project that‚Äôs been selected by our senior leaders. Past projects have included boosting our brand‚Äôs social media presence or improving the onboarding experience for new employees ‚Äì projects which offer the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the business. This is definitely not a coffee-getting, copy-making kind of internship ‚Äì you‚Äôll be using your talents to the fullest. Do well, and we‚Äôll invite you to join our Leadership Development Program after you graduate.

The Program

Global Onboarding

It all begins with orientation at our corporate office in Singapore. We‚Äôll give you an in-depth overview of our business and culture, and you‚Äôll spend a day getting hands-on experience in one of our restaurants.

Project work

After onboarding and training, you‚Äôll jump right into your project. Whatever that is, it will enable you to make an impact on our organization ‚Äì every project we assign to our interns receives sign off by our Regional President and Leadership team.

Ongoing support

You‚Äôll receive plenty of guidance, support, and exposure. Your summer schedule will include training, leadership team lunch-and-learns, formal and informal performance reviews, and social opportunities.

Final presentation

At the end of your internship, you‚Äôll deliver a presentation, reviewing your results and recommendations with members of our leadership team and the President of your region.

What You Need


A good academic track record ‚Äì you should be a penultimate year student, working towards a bachelor‚Äôs or master's degree at an accredited post-secondary institution.
A performance-focused, results-oriented approach ‚Äì you‚Äôll have a strong work ethic and a determination to achieve success.
Strong ownership mentality and exceptional levels of self-motivation, ambition, and entrepreneurial spirit.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, leadership and motivational skills.
Solid analytical capabilities and structured thinking.
Fluent in English

Title: Intern - Trading Analyst (Aug - Dec 2024)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Us
At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.

We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society‚Äôs evolving needs. Learn more about our What and our Why and how we can work together.

Overview
ExxonMobil Global Trading is where we trade oil, natural gas, and energy products safely and responsibly around the world. We leverage our expertise in analytics, logistics, origination, and knowledge of energy markets to maximize the value of our global assets and deliver industry-leading results. This is an exciting time to join our growing trading team and be an integral part of ExxonMobil.

What You Will Do
Through our internship program, you will gain first-hand experience with an industry leader in the refining and petrochemical industry, where your work, and that of the teams, contributes to the growth and future of our business, as we provide energy, sustainable products and solutions for society. You will also gain valuable experience and contribute to the dynamic world of commodity trading. You will work closely with experienced Trading Analysts and learn about the intricacies of the oil market. Your primarily responsibility is to assist the AP Trading Analytic Team in analyzing market data, market study and support ad hoc trading activities.

Your internship will be assessed, and the process includes a formal final review of project delivery and performance by your supervisor. You‚Äôll also be asked to prepare a final presentation and/or provide a report out about your project / work achieved. You can look forward to the following in your time with us:


Data Management - Collect and maintain accurate trading data and ensuring its availability for analysis and reporting. This include refineries outages/ expansion/ closure etc., country statistics such as demand, supply, etc. 
Trading reports - Develop weekly reports such as refinery outages, country inventory reports, ect. for the trading team
Research and Reporting - Conduct ad-hoc analysis and prepare reports on specific market, trends, etc. to assist in decision making


Outstanding candidates may be offered a full-time job offer to kick start your career.

About You
Skills and Qualifications

To be eligible for our Internship Program, you should be:


Preferably in your penultimate year of study
A degree in any Engineering course, Computational Science, Data Analytic, Statistic/ Mathematics major, Business/ Accountancy
Strong quantitative and analytical skills to interpret market data
Excellent attention to detail for accurate analysis 
Effective verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with team members and other trading functions
Experience and competent in working with spreadsheets, data analysis using excels, Power BI etc. and competent in programming such as Python, etc. 
Ability to work in a fast-paced, high pressure environment and adapt to changing market conditions. 


Stay connected with us:


Learn more at our website
Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram
Like us on Facebook 
Subscribe our channel at YouTube


Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunity in conformance with all applicable laws and regulations to individuals who are qualified to perform job requirements. The Company administers its personnel policies, programs, and practices in a non-discriminatory manner in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, work assignment, promotion, transfer, termination, wage and salary administration, and selection for training.

Please be informed that only shortlisted candidates will be notified, and you can find out more about our hiring process here.

We thank you for your interest in ExxonMobil.

Exxon Mobil Corporation has numerous affiliates, many with names that include ExxonMobil, Exxon, Esso and Mobil. Title: Summer Internship 2024 - Business Analytics Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Munich Re Group is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance. As pioneers in risk assessment, we drive the digital transformation of the global insurance landscape, expanding products and services as new forms of risk emerge. From space rocket launches to cyber-attacks, from high-net worth individuals to pandemics, we take care of risks so our clients can take care of their businesses.

Join us this Summer for our Structured Internship Program from May to August 2024. In addition to gaining valuable work experience alongside industry experts, you will also benefit from ongoing engagement, career development and networking activities.

Munich Re‚Äôs Digital Solutions provides AI driven solutions to meet our client‚Äôs needs. The Business team within MR Digital Solutions is primarily tasked with driving and managing AI projects and conducting risk assessments. The risk assessment techniques will encompass several fields, including data science, actuarial, and underwriting.

Your Role


 Gain exposure and understanding of ongoing AI or Machine Learning related projects that Munich Re‚Äôs Digital Solutions is working on
 Good understanding of AI models and business use-cases
 Assist the business analyst to provide analysis of the data
 Conduct risk assessment and monitor model performance of AI projects, and any other initiatives as required such as market research etc.



Your Profile


 Finance or analytics focused degree (Actuarial, quantitative finance, statistics, data science, business analytics).
 Data science exposure/experience or degree is an advantage.
 Exposure or knowledge in Python is an advantage.
 Good understanding of the insurance industry and products (preferable).
 Attention to detail, logical, display a willing to learn attitude, go-getter
 Excellent technical and analytical skills, logical and concise in approach



At Munich Re, we embrace, and value, the interaction of diverse backgrounds, experiences, perspectives and thought. This interaction is our foundation. Of our open culture and spirit of partnership. Of how our teams are built and cultivated. Of how we are supported and developed. And at the centre of this interaction is each of us.

Title: Algorithm Development Internship ‚Äì Summer 2024
Description Snippet:
About the job
Please only apply to one job posting. We recommend you apply for the position/office you are most interested in. Upon review of your application, if your skill sets are better suited for another position, we will reach out and let you know. If you are interested in multiple offices, you will have the opportunity to indicate that below in the application questions. 

HRT is seeking exceptional full-time students to join our Algorithm Development summer internship program. Algorithm Developers at HRT focus on the research and implementation of automated trading strategies. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to rotate between our high-frequency trading, multi-frequency trading, and/or machine learning teams. In close collaboration with your mentors, you will apply sophisticated quantitative modeling techniques to understand and predict market behavior and write software to improve our trading strategies.

We are looking for quantitatively-driven and practically-minded programmers, scientists, and mathematicians who are excited to collaborate with others to solve the most challenging problems in our field.

What To Expect


Leverage our proprietary infrastructure (Python/C++) in conjunction with third-party tools to conduct quantitative research and data analysis
Use machine learning and time series techniques to derive novel insights regarding market behavior from large and complex datasets
Work on real projects in close collaboration with experienced researchers, traders, and developers
Use our world-class compute cluster to run simulations and crunch data
Build predictive models for financial markets using a combination of market and non-market data
Attend and participate in Tech Talks that provide an overview of markets and HRT‚Äôs trading philosophy
Enjoy a curriculum of speakers, trading games, mentorships, and social events throughout the summer


Requirements


You are a full-time undergraduate, masters, or PhD student in a quantitative discipline (math, physics, computer science, statistics, or a related program) who is eligible for full-time roles in 2025
Experience programming in Python is a must; C++ is a plus for those interested in high-frequency trading
Experience with statistical analysis, numerical programming, or machine learning in Python, Pandas/Numpy, R, and/or MATLAB
A passion for applying quantitative models and technology toward solving real-world problems
Strong communication skills


Culture

Hudson River Trading (HRT) brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

At HRT we welcome a variety of expertise: mathematics and computer science, physics and engineering, media and tech. We‚Äôre a community of self-starters who are motivated by the excitement of being at the cutting edge of automation in every part of our organization‚Äîfrom trading, to business operations, to recruiting and beyond. We value openness and transparency, and celebrate great ideas from HRT veterans and new hires alike. At HRT we‚Äôre friends and colleagues ‚Äì whether we are sharing a meal, playing the latest board game, or writing elegant code. We embrace a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Feel like you belong at HRT? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. HRT is proud of our diverse staff; we have offices all over the globe and benefit from our varied and unique perspectives. HRT is an equal opportunity employer; so whoever you are we‚Äôd love to get to know you.

Title: Leadership Development Program Summer Internship 2024 (Singapore)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Restaurant Brands International

Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with more than $35 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 28,000 restaurants in more than 100 countries. RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands ‚Äì TIM HORTONS¬Æ, BURGER KING¬Æ, POPEYES¬Æ and FIREHOUSE SUBS¬Æ. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.

Leadership Development Program Summer Internship

Be bold. Dream Big.

Our 10-week internships for undergraduates give top-performing individuals an early taste of real business challenges. During your summer with us, you‚Äôll get to own at least one key project that‚Äôs been selected by our senior leaders. Past projects have included boosting our brand‚Äôs social media presence or improving the onboarding experience for new employees ‚Äì projects which offer the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the business. This is definitely not a coffee-getting, copy-making kind of internship ‚Äì you‚Äôll be using your talents to the fullest. Do well, and we‚Äôll invite you to join our Leadership Development Program after you graduate.

The Program

Global Onboarding

It all begins with orientation at our corporate office in Singapore. We‚Äôll give you an in-depth overview of our business and culture, and you‚Äôll spend a day getting hands-on experience in one of our restaurants.

Project work

After onboarding and training, you‚Äôll jump right into your project. Whatever that is, it will enable you to make an impact on our organization ‚Äì every project we assign to our interns receives sign off by our Regional President and Leadership team.

Ongoing support

You‚Äôll receive plenty of guidance, support, and exposure. Your summer schedule will include training, leadership team lunch-and-learns, formal and informal performance reviews, and social opportunities.

Final presentation

At the end of your internship, you‚Äôll deliver a presentation, reviewing your results and recommendations with members of our leadership team and the President of your region.

What You Need


A good academic track record ‚Äì you should be a penultimate year student, working towards a bachelor‚Äôs or master's degree at an accredited post-secondary institution.
A performance-focused, results-oriented approach ‚Äì you‚Äôll have a strong work ethic and a determination to achieve success.
Strong ownership mentality and exceptional levels of self-motivation, ambition, and entrepreneurial spirit.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, leadership and motivational skills.
Solid analytical capabilities and structured thinking.
Fluent in English

Title: [Tech Cooperative Internship] Data Engineering Intern (6 months)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

 Our Purpose ‚Äì  Bridging the World Through Travel 

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

The Opportunity:

Within our team, we are dedicated to developing and maintaining the engines that power machine-learning-driven systems for content deduplication. This involves a fusion of machine learning models, Spark jobs executed on Hadoop clusters, and a user-friendly back-office UI component accessible to our internal business users. Our systems span multiple data centers and operate across hundreds of machines. Our primary challenges revolve around accommodating the continuous expansion of features and business needs while meeting the SLA and scale demands of the systems.

In This Role, You‚Äôll Get to


Collaborate with seasoned engineers and product owners to identify business opportunities, design and develop new data systems from inception to deployment
Engage with the diverse tools and components of the Agoda Data Platform
Enhance the scalability, stability, and speed of existing applications
Diagnose and rectify production issues
Work closely with other teams to foster collaboration
Explore and share insights into new technologies across the organization


What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed


Passion for data and problem-solving on a large scale
Basic proficiency in at least one of the following languages: Scala, Java, Python, or any functional/OO languages. Our primary coding language is Scala
‚ÄúCan do‚Äù attitude
Eagerness to learn something new every day


It‚Äôs Great If You Have


Any prior experience
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop)
SQL knowledge


#students #singapore #cooperativeinterns

Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

Title: Risk Services - Data Trust Services Mid-Year Internship (May - Jul/Aug 24)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Line of Service

Assurance

Industry/Sector

FS X-Sector

Specialism

Risk

Management Level

Intern/Trainee

Job Description & Summary

We at PwC believe that challenges are better solved together. That's why you'll join a diverse, global community that comes together to build trust in society and solve important problems. With us, you are encouraged to lead with your heart and values, and where your skills are developed and put to work in exciting ways, superpowered by technology.

How Will You Value-add:

We aspire to build a team of data professionals with the ability to apply their knowledge in helping our clients solve their business challenges while future proofing their business.

Our practice is integrated across different PwC Lines of Services, and works collaboratively with our clients to manage engagements and lead teams of data and analytics resources in various aspects digital, data and analytics solutions.

Choose Your Track:

There are multiple tracks within our team where you can find your niche. Candidates will be assigned to the relevant roles, listed below, based on their experience and expertise. Please refer to the list below for a detailed description of the roles.

Track A: Data Engineering

A Data Engineer Is Responsible For Collecting, Managing, And Transforming Raw Data Into Information That Can Be Consumed And Interpreted Downstream By End Users, Facilitated By Data Scientists And Business Analysts. Your Ultimate Goal Is To Enable Organizations To Utilize Their Data For Performance Evaluation And Optimization. Here Are Some Of The Skills And Experience You May Need To Be Effective In Your Role:


Master‚Äôs or Bachelor‚Äôs degree and above in Analytics, Information Systems Management, Computer Science or related fields
Keen Interest in working with RDBMS such as DB2, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, PostGresSQL, Teradata, etc.
Possess good knowledge and experience in data quality definition, data cleansing and data treatment/profiling processes using open-source or industry-standard tools like Informatica
Good knowledge of the following is a plus
Data warehouse and data management implementation methodology
Conceptual knowledge of the data management frameworks, including operating model, data governance, data management, data security, data quality and data architecture 
Big data platforms like Cloudera and HortonWorks
Cloud technologies including AWS, Azure, Google Cloud and their respective ETL specific services (eg: AWS Glue) 
Cloud data warehouses like Snowflake, Redshift, Synapse
Data integration or ETL tools such as Informatica PowerCentre, Oracle Data Integrator, SAP Data Services, Ab Initio, IBM DataStage or Microsoft SSIS
API Management software design and build
Data Quality using Trillium Software, SAS Data Quality, SAP Data Quality Management, etc.
Data visualisation using tools such as Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI, Qlik Sense
Project management methodology like agile
Infrastructure paradigms such as OS, network,
Certification in any of database, data integration, data management, visualisation tools and cloud is an added advantage
Ability to pick up new tools and able to be independent with minimal guidance from the project leads/managers
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving capabilities
Ability to establish personal credibility quickly and demonstrate expertise
Keen learner and self-motivated to keep abreast with latest trends in data architecture like Data Fabric, Data Lakehouse, Data Mesh to name a few.

Track B: Data Management and Governance

A Data Management Professional Develops And Governs Data-oriented Systems Designed To Meet The Needs Of An Organization Or Research Team. Data Management Includes Accessing, Validating, And Storing Data That Is Needed For Research And Day-to-day Business Operations. Key Areas Of Work Include Data Quality, Metadata And Masterdata Management, Creation Of Data Catalogues To Name a Few. Here Are Some Of The Skills And Experience You May Need To Be Effective In Your Role:


A degree in technology or business-related subjects is recommended (e.g. Business Analytics, Computer Science, Accounting, Business Management, etc.)
Knowledge in the Financial industry through university courses or prior internships will be an added advantage
Strong technical and analytical skills coupled with good presentation skills, both oral and written
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively manage internal and external stakeholders 
Strong problem-solving skills and an ability to prioritise and manage multiple task
Ability to lead teams under pressure with demonstrated experience in project management
Self-driven, curious, a fast-learner and a strong practitioner of self-development
Must be able to stay up to date on the latest trends in data analytics like Data Fabric, Data Lakehouse, Data Mesh to name a few.
Conceptual understanding of various data platforms, including major cloud players like AWS, Azure and GCP is a plus
A passion for client service and an ability to work from both the PwC Singapore office and client sites


Track C: Data Science

A data scientist‚Äôs primary job, in simple terms, is to extract actionable insights of value from data. But we expect certain more skills and qualities in the data scientists who wish to join us, like


Ability to work with data to get it into proper form amenable for analysis which includes data preparation/wrangling and integration experience, feature engineering
Business acumen so that you are able to understand the business problem, translate the requirements into technical requirements and then ensure use cases you formulate see the light of the day


Read on only if you think you can deliver on both of the aforementioned aspects.

How Will You Value Add:


Using Data Science Methods and Artificial Intelligence to enhance innovation, profitability and growth of our clients in three dimensions:
(1) Business Innovation: Design and implement innovative, data-driven business models, identification, conception and assessment of industry and client specific Use Cases, Utilization of data-modeling and -analysis in every aspect of Sales, Marketing, Operations and Business-model innovation
(2) Big Data and Analytics: Extract new insights from various data sources leveraging sophisticated Machine Learning and AI solutions
(3) Digital Transformation: Working in multidisciplinary teams to define and implement corporate transformation as well as strategy development towards a ‚ÄúData-Driven Business‚Äù leveraging data science, AI, ML and digital technologies
Work with business and tech to develop end-to-end analytics solutions, from problem formulation, data sourcing to developing and deploying the solution into production
Provide business domain expertise/support
Provide end-to-end advanced solutions to design, develop and deploy to production system
Build MLOps, CI/CD practices to manage models regarding quick experiments and feedback loop and their ultimate operationalization
Communicate, interpret, execute analytics results and machine learning model details with business as well as technical stakeholders


About You:


Master‚Äôs or Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or other relevant fields with deep theoretical knowledge in machine learning, data mining or statistical / mathematical modelling
Prior experience in the design and execution of projects related to Data Analytics, Data science and digital transformation and up-to-date on methods and technologies related to Data Science, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning and Automation
Practical experience in solving complex problems using scientific methods and modelling approaches using experimental, statistical, machine learning and visualization techniques
Prior experience in the identification, pursuit and opportunities conversion is a plus
Proven practical interest in statistical modelling, Machine Learning, Text Mining or Data Visualization for use cases including segmenting, customer value modelling, marketing optimization, campaign management, Pricing, image and voice recognition, fraud detection, Robotics and Chatbots as well as real time data capture and evaluation.
Proficient in the technical skills such as SQL, Python, PySpark, ML packages and tools
Knowledge in Business Intelligence tools and relevant statistic tools/languages (e.g. R, Python, SAS) as well as Data Storytelling and visualization skills (e.g. with Tableau or QlikView)
Other tools/cloud platform knowledge and experience valued: Alteryx, GCP, Azure, AWS


Track D: BI and Data Visualisation

Specific Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To:


Perform work across diverse industries and projects ranging from developing organisational strategies for analytics to building sophisticated data architectures and analytical models
Analyse and interpret large volumes of data from client data systems and external sources using proprietary and open source data tools, platforms and analytical tool kits
Translate complex findings into simple language and communicate them to internal and external stakeholders, such as your team members and clients executives
Deliver excellent client service and work from both the PwC Singapore office and at client sites


About You


Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Economics, Engineering, Information Systems, Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or other related disciplines that possesses an analytical and quantitative component from a reputable university
Strong communication skills and an awareness of global trends
Strong preference for basic competency in two or more of the following:
an analytical software (e.g. R, SAS)
a data visualization tool (e.g. Qlik, Tableau, PowerBI)
a relational or graph database management tool (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, Neo4J)
programming/scripting language (e.g. VBA, C++, Java, Python)
distributed architectures (e.g. HDFS, Mapreduce, Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Pig, Hive)
A self-driven learner with the ability to quickly learn and apply new tools and techniques such as proprietary analytical software, data models and programming languages
An appreciation for structured methodical research, critical thinking and problem solving skills with an understanding for the application of these skills in the business environment
A natural curiosity to identify, investigate and explain trends and patterns in data
An ability to analyse and break down complex concepts and technical findings into clear and simple language for communication to team members and clients
A passion for Emerging Technologies related to Big Data, Machine Learning and AI

Track E: Data Generalist / Analytics focussed Business Analyst (BA)

A business analyst plays a key role in the lifecycle of an analytics project, by analyzing data and providing insights that can help the stakeholders make better business decisions. As a Data Generalist or a Business Analyst, you would often work closely with data analysts to collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources, and business stakeholders to elicit analytics requirements around use cases. The ability to wear multiple hats, translate business requirements into technical requirements, drive UATs and test case scenarios, guide and manage the team delivering the data analytics project will be some of the key responsibilities in your job.

About You


Someone who has interest in at least two of the below tracks:
Data Engineering
Data Management
Data Science
BI and Data Visualisation
Knowledge in creating and maintaining documents like Business Requirements Document (BRD), Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM), Functional Specification Document (FSD)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as the demonstrated ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively
Track record of providing ongoing support and guidance to stakeholders to help them understand and use data effectively, like conducting adoption trainings, hackathons etc. is a plus
Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders to identify and prioritize business needs
Interest in developing and implementing data collection and analysis processes
Evaluating data to identify areas for improvement and making recommendations to senior management
At least a Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as business management, engineering, economics, or statistics

Next Step:

You will receive an email from us to complete pymetrics within 3 working days of your application submission. Pymetrics is a series of engaging online games that will assess cognitive, behavioural and emotional traits. This allows us to learn more about you and gives us insights into where you will thrive the most in our business.

Description Snippet:
About the job

GetGo is Singapore‚Äôs largest and fastest growing carsharing platform that enables everyone with the freedom to drive, without the burden of ownership. Our vision is to be APAC‚Äôs #1 carsharing platform as we seek to create a mobility ecosystem that's shared and sustainable for all.

Title: Quantitative Trading Analyst Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Our formula for success is to hire exceptional people, encourage their ideas and reward their results.

As a Quantitative Trading Analyst Intern, you will gain exposure to the dynamic worlds of trading and technology in order to learn what it takes to become a successful and sustainable trader. You will work on a small team to combine the disciplines of technology, research and risk management to identify optimal trading and investment strategies within the regulatory framework through a series of project based assignments. At the conclusion of internship, you will have the opportunity to present your results to senior leadership at DRW. While your days will have you engrossed with complex quantitative trading projects, your evenings will be spent exploring the city with organized social events to truly discover what it‚Äôs like to live and work in Singapore.

How You Will Make An Impact‚Ä¶


Collaborate with senior traders, technologists and quantitative researchers by developing and improving trading strategies by working directly on the trading desk
Identify and research in the development of cutting-edge market research projects using powerful analytic tools
Market research projects vary from macroeconomic data curation and analysis to application of machine learning techniques to market tick data for automated trading
Be given immediate responsibility through assignments like position tracking, calculating risk, and analyzing vital theoretical values


What You Bring To The Team‚Ä¶


Are pursuing a bachelor‚Äôs, master‚Äôs or PhD in mathematics, economics, physics, statistics, computer science or any engineering related field and have an expected graduation date between December 2024 and June 2025
Advanced quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to deploy those skills under time-sensitive situations
Proficient programming in Python
Are self-motivated, enjoy challenges and significant responsibility, and thrive in fast-paced, competitive environments
A passion for the financial markets and a deep curiosity to explore new methodologies
Strong communication skills to advocate your ideas in a clear and concise manner to the group


What To Expect During The Internship


Meaningful projects: Each project, advised by a trader, promotes a comprehensive learning experience and provides you with real-world work experience.
Community: Throughout the summer, we host a variety of educational, social and team-building activities to explore the city, foster friendships and camaraderie.
Mentorship: You‚Äôll build a professional relationship with an experienced mentor in your field. Mentors and mentees meet to discuss goals, challenges and professional development and explore the city together at our mentor outings.


DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that it‚Äôs not just what we do that matters‚Äìit's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

Title: Intern, Robotics research engineer
Description Snippet:
About the job

Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group's interests in Southeast Asia where it is present in all ASEAN member countries. Business operations in these countries report to Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd, located in Singapore. Bosch has been present in Southeast Asia since 1919, with diversified businesses in the company's four business sectors - Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. Bosch's strategic objective is to improve quality of life with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is ‚ÄúInvented for life.‚Äù



At Bosch, we care. For you, our business, and our environment.



Let‚Äôs turn visions into reality. At Bosch,we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people‚Äôs lives. Our areas of activity are every bit as diverse as our outstanding Bosch teams around the world. Their creativity is the key to innovation through connected living, mobility or industry. Our responsibility goes far beyond business. We‚Äôre independent of stock markets and bound to the purpose of the Robert Bosch Foundation; our success directly benefits society, the environment, and future generations. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference.



Let‚Äôs be remarkable.



Job Description



As a robotics research engineer, the candidate will work on developing a new testbed towards automation autonomous disassembly process in e-waste management. The candidate will assist in:

Development of the testbed to integrate sensors, robots, conveyor belts, workbench, controllers, etc.
Programing and integrating industrial robots to perform tasks such as pick-n-drop and execution of disassembly action.
Development and maintenance of prototype applications based on controllers such as Raspberry Pi and Arduino
Improving trajectory planning algorithms to ensure high throughput of operations such as pick-n-drop
Developing automated robot trajectory planning for robotic 3D scanning and disassembly, and automated generation and execution of disassembly actions.
Closely communicate with other teams and presentation slides


Qualifications


Able to work full time for a period of 6 months (April 2024 onwards)
Undergraduate/graduate studies in related field of robot engineering
Major in robotics from Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering or Electrical engineering and Computer Science
Experience with ROS platform and Machine vision
Advanced knowledge in embedded programming, python, machine learning.
Independent learning and self-motivated

Title: Intern - QA
Description Snippet:
About the job
Education required: Bachelor's Degree in Science, Engineering or Administration

Other requirements:  Must be enrolled at a University for the duration of your Internship

Language requirement: Written and spoken fluency in English

Expected Start Date: May/June 2024

Application deadline:  9 Feb 2024

We will close this vacancy when we have enough applications, so please apply as soon as you can so your application can be considered

Looking to gain valuable real world work experience and help positively impact the health of billions of people? 

A GSK internship offers you the opportunity to kickstart your career ‚Äì to take on a real role with genuine impact! You‚Äôll take on challenging, serious work on live projects or assignments. You‚Äôll also get to learn from us, develop your skills and gain valuable experience for wherever the future takes you.

With an investment of S$510 million, our state-of-the-art vaccines manufacturing facility at Tuas was opened in June 2009 by Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, coinciding with our 50th anniversary in Singapore. Comprising two production buildings, an administration block, quality control laboratories, utility plant and warehousing, the facility became operational in 2011. The facility and operations meet the high quality and good manufacturing standards of global regulatory bodies such as the European Medicines Agency and the United States Food and Drug Administration.

Tuas is a key manufacturing site within our network supplying the active ingredient used to make our pneumococcal conjugate vaccine. This paediatric vaccine is indicated for the active immunisation against pneumonia, invasive diseases and acute otitis media caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae in infants and children.

Tuas site also focuses on manufacturing Hib (Haemophilus influenzae type b) antigen which is used in the manufacture of several pediatric vaccines. Hib is a bacterium responsible for invasive diseases, such as severe pneumonia and meningitis, contracted almost exclusively by children less than five years old.

These two vaccine products manufactured at Tuas cover several diseases causing pediatric mortality in the world, making a significant contribution to our global health agenda. The site continues to invest in developing technical capability and process improvement and embracing new technology such as digital, data, and analytics to position itself as a center of excellence for the manufacture of vaccines.

Watch GSK Tuas Introduction video here

GSK Tuas in the news

Pharma giant GSK to build Singapore facility making Hepatitis B vaccine | Video - CNA (channelnewsasia.com)

GSK‚Äôs Tuas vaccine facility is Singapore‚Äôs largest after over $300m investment added: Gan Kim Yong | The Straits Times

What will you do?

The quality department for GSK Vaccines. The intern will work under the supervision of the Quality Systems Lead and have the opportunity to manage the archival system for GMP documents on-site. During the internship, there will be many opportunities to collaborate with other functions through continuous improvement initiatives as well as during preparations for audits, investigations, and data collation.

Where does the role fit?



Manage the archival system of GMP documents on-site 
Propose improvements to simplify archival processes 
Propose solutions for the management of physical and digital documents 
Share good practices with users on Good Documentation practices relating to archival 
Be involved in deviation investigations if any 
Support data collation and compliance sampling (documentation check) activities for the annual system effectiveness review 
Support logistics and activities for audit preparation and execution 
Support self-inspection and internal audit follow-up 



What are we looking for?



Educational background ‚Äì Undergraduate studying Bachelor's Bachelor's Degree in Science, Engineering, or Administration who is interested in learning more about a manufacturing environment and vaccines
Proficient in the use of IT and software/systems, ideally document management and database systems 
Strong written and oral communication skills 
Deadline-driven, flexible with self-reliance to work in an empowered environment 
Demonstrated ability to take initiative, think and work independently, and problem-solve 
Strong drive for performance and attention to detail 
A passion for knowledge 



What do we offer you?  



Understand the Good Manufacturing Practices in the Biopharmaceutical industry 
Understand the importance of Good Documentation practices to ensure document integrity throughout their lifecycle 
Experience problem-solving sessions to find solutions 
Learn investigation skills 
Practice interpersonal and organization skills through planning and coordination of sitewide activities 
Learn data analysis through quality system data trending 



Let‚Äôs do this!

You‚Äôll find hints, tips, and guidance on our recruitment process on our website ‚Äì Learn more about the application process | GSK

You can hear more from our past interns in the video below:

We recommend you apply as soon as possible because we accept ongoing applications and offer positions on a first-come, first served basis.

Apply now!

Need help with your application? Please email us at sg.campus@gsk.com and let us know how we can help you.

Why Us?

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose ‚Äì to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together ‚Äì so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns ‚Äì as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030.

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it‚Äôs also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves ‚Äì feeling welcome, valued and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

Title: Regional Marketing Intern (CRM)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description

Regional Marketing Internship - 6 months 

Your Job 

You‚Äôre not the person who will settle for just any role. Neither are we. Because we‚Äôre out to create Better Care for a Better World, and that takes a certain kind of person and teams who care about making a difference. Here, you‚Äôll bring your professional expertise, talent, and drive to building and managing our portfolio of iconic, ground-breaking brands.

In your Regional Marketing Internship - 6 months role, you‚Äôll help us deliver better care for billions of people around the world. It starts with YOU.

Role Overview & Primary Accountabilities


 Co-design CRM programmes to launch at scale for APAC, especially for key markets like Australia, Indonesia and Vietnam
 Propose recommendations to improve our acquisition, utilisation and engagement scores (as supported by our in-house IT teams and external agencies)
 Deep-dive into key markets‚Äô performance for strategic reviews; evaluating based on CRM metrics, content quality, email design, segmentation etc
 Do some competitive studies on how other companies and brands are doing their CRM programmes, and apply some of these best practices as our own
 Work on special projects such as tapping on new acquisition sources, launching new communication channels, tapping on AI capabilities to elevate our CRM capabilities etc
 Prepare reports for our acquisition, engagement and utilisation performance on a monthly and quarterly basis (as supported by our in-house IT teams and external agencies)


About Us

Huggies¬Æ. Kleenex¬Æ. Cottonelle¬Æ. Scott¬Æ. Kotex¬Æ. Poise¬Æ. Depend¬Æ. Kimberly-Clark Professional¬Æ. You already know our legendary brands‚Äîand so does the rest of the world. At Kimberly-Clark, you‚Äôll be part of the best team committed to driving innovation, growth, and impact. It‚Äôs all here for you at Kimberly-Clark.

Led by Purpose. Driven by You.

About You

You‚Äôre driven to perform at the highest level possible, and you appreciate a performance culture fueled by authentic caring. You want to be part of a company actively dedicated to sustainability, inclusion, wellbeing, and career development.

You‚Äôre also a university graduate or pursuing other related field. You love what you do, especially when the work you do makes a difference. At Kimberly-Clark, we‚Äôre constantly exploring new ideas on how, when, and where we can best achieve results.

Title: International Consulting Principal
Description Snippet:
About the job
Welcome to Brighter!

Ready to be part of a company that is not only leading the market, but transforming in the most exciting way? We are a team of experts who believe in building brighter futures for our clients and community by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and health and wellbeing.

At Mercer, we walk the talk:


Voted #1 HR Consulting Company globally
Named Best Employee Engagement Consultancy and Best Corporate Wellness Provider by Human Resources Online
Great Package and Recognition Programs
Energetic & flexible environment surrounded by supportive colleagues


We take care of our people and we pride ourselves in our diverse and inclusive workforce with our ‚Äúpeople first‚Äù culture. We make sure our people are continually learning and growing, providing them with outstanding career development, on-the-job learning opportunities and financial rewards. Most importantly, we are committed to making your journey with us meaningful and fun.

To support our team and strengthen the growth of our APAC business, we are seeking an International Consulting Principal based in Singapore or Hong Kong.

What can you expect?


Exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic international consulting team, advising multinational clients within the Asia Pacific region. You will contribute to the team's commercial success by creating and delivering international consulting solutions across various lines of business at Mercer.
This role will expose you to multiple employee benefit advisory domains, including health, flexible benefits, wellbeing, and retirement. You will also support key multinational clients across Asia Pacific, helping them with their strategic agendas on benefits, employee experience, and engagement.
You will be part of a great team culture and work environment!


We will count on you to:


Develop strong relationships: Build a strong network of relationships internally, collaborating with various stakeholders such as the regional consulting team, country brokers, country retirement teams, cross line of business functions, and global international consulting group teams. Externally, establish partnerships with insurers and third-party service providers.
Manage regional consulting projects: Play a key role in a wide variety of regional consulting projects, including ad-hoc multi-country projects, benefit and well-being strategy and implementation, employee health data analytics, and retirement governance and advisory. Proactively manage timelines, act as a project manager, and ensure all stakeholders are kept updated with timely information. Attend internal and client meetings as necessary to provide guidance.
Drive innovative initiatives: Identify, drive, and support first-to-market initiatives. Stay updated on employee benefit trends in the market and contribute to the development of these initiatives. Develop vendor partnerships that add value to our well-being, health, and retirement offerings. Prepare internal and client-facing presentations to showcase employee benefit trends. Understand client challenges and prioritize a client-centric approach.
Business development: Actively promote our value propositions both internally and externally to build a pipeline. Support all business development-related activities.


What you need to have: 


Consulting experience: At least 12 years of consulting experience in roles related to health, global or regional benefits, and/or employee benefits.
Education: University graduate from an analytical and business management program, preferably in Mathematics, Business Management, Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields.
Domain knowledge: Strong domain knowledge in corporate employee health, well-being, or retirement.
Communication and presentation skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Project and client management: Strong project management and client management experience.
Analytical skills: Excellent analytical and numerical skills, with the ability to understand statistics and make data-driven decisions. Ability to visualize and interpret trends, create and analyze analytics reports, and effectively "story tell."
Proactive and resourceful: Proactive, resourceful self-starter with strong market research skills and the ability to absorb market knowledge effectively.
Critical thinking: Strong learning agility with critical and logical thinking capabilities.
Team player: Resourceful team player who can manage tight timelines and deliver client projects for multiple markets across Asia. Ability to work in cross-functional teams and actively contribute to a collaborative, innovative team culture.
Business acumen: Ability to envision and take advantage of business opportunities in a global and regional capacity.

We have manufacturing facilities that include an integrated world-scale refining and petrochemical complex in Jurong and Jurong Island, a network of service stations under the Esso brand, operate a lubricant plant and are a supplier of cylinder cooking gas. ExxonMobil provides customers and commercial markets in the region with ground transportation, industrial, aviation and marine fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and liquefied natural gas (LNG).

As Singapore serves as the AP hub for some of our businesses, we employ about 3,500 people across positions in operations, projects, commercial, corporate support functions and others.

ExxonMobil also contributes to community programs in Singapore that support the arts, education, health and the environment.

For more information, visit www.exxonmobil.com.sg or follow ExxonMobil Singapore on LinkedIn and Instagram.

What You Will Do

Through our internship program, you will gain first-hand experience with an industry leader in the refining and petrochemical industry, where your work, and that of the teams, contributes to the growth and future of our business, as we provide energy, sustainable products and solutions for society. You will have the opportunity to explore your career aspirations while delivering tangible benefits throughout our business from invaluable on-the-job-experience. Beyond that, you won‚Äôt be going it alone as you will have a supervisor & buddy assigned to you who can help you navigate the organization, give advice on your development & help you learn what it takes to achieve your goals.

As part of the assessed internship, you‚Äôll have a formal final review on project delivery and performance by your supervisor. You‚Äôll also be asked to prepare a final presentation or report out about your project. Your internship scope would include:


 Opportunities to support some of technical activities including monitoring, troubleshooting and optimization 
 Supporting improvement initiatives and programs to achieve safe, reliable and optimized unit operation 
 Involvement in real significant projects. Take part in challenging development projects, gain insights into the pillars of operational fundamentals & contribute to business needs. 



An internship with us can also be seen as a way to kickstart your career, as your performance will be assessed, and outstanding candidates may be given a full-time job offer. We prioritize our employment offers to outstanding candidates on our internship program over those without internship.

About You

Skills and Qualifications

To be eligible for our Internship Program, you should be:


 Preferably in your penultimate year of study 
 A degree in Chemical Engineering, preferably Second Upper Honors and above, and / or with leadership experience in non-academic areas such as Co-curriculum activities or National Service. 
 Willing to work at one of our assigned manufacturing locations in Jurong Island or Pioneer Road 
 Successful candidates may be assigned to either a Process Engineer or Process Control Engineer role 



Stay connected with us:


 Learn more at our website 
 Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram 
 Like us on Facebook 
 Subscribe our channel at YouTube 



Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunity in conformance with all applicable laws and regulations to individuals who are qualified to perform job requirements. The Company administers its personnel policies, programs, and practices in a non-discriminatory manner in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, work assignment, promotion, transfer, termination, wage and salary administration, and selection for training.

Our culture and values:

Be customer-obsessed

We build trust through honesty and transparency. We‚Äôre committed to doing the right thing for our customers, our company, and each other

Think forward

Make an impact 

We drive positive change as individuals, and as a company. We‚Äôre passionate about creating a better tomorrow for our industry and our communities

Title: Design Innovation Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Location: Singapore, Singapore

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.
