Internship: Design Innovation Engineer at the Thales Innovation Hub (R&T&I)

With 80,000 employees in 68 countries, Thales plays a key role in keeping the public safe and secure, guarding vital infrastructure and protecting national security interests. Thales has been recognized for the fourth time as one of the world's top 100 innovators.

As an intern, you will


Support innovation projects in the domains of Aerospace, Space, Defence, Transportation & Security, working on Smart City initiatives such as Smart sensors & Video Analytics, Unmanned Underwater Vehicles, new Space solutions and In-flight Entertainment and Connectivity projects. 
Apply Design Thinking (User-Centered Innovation) methodology to innovate with customers/users on complex systems design and development. 
Be an integral part of the Marketing and Innovation team at Thales and working with Thales customers.
Meet, learn from and interact with many domain experts who come from different backgrounds and expertise.
Opportunities to engage to Thales customers and partners.
Experience real working environment in multi-cultural teams, working with colleagues mainly in Europe and Australia
Research and analyze market data and technology trends.
Understand how the corporate and technical departments of a company compliment and support one another.



Specifically, you will be involved in the following activities


Assist to prepare for Design Thinking workshops in various engineering domains under guidance of Thales domain experts.
 prepare Inspiration Boards or Concept mapping based on research.
 prepare physical mock-ups (prototypes) to be used during sessions to engage users.
Build digital prototypes across multiple domains.
Apply design thinking techniques to co-design with customers/users.
Participate in Design Innovation workshops with customers/users.
Create/produce videos, infographics to help the target audience understand Thales‚Äô products/solutions.
Build 3D Models of innovative products, when needed.
Prepare reports for innovation workshops, and produce Synthesis Posters
Provide technical support in the Innovation Hub

Provide support in product design: 3D modeling and 3D printing.
Assist to organize and prepare for product/technology showcases to customers. 
Attend industry events (eg. conferences, product/technology seminars) and gather market intelligence in Singapore.
Gather business intelligence and data to gain understanding of customer and market needs.
Research on Thales‚Äô competitors and present to the team



The following skills are useful, but not mandatory:

3D Prototyping, 3D Printing, Laser cutting.

Adobe suite, Solidworks, AutoCAD.

At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Title: Intern - QA
Description Snippet:
About the job
Education required: Bachelor's Degree in Science, Engineering or Administration

Other requirements:  Must be enrolled at a University for the duration of your Internship

Language requirement: Written and spoken fluency in English

Expected Start Date: May/June 2024

Application deadline:  9 Feb 2024

We will close this vacancy when we have enough applications, so please apply as soon as you can so your application can be considered

Looking to gain valuable real world work experience and help positively impact the health of billions of people? 

A GSK internship offers you the opportunity to kickstart your career ‚Äì to take on a real role with genuine impact! You‚Äôll take on challenging, serious work on live projects or assignments. You‚Äôll also get to learn from us, develop your skills and gain valuable experience for wherever the future takes you.

With an investment of S$510 million, our state-of-the-art vaccines manufacturing facility at Tuas was opened in June 2009 by Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, coinciding with our 50th anniversary in Singapore. Comprising two production buildings, an administration block, quality control laboratories, utility plant and warehousing, the facility became operational in 2011. The facility and operations meet the high quality and good manufacturing standards of global regulatory bodies such as the European Medicines Agency and the United States Food and Drug Administration.

Tuas is a key manufacturing site within our network supplying the active ingredient used to make our pneumococcal conjugate vaccine. This paediatric vaccine is indicated for the active immunisation against pneumonia, invasive diseases and acute otitis media caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae in infants and children.

Tuas site also focuses on manufacturing Hib (Haemophilus influenzae type b) antigen which is used in the manufacture of several pediatric vaccines. Hib is a bacterium responsible for invasive diseases, such as severe pneumonia and meningitis, contracted almost exclusively by children less than five years old.

These two vaccine products manufactured at Tuas cover several diseases causing pediatric mortality in the world, making a significant contribution to our global health agenda. The site continues to invest in developing technical capability and process improvement and embracing new technology such as digital, data, and analytics to position itself as a center of excellence for the manufacture of vaccines.

Watch GSK Tuas Introduction video here

GSK Tuas in the news

Pharma giant GSK to build Singapore facility making Hepatitis B vaccine | Video - CNA (channelnewsasia.com)

GSK‚Äôs Tuas vaccine facility is Singapore‚Äôs largest after over $300m investment added: Gan Kim Yong | The Straits Times

What will you do?

The quality department for GSK Vaccines. The intern will work under the supervision of the Quality Systems Lead and have the opportunity to manage the archival system for GMP documents on-site. During the internship, there will be many opportunities to collaborate with other functions through continuous improvement initiatives as well as during preparations for audits, investigations, and data collation.

Where does the role fit?



Manage the archival system of GMP documents on-site 
Propose improvements to simplify archival processes 
Propose solutions for the management of physical and digital documents 
Share good practices with users on Good Documentation practices relating to archival 
Be involved in deviation investigations if any 
Support data collation and compliance sampling (documentation check) activities for the annual system effectiveness review 
Support logistics and activities for audit preparation and execution 
Support self-inspection and internal audit follow-up 



What are we looking for?



Educational background ‚Äì Undergraduate studying Bachelor's Bachelor's Degree in Science, Engineering, or Administration who is interested in learning more about a manufacturing environment and vaccines
Proficient in the use of IT and software/systems, ideally document management and database systems 
Strong written and oral communication skills 
Deadline-driven, flexible with self-reliance to work in an empowered environment 
Demonstrated ability to take initiative, think and work independently, and problem-solve 
Strong drive for performance and attention to detail 
A passion for knowledge 



What do we offer you?  



Understand the Good Manufacturing Practices in the Biopharmaceutical industry 
Understand the importance of Good Documentation practices to ensure document integrity throughout their lifecycle 
Experience problem-solving sessions to find solutions 
Learn investigation skills 
Practice interpersonal and organization skills through planning and coordination of sitewide activities 
Learn data analysis through quality system data trending 



Let‚Äôs do this!

You‚Äôll find hints, tips, and guidance on our recruitment process on our website ‚Äì Learn more about the application process | GSK

You can hear more from our past interns in the video below:

We recommend you apply as soon as possible because we accept ongoing applications and offer positions on a first-come, first served basis.

Apply now!

Need help with your application? Please email us at sg.campus@gsk.com and let us know how we can help you.

Why Us?

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose ‚Äì to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together ‚Äì so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns ‚Äì as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030.

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it‚Äôs also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves ‚Äì feeling welcome, valued and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. To gain exposure and experience to the quality assurance function in pharmaceutical industry. Understanding of the cGMP concepts and considerations. Gives the candidate a hands-on experience in the capacity of a Quality Officer.

Student must not be Allergic to Penicillin



Why Us?

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose ‚Äì to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together ‚Äì so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns ‚Äì as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030.

Our success absolutely depends on our people. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

Title: Intern - F10 Quality - PCS Advanced Data Analytics
Description Snippet:
About the job
Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all.

Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.

JR49432 Intern - F10 Quality - PCS Advanced Data Analytics

Applying data analytics and machine learning techniques on the big data from quality area for faster quality metrics drift detection. Develop an end-to-end solution from data query, pre-processing, analytics and results visualization.

Project Title: faster quality metrics drift detection using advanced data analytics and machine learning

Description


Data analytics and machine learning has been introduced in the Micron manufacturing operations to improve efficiency. There are intensive quality metrics monitoring before product being shipped out. New big data and machine learning based data analytics methods are demanded of faster drift detection. 
In this project, a novel method will be developed to leverage analytics and machine learning on the big data generated from various electrical, physical tests and measurements for earlier drift detection of quality healthy metrics. 
the student will have the opportunity to learn and apply industrial data analytics, modeling, simulation and optimization skills to solve the practical issues and bring real impact on the state-of-arts semiconductor manufacturing process. 
The intern will also have opportunity to participate to an end-to-end solution development team to contribute ideas and learn from industrial subject experts. 


Scope: Explore various machine learning techniques for the feature selection, modeling and simulation on the big test and measurement data. Explore inline and probe data correlation. Explore multiple variables optimization. Explore surface curve turning point detection.

Deliverable: Accurate modeling of the quality metrics, early drift detection

Impact of Project: improved product quality control

Skillset Require: general problem solving, data analytics, programming language R, python

Course of interests: data analytics related courses, i.e., engineering, statistics, mathematics, computer science

Duration Period: min 5 months (Semester Internship from August to December)

About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions transforming how the world uses information to enrich life for all. With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron¬Æ and Crucial¬Æ brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities ‚Äî from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience.

Title: Software Informatics Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
What if the work you did every day could impact the lives of people you know? Or all of humanity?

At Illumina, we are expanding access to genomic technology to realize health equity for billions of people around the world. Our efforts enable life-changing discoveries that are transforming human health through the early detection and diagnosis of diseases and new treatment options for patients.

Working at Illumina means being part of something bigger than yourself. Every person, in every role, has the opportunity to make a difference. Surrounded by extraordinary people, inspiring leaders, and world changing projects, you will do more and become more than you ever thought possible.

Make a difference and be part of something bigger. Experience the breath-taking pace of genomic innovation through Illumina‚Äôs internship opportunities. During our program, you‚Äôll learn, grow, and become a fully integrated member of the Illumina team. Join our Internship Program 2024 for an exciting and fulfilling experience, and we'll give you an experience you'll remember for a lifetime!

Software Informatics Intern (18-24 Weeks)

The Software Informatics Intern will complete an 18-24 weeks program from Jun to Dec 2024. Shortlisted candidates will be invited for interviews, and we will extend offers to successful candidates.

Project Description

The cost to sequence a human genome is rapidly decreasing and will approach $100 in the coming years. This is driving the creation of multi-omic data sets, population sequencing of multi-million sample human cohorts, gene expression profiles of millions of cells from a single sample, experiments to characterize the functional consequences of all possible variants in a gene, and surveys of the complete human immune repertoire‚Ä¶ and this is just the beginning.

To derive value and insights from these incredibly deep and varied data sets, genomics has become an information science, requiring investment in modern data engineering, data science, and machine learning capabilities. Applications range from population based sequencing efforts to personalized health care and genetics-informed drug discovery.

Towards this end, Illumina is partnering with PRECISE, which aims to generate, sequence and deliver fully analyzed data for 100,000 Whole Genomes of the Singapore Population (SG100K).

The successful candidates will play a key role in advancing this project, working across internal teams and with external partners to identify, develop and test a catalogue of new bioinformatics workflows, while also enabling scalable deployment of these workflows in our cloud platform.

Roles And Responsibilities


Work collaboratively with teammates, other teams within Illumina, and with external collaborators and partners to apply novel genomic data sets and tools to population genomics, personalized medicine, and other emerging applications.
Contribute to the development and implementation of our tools to better allow the use of large genomic data sets in these emerging applications.
Work with Illumina software engineering colleagues to deploy these techniques to internal and external users on a cloud-deployed platform.
Contribute to pilot studies with partners
Communicate effectively across the research and informatics organizations
Learn and have fun!


Qualifications And Requirements


Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate program, ideally in Computational Biology, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Biomedical Science or Engineering
Competent in at least one software programming language, preferably Python (or R) for data analysis and visualization
Passion for technology, healthcare, and personalized medicine
Excellent interpersonal and communication (English ‚Äì both oral and written) skills, along with the ability to communicate appropriately and confidently with colleagues from a wide range of backgrounds and seniority levels
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated, resourceful and proactive
Curious and observative, in order to rapidly comprehend the research and development environment to deliver fit for purpose results to the project team
Experience with standard bioinformatics tools for Next-Generation sequencing analysis is preferred
Familiarity with cloud computing is preferred


Learning Objectives

This internship opportunity aims to provide students whose interests lie beyond academic research with practical experience of how they can apply the knowledge they have acquired in alternate roles.

The goals are to help the student achieve the following learning objectives:


Real-life experience in prototyping and developing new data science and software solutions in an emerging space in population genomics and personalized medicine.
Hands on project experience analysing and reporting computational results to research project teams
Develop strong interpersonal and communication skills


Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Title: Content Generation Data Scientist Intern - 2024 Start
Description Snippet:
About the job
Responsibilities

 TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. 

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 
Join us.

About the team
The success of TikTok's data business model hinges on the supply of a large volume of high quality labeled data that will grow exponentially as our business scales up. However, the current cost of data labeling is excessively high. The Data Solutions team is built to understand data strategically at scale for all Global Business Solution (GBS) business needs. Data Solutions Team uses quantitative and qualitative data to guide and uncover insights, turning our findings into real products to power exponential growth. Data Solutions Team responsibility includes infrastructure construction, recognition capabilities management, global labeling delivery management.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us for this future position in 2024. As a graduate, you will get unparalleled opportunities for you to kickstart your career, pursue bold ideas and explore limitless growth opportunities. Co-create a future driven by your inspiration with TikTok.

Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

About the team
The success of TikTok's data business model hinges on the supply of a large volume of high quality labeled data that will grow exponentially as our business scales up. However, the current cost of data labeling is excessively high. The Data Solutions team is built to understand data strategically at scale for all Global Business Solution (GBS) business needs. Data Solutions Team uses quantitative and qualitative data to guide and uncover insights, turning our findings into real products to power exponential growth. Data Solutions Team responsibility includes infrastructure construction, recognition capabilities management, global labeling delivery management.

Responsibilities 
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and align AI project goals with business objectives.
- Create clear and concise documentation for technical and non-technical stakeholders, outlining AI concepts and results. 
- Demonstrate development tasks and analysis results to Product Owner and other teams effectively.
- Able to break down sophisticated machine learning model knowledge to digestible information for non-technical audiences.
- Develop innovative solutions and define research requirements, technical choices while ensuring scalability, maintainability, and cost-effectiveness to solve project goals.
- Test and evaluate different AI models and algorithms to determine their effectiveness.
- Design and maintain AI pipelines, including data preprocessing, feature extraction, model training, and evaluation.
- Conduct research to stay updated on the latest generative AI, machine learning, and deep learning advancements and related technologies, and incorporate new ideas and techniques into the team's work. 

Qualifications

 - Education: Currently pursuing a bachelors or masters degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science or related. Also open to individuals with applicable experience pursuing different fields of study.
- Technical Skills: Ability to handle the tasks outlined above. Strong technical proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Java, C++
- Effective Presentation: Strong presentation skills suitable for both technical and non-technical audiences.
- Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying abreast of best practices and emerging technology solutions in the field.
- Relevant Experiences: Previous internships or personal projects related to machine learning, NLP, computer vision. Proven adaptability to evolving generative AI technology, including successful proof-of-concept (POC) development, is an additional bonus.
- Machine Learning Knowledge: Familiarity with frameworks (PyTorch) & recent advancements in the AI / ML space (e.g. Diffusion models, LLMs).

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at sg.campus.recruitment@tiktok.com.

Title: NGLs Analyst Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job

FGE's Singapore office is looking to recruit an NGLs Analyst Intern to join our team of NGLs consultants and industry specialists.




We are a team of experienced professionals with a wide range of international clients, mainly oil companies, financial institutions and producer governments. Consultancy services include the provision of regular research, interacting with clients and undertaking special studies and reports. This dynamism also allows the company to provide unrivalled organic growth opportunities to candidates with a proven ability to develop and expand the business. 




Analysing NGLs as part of the global team, the successful candidate needs to display strong interest in the oil and gas sector. He/she will work along side the NGLs team to analyse demand, supply and trade flows across various regions and drive improvement projects to current work processes. The successful and driven candidate will stand to benefit from this opportunity and gain invaluable exposure to the workings of the commodities market.

 

Responsibilities

Collecting data and information with regards to market fundamentals and pricing for Natural Gas Liquids.
Analysing macro and micro economic oil, gas, NGLs & LNG data.

Title: Engineering Analysis Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Us

Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We solve the problems others choose to ignore, with surprising new inventions that defy convention and simply work better. We‚Äôre driven by progress and thrive on the challenge of relentless improvement. We‚Äôre growing fast and our ambition is huge ‚Äì more categories, more locations and more people.

Our scale and rapid growth make Dyson rich in new opportunities. We value new ideas and diverse perspectives, so our people are trusted with real work and responsibility from the outset. You‚Äôll develop fast and have the chance to move into different business areas and regions. And you‚Äôll be part of a global network of like-minded people ‚Äì a community that supports and learns from each other.

Power Systems is a global function that designs and develops Dyson‚Äôs internal technologies that enable most of our products. The team has experts in wide range of areas (mechanical, electrical, software, project management) and is responsible of the development from early stages through to production.

Engineering Analysis team within Power Systems is responsible for the performance, simulation, analysis, and experimental verification of the technology project. The team consists of experts in fields of turbomachinery, thermodynamics, acoustics, vibrations, rotor dynamics, fluid dynamics, structural analysis, and data analysis. Utilizing the state-of-the-art advanced analysis methods to ensure the design is optimised and robust for maximum performance.

About The Role

We are looking for a Engineering Analysis Intern to work within our Engineering Analysis function inside Power Systems, to apply her/his skills and experience in Fluid Dynamics/Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) and/or Structural Dynamics/Finite Element Analysis (FEA) to deliver our next generation Dyson internally developed technologies and their product integration. He/she will also use analytical techniques to add insight into experimental results, driving early development concepts, supporting projects with appropriate technology readiness and advancement. In addition, the candidate will be expected to continually improve and develop new techniques and methodologies, to build the capability of Power Systems group and Dyson as a whole. Some of your tasks could include:


Generate innovative concepts for new technologies using analytical techniques including CFD/FEA and experiments.
Responsible for activities such as thermal management, aerodynamic/acoustic performance, structural robustness, rotor dynamics of the technology through design, development, and delivery.
Responsible to develop air paths and cooling options for mechanical, electrical and electronic components of the technology system to achieve robustness and high performance. 
Responsible for supporting implementation of design concepts from component design through to finished assembly. This would include analysis, product concepts, dimensional verification, and general demonstration of the use of core engineering disciplines.
Responsible for leading the development of design concepts through prototype hardware procurement, assembly, testing, data analysis, fault analysis, problem solving, and design refinement. This may require some direction of technical support personnel.
Considers and seeks out the impact of his/her actions within the team. Actively seeks collaboration with internal and external team members
Ability and engagement in transferring experience and training to design engineers and junior specialists ‚Äì best-practices establishing and sharing.
Performs other duties as requested, directed, or assigned. Deliver product focused technology projects to the Dyson range plan.



About You

Our internship roles are competitive and delivering the next generation of Dyson technology is tough, so you will need to be:


Working towards or have achieved a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Mechanical or Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent (other relevant engineering disciplines will be considered)
Fundamental knowledge in one or more of the areas: structural dynamics, thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, strength of materials, vibro- or aero- acoustics
Demonstrated ability to investigate, model and provide critical insights into complex physical phenomena such as aerodynamic performance, noise, vibration, vibro-acoustics, aero-acoustics, or thermal management.
Ability to perform thermodynamic heat transfer calculations and proficient in the theory of thermodynamics, aerodynamics, and fluid dynamics.
Experience in using simulation analysis software such as ANSYS, Nastran, Abaqus would be advantageous
Good understanding of experimental techniques, particularly about pressure, temperature, strain, and flow measurement.
Interest in understanding of rotating machinery design.
The proven ability to work as part of a team or un-supervised to an agreed goal or set
of deliverables is imperative.
A clear logical thinker with exceptional attention to detail.
A proven structured approach to creative problem solving.
Ability to communicate appropriate, concise, and accurate information in written and verbal format.



For your application to be considered, please upload 1) your detailed resume and 2) transcript (all semesters inclusive) in a single file together with your online application.

Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don‚Äôt think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

This involves a fusion of machine learning models, Spark jobs executed on Hadoop clusters, and a user-friendly back-office UI component accessible to our internal business users. Our systems span multiple data centers and operate across hundreds of machines. Our primary challenges revolve around accommodating the continuous expansion of features and business needs while meeting the SLA and scale demands of the systems.

In This Role, You‚Äôll Get to


Collaborate with seasoned engineers and product owners to identify business opportunities, design and develop new data systems from inception to deployment
Engage with the diverse tools and components of the Agoda Data Platform
Enhance the scalability, stability, and speed of existing applications
Diagnose and rectify production issues
Work closely with other teams to foster collaboration
Explore and share insights into new technologies across the organization


What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed


Passion for data and problem-solving on a large scale
Basic proficiency in at least one of the following languages: Scala, Java, Python, or any functional/OO languages. Our primary coding language is Scala
‚ÄúCan do‚Äù attitude
Eagerness to learn something new every day


It‚Äôs Great If You Have


Any prior experience
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop)
SQL knowledge

Title: Intern, Robotics research engineer
Description Snippet:
About the job

Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group's interests in Southeast Asia where it is present in all ASEAN member countries. Business operations in these countries report to Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd, located in Singapore. Bosch has been present in Southeast Asia since 1919, with diversified businesses in the company's four business sectors - Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. Bosch's strategic objective is to improve quality of life with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is ‚ÄúInvented for life.‚Äù



At Bosch, we care. For you, our business, and our environment.



Let‚Äôs turn visions into reality. At Bosch,we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people‚Äôs lives. Our areas of activity are every bit as diverse as our outstanding Bosch teams around the world. Their creativity is the key to innovation through connected living, mobility or industry. Our responsibility goes far beyond business. We‚Äôre independent of stock markets and bound to the purpose of the Robert Bosch Foundation; our success directly benefits society, the environment, and future generations. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference.



Let‚Äôs be remarkable.



Job Description



As a robotics research engineer, the candidate will work on developing a new testbed towards automation autonomous disassembly process in e-waste management. The candidate will assist in:

Development of the testbed to integrate sensors, robots, conveyor belts, workbench, controllers, etc.
Programing and integrating industrial robots to perform tasks such as pick-n-drop and execution of disassembly action.
Development and maintenance of prototype applications based on controllers such as Raspberry Pi and Arduino
Improving trajectory planning algorithms to ensure high throughput of operations such as pick-n-drop
Developing automated robot trajectory planning for robotic 3D scanning and disassembly, and automated generation and execution of disassembly actions.
Closely communicate with other teams and presentation slides


Qualifications


Able to work full time for a period of 6 months (April 2024 onwards)
Undergraduate/graduate studies in related field of robot engineering
Major in robotics from Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering or Electrical engineering and Computer Science
Experience with ROS platform and Machine vision
Advanced knowledge in embedded programming, python, machine learning.
Independent learning and self-motivated


Additional Information


Candidate should fulfil the visa requirements for employment in Singapore
http://www.mom.gov.sg/passes-and-permits/work-pass-exemption-for-foreign-students
Applicant must be enrolled throughout internship period, or plan to pursue further studies

Title: Poly Internship Sep 2024 to Feb 2025 - Automated Procurement Market Intelligence
Description Snippet:
About the job
Synapxe is the national HealthTech agency inspiring tomorrow‚Äôs health. The nexus of HealthTech, we connect people and systems to power a healthier Singapore. Together with partners, we create intelligent technological solutions to improve the health of millions of people every day, everywhere.

Are you someone who enjoys problem solving, has a creative and curious mind, and strives to create a better and healthier tomorrow? If you say yes to all, do check out our website and find out more about Internship@Synapxe .

Join Synapxe as an intern and see how you can contribute in powering a healthier Singapore. We aim to deliver the best experience for all interns, to create exponential growth and paving your future in the tech industry.

The intern will co-design, build, and implement a solution or tool to allow Synapxe Procurement to perform automated market intelligence.

During the internship, responsibilties will include but not limited to:


Research, design and propose a solution to provide Synapxe Procurement department staff means to perform Procurement Market Intelligence work in a more automated manner.
Perform business analysis understand and map out the as-is process and effort involved in current way of performing Market Intelligence, and compare with the to-be solution in order to present the estimated ‚Äúreturn of investment‚Äù (ROI) in investing resources and effort moving the proposed solution into implementation phase (which might require man effort from other departments)
Collaborate with other Synapxe departments (such as Corporate IT, Data & Analytics departments), leverage their expertise to achieve the scope of this project
Suggest technical solution ‚Äì web scrapping (for price or industry news of interest) ‚Äì i.e. to build database so that Procurement team can be notified (automated via pre-defined rules) or is well-informed of the best price or news in the market
An example of today‚Äôs use cases of web scrapping technology is: purchase of airplane tickets, web scrapping techniques is widely adopted by online 3rd party travel platforms for scrap through the web and find the best provider that offer you the flight at the lowest price
An example of an actual use case that will benefit Synapxe Procurement: for professional services where vendor charges Synapxe man-hour fees, usually the average wage is published on different government websites. Via web scrapping technique and the build up of the scrapped dataset into our database, Synapxe procurement will have easy access to such ‚Äúmarket intelligences‚Äù



Skills Developed Through This Internship


Analytical skills ‚Äì develop these skills through analyzing complex data, identify patterns and trends
Problem solving ‚Äì improve problem solving skills through working with multiple departments and stakeholders in a corporate setting
Influencing & negotiating skill (intern will need support from other teams/ departments to execute his solution, hence influencing and negotiation skills is essential)
Hands on experience (candidate will pick up, further improve, and make use of his/her technical skills on the job)
Planning and project management skills (in end-to-end project manage so to achieve the expected outcome)
Collaborative skills (working in a 40-50 pax procurement department, as well as with other departments across Synapxe , an approx. 4000 people organisation)



About You


Be pursuing a Diploma in Big Data and Analytics, Business Information Systems or related discipline
Graduating in May 2025
Background in data science programming and web scrapping experience is preferred ‚Äì with understanding of web scrapping framework and its associated tools.
Candidate with strong programing skills (eg Python, SQL, Java etc) is encouraged to apply and expected to learn the necessary web scrapping language during the internship duration.
Knowledge in data storage relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL and Oracle etc
Good understanding and has keen interest to expand his/ her knowledge in area of general artificial intelligence technology, machine learning, data mining, statistical analysis etc
Good to have data visualization tool experience (such as Tableau) and familiar with excel, including Power Query
Effective communicator and team player
Passionate and keen to make a difference to re-imagine the future of HealthTech

Together We deployed the first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.

IP Networks,
Storage (NAS, SAN,‚Ä¶)

Title: Internship - Silicon Validation and Automation
Description Snippet:
About the job
The intern, as part of the Mixed Signal Verification team and under the guidance of an assigned mentor, will validate physical IC's to confirm proper functionality and performance across multiple conditions. The IC's are implementing mixed-signal blocks (e.g. on-chip temperature sensing, oscillators, voltage sensing, ...) in various technologies, and require dedicated & advanced equipment using state-of-the-art measurements methods. To support efficient validation, the project will involve development of automation mixing both hardware and software, requiring innovative thinking and the ability to convert ideas to implementation. In your new role you will:


Understand the device functionality and target performance 
Understand the device validation setup (hardware, software, automation) 
Review the validation plan 
Establish validation setup 
Execute lab measurements 
Generate validation reports & summary 
Contribute to lab automation and improvements (h/w, s/w)


Internship learning outcomes:

Technical


Demonstrate the ability to understand project requirements & IC performance 
Demonstrate the ability to setup and conduct validation on actual silicon 
Get acquainted with validation methods (incl. automation) and equipment 
Understand on-chip mixed signal blocks functionality and performance 
Expand knowledge of scripting and automation 


Non-Technical


Understanding of semiconductor R&D processes 
Exposure to industry practices and processes 
Exposure to team work and collaboration in a semiconductor R&D environment


You are best equipped for this task if you are/have:


On track to attain Bachelor in Electrical & Electronic 
Familiar with computer programming language such as C# or Python 
Methodic & organized 
A team player, curious and willing to learn
Language: English required for communication
Understanding of analogue circuits is an advantage
Exposure to IC measurement and electrical lab equipment usage is an advantage


Driving decarbonization and digitalization. Together.

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

Title: Life Actuarial Intern, APAC
Description Snippet:
About the job

This internship will give you the opportunity to be involved in various areas in reinsurance valuation and internal projects

SCOR, the 4th largest reinsurer in the world, provides insurance companies with a diversified and innovative range of solutions and services to control and manage risk. Leveraging experience and expertise to deliver "The Art & Science of Risk", SCOR provides cutting-edge financial solutions, analytics tools and services in all areas related to risk - from Life & Health and Property & Casualty insurance to Investments. Our specialized teams operate in over 160 countries, fostering long-term relationships with clients. 
 
In order to provide our clients with a broad range of innovative reinsurance solutions, SCOR pursues an underwriting policy that is founded on profitability and supported by effective risk management strategy and a prudent investment policy. This approach allows us to offer clients an optimum level of security, to create value for shareholders, and to contribute to the welfare and resilience of society by helping to protect insureds against the risks they face.
 
At SCOR, we believe that employing people from different backgrounds and ensuring inclusivity is a major driving force for the success of the Group. We are committed to fostering a work environment in which all employees are treated fairly and respectfully, have equal access to opportunities and resources, and can contribute fully to SCOR's success.

Our internship program is designed to provide students with exposure into our reinsurance business, and to develop skills to promote personal and professional development. This internship in the Actuarial Department will give you the opportunity to be involved in various areas in reinsurance valuation and internal projects. 
*In this exciting and fast-paced role, you will be working across APAC (including China, North Asia, South Asia & ANZ) writing business in c.30 countries and 13 legal entities in the region 
*Supporting the APAC Actuarial team in the management of all divisional reserving activities for Life business 
*With a focus on IFRS17, Solvency II, local statutory/solvency reporting, and experience analysis

 

Key duties and responsibilities

*Support in the continuous improvement of actuarial reporting processes, analyses and controls across the macromarkets

*Assist in the preparation of assigned reports

*Any other ad-hoc project

Experience:

Skills and Personal Competences:

- Experience in programming is a plus

Title: Intern - Manufacturing Operations
Description Snippet:
About the job
Education required: Bachelor in Engineering, Biomedical Sciences, Chemical & Biomolecular Engineering and Pharmaceutical Engineering

Other requirements:  Must be enrolled at a University for the duration of your Internship

Language requirement: Written and spoken fluency in English

Expected Start Date: May/June 2024

Application deadline:  31 Jan 2024

We will close this vacancy when we have enough applications, so please apply as soon as you can so your application can be considered

Looking to gain valuable real world work experience and help positively impact the health of billions of people? 

A GSK internship offers you the opportunity to kickstart your career ‚Äì to take on a real role with genuine impact! You‚Äôll take on challenging, serious work on live projects or assignments. You‚Äôll also get to learn from us, develop your skills and gain valuable experience for wherever the future takes you.

With an investment of S$510 million, our state-of-the-art vaccines manufacturing facility at Tuas was opened in June 2009 by Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, coinciding with our 50th anniversary in Singapore. Comprising two production buildings, an administration block, quality control laboratories, utility plant and warehousing, the facility became operational in 2011. The facility and operations meet the high quality and good manufacturing standards of global regulatory bodies such as the European Medicines Agency and the United States Food and Drug Administration.

Tuas is a key manufacturing site within our network supplying the active ingredient used to make our pneumococcal conjugate vaccine. This paediatric vaccine is indicated for the active immunisation against pneumonia, invasive diseases and acute otitis media caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae in infants and children.

Tuas site also focuses on manufacturing Hib (Haemophilus influenzae type b) antigen which is used in the manufacture of several paediatric vaccines. Hib is a bacterium responsible for invasive diseases, such as severe pneumonia and meningitis, contracted almost exclusively by children less than five years old.

These two vaccine products manufactured at Tuas cover a number of diseases causing paediatric mortality in the world, making a significant contribution to our global health agenda. The site continues to invest in developing technical capability and process improvement, and embracing new technology such as digital, data and analytics to position itself as a centre of excellence for the manufacture of vaccines.

Why Us?

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose ‚Äì to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together ‚Äì so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns ‚Äì as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030.

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it‚Äôs also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves ‚Äì feeling welcome, valued and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

Description Snippet:
About the job
What The Role Is

About CPF Board

The Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. As the trustee of the nation‚Äôs retirement savings, we serve CPF members knowing that we make a difference. At CPF Board, we believe in developing individuals who are inspired to do their life‚Äôs best work, through 3Ps: Purposeful Work, Professional Growth, People & Culture.


 Purposeful Work ‚Äì We're not just your typical pension fund; we're a national social security organization, and we take pride in the difference we make.
 Professional Growth ‚Äì Embark on a journey of learning and skill development. Even though you're starting with one organization, you're opening doors to a myriad of career opportunities down the road.
 People and Culture ‚Äì Be part of a mission-oriented organisation with a strong culture of teamwork, collaboration, and innovation. We treasure our people as our most valuable asset, promoting a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusivity. We believe in ensuring that everyone's voice is not just heard but celebrated.



Apply for our internship programme and be a part of #TeamCPF today, to make a difference in the lives of others and in the future of Singapore.

About The Team

What you will be working on

Data Science Accelerator (DSA) Department

Our Policy, Statistics and Research (PSR) Group plays a vital role in influencing CPF policies and operations; DSA is a department within PSR Group. Data informs many of the decisions we make in CPFB; and to perform our roles well, CPFB has embarked on a journey to become Data-Smart. In support of that, you will be part of a team that builds data science capabilities for all levels in the organization and champions data visualisations to help CPFB extract value from data for effective business decisions and policymaking.

What you will be working on

As an intern with DSA‚Äôs capability development team, your responsibilities will include:


 Capability Building - Assist in the running of in-house training courses for Power BI, PySpark and SQL coding. This builds up capabilities in CPFB to leverage the data analytics tools found in our cloud-based platform.
 Champion Data Visualisation Projects ‚Äì Work with stakeholders on data visualization projects. This includes the migration of Tableau dashboards onto the Power BI platform (our enterprise visualisation tool). You should value add by suggesting improvements to the data manipulation process, the data model and the design of dashboards/ visualisations.
 Assist in Data Science and AI (DSAI) Projects ‚Äì Have the opportunity to work on and assist data scientists / analysts on DSAI projects such as machine learning and generative AI. Candidates with suitable knowledge will also have the opportunity to experience aspects of data engineering within CPFB‚Äôs cloud-based data platform.
 Knowledge Management, User Experience - As part of the capability building and Data-Smart strategic planning office, you will also be tasked with the maintenance and enhancement of the team's website to ensure currency and improve usability.



What We Are Looking For

What you can expect

During Your Internship With CPF Board, You Can Expect


 Learning Opportunities: Gain valuable hands-on experience across the data life cycle, from engagement of business users, data preparation, data modelling to dashboard/ report development.
 Mentorship: Receive guidance and mentorship from data analysts.
 Exposure: You will be exposed to the inner workings of the public service sector and understand the role of data and how it supports decision-making in a government agency.



What we are looking for

We Are Seeking Candidates Who Meet The Following Criteria


 Available Full-time (5 days/week) from May to Dec 2024
 Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science or a related field.
 Preferably familiar with Python, SQL, HTML and Power BI.
 Collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively within a team.
 Willingness to adapt and learn in a fast-paced environment.
 Proactive and self-motivated with a desire to take on new challenges.

Title: Intern, Optimizing Disassembly for Circular Economy
Description Snippet:
About the job

Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group's interests in Southeast Asia where it is present in all ASEAN member countries. Business operations in these countries report to Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd, located in Singapore. Bosch has been present in Southeast Asia since 1919, with diversified businesses in the company's four business sectors - Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. Bosch's strategic objective is to improve quality of life with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is ‚ÄúInvented for life.‚Äù



At Bosch, we care. For you, our business, and our environment.



Let‚Äôs turn visions into reality. At Bosch,we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people‚Äôs lives. Our areas of activity are every bit as diverse as our outstanding Bosch teams around the world. Their creativity is the key to innovation through connected living, mobility or industry. Our responsibility goes far beyond business. We‚Äôre independent of stock markets and bound to the purpose of the Robert Bosch Foundation; our success directly benefits society, the environment, and future generations. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference.



Let‚Äôs be remarkable.



Job Description



The candidate will join a research team to work on developing an in-house python-based tool for optimizing disassembly of products at end-of-life, working towards enabling a circular economy.



The candidate will have the following tasks and responsibilities:

Able to work full time for a period of 6 months (Starting period from May-July).
Understanding current approaches to product disassembly and the developed optimization approach (using python).
Develop and extend existing optimization approach and disassembly framework for different use cases.
Test existing optimization framework on different products at Bosch.
Develop GUI of software tool in accordance with UX/UI principles at Bosch.
Research and understand environmental impact indicators based on existing methodology to evaluate environmental impact of disassembly processes.
Use python-based approaches to calculate environmental impact of disassembly processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate the software into existing processes.
Document the development process, methodologies, and key findings.
Generate regular reports and presentations to update stakeholders on progress and outcomes.


Qualifications


Enrolled in a relevant undergraduate or graduate program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering (w programming background), or a related field. Students from other fields are welcome to apply if they believe they are a good fit as well.
High proficiency in programming language Python.
Experience with programming GUIs in PyQt5/PyQt6 and experience with UX/UI methodology.
Understanding of mixed-integer linear programming (MILP), preferable experience with pyomo package.
Understanding and application of AI and ML based methods for optimization.
Experience with Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) and Brightway is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Effective communication and collaboration skills in a team environment.
Eager, quick learner with a strong teamwork spirit.





Additional Information


Candidate should fulfil the visa requirements for employment in Singapore
http://www.mom.gov.sg/passes-and-permits/work-pass-exemption-for-foreign-students
Applicant must be enrolled in full-time studies throughout internship period, or plan to pursue further studies.
Candidate should be available for full time work for 6 months
For foreign students studying overseas, you must be eligible for the Work Holiday Programme (WHP)
http://www.mom.gov.sg/passes-and-permits/work-holiday-programme/eligibility

Title: Business Operations Intern (Jun - Dec 2024)
Description Snippet:
About the job

The Team You‚Äôll Be Joining

We‚Äôre a Singapore-based clean energy startup, seed funded by ENGIE, one of the world‚Äôs largest renewable energy companies. We make rooftop solar more accessible and hassle-free for residential and commercial property owners by providing zero upfront cost rooftop solar-as-a-service. Join us in our mission to make it as simple as possible for all property owners to get solar - from Singapore and beyond! Find out more at https://getsolar.ai 




The Opportunity

This is a unique opportunity for you to own and handle key operational and planning tasks associated with the sales process of our solar projects, and develop yourself within a VC-backed startup.




As a Business Operations Intern, you will be working closely with our COO and members of the Operations and Customer Success team, and will be instrumental in seeing our solar projects to completion and helping to grow the business. You will also be a part of a small but collaborative community in ENGIE Factory, passionate about using technology and innovation to solve climate change.




We don‚Äôt see our interns any differently from one of us. If you‚Äôre up for it, lead teams, craft strategies or drive new initiatives ‚Äì the sky‚Äôs the limit.




What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For

Actively help to manage all aspects of the solar installation process and own our internal project tracker to ensure an optimal experience for our customers
Take ownership of our residential client‚Äôs experience from site visits through to a successful installation, including managing all enquiries and requests for assistance from customers
Help liaise with solar contractors on project management to ensure smooth project implementation and construction
Proactively assist in document management to ensure our internal records are always up-to-date and properly maintained
Creatively identify and evaluate new opportunities for process optimisation and improving customer experience




What You‚Äôll Gain from the Internship

Learn how to build a business from zero-to-one
Learn to use and effectively work with sales and operations tools like our proprietary CRM, Trengo, Notion, Slack
Effective project management and customer management skills
Learn to work with various internal and external stakeholders including partners and financiers in order to execute deals
Gain insights into the regional renewables market and digital technologies
Receive mentorship from seasoned startup founders and professionals




Who We‚Äôre Looking For

Penultimate undergraduate student graduating in 2024/25. Recent graduates are also welcome to apply
Prior internship experience is preferred, ideally in business development, operations, or other related functions
Very strong attention to detail, meticulous and organised with managing information
A proactive self-starter with a high level of initiative 
Excellent communication, organisational and follow-up skills
Entrepreneurial spirit, proactive, and willing to get your hands dirty
Ability to solve problems creatively, manage projects and multiple tasks effectively, and constantly on the lookout for ways to do things better
Thrives in a rapidly growing and radically changing environment and wants to help us turn GetSolar into the next VC-backed unicorn
Interested in sustainability and renewable energy




Contract Type and Location

You must be able to commit for a minimum of 16 weeks, up to a maximum of 9 months. The role will be based in Singapore with a flexible start date.

Description Snippet:
About the job
In Your Career, Let‚Äôs Prove What‚Äôs Possible.

At Lam Research, we create equipment that drives technological advancements in the semiconductor industry. Our innovative solutions enable chipmakers to power progress in nearly all aspects of modern life, and it takes each member of our team to make it possible.

 Engineering Intern 1 

Date: Feb 29, 2024

Location:

Singapore, SG-Singapore, SG

Req ID: 181727

Worker Category: On-site

Job Responsibilities

We are looking for an internship candidate who wishes to enhance his / her skills in  Machine Learning (ML) / Deep Learning (DL) Models  with the focus in  Image Processing / Computer Vision (CV)  . With Model and Data evolving almost every day, it is critical to setup and follow a rigorous Data engineering (MLOPs) infrastructure to keep track of the generated models, their backward compatibilities, code, and data versioning. Also implement modules for validation, testing and identify data leakage. The successful candidate will work with Lam‚Äôs Data Scientists to develop next gen Data Engineering (MLOPs) for Lam‚Äôs proprietary ML / DL Models. Specifically, the intern will be involved in the design and development of MLOPs and data engineering pipelines for Lam‚Äôs powerful image segmentation DL models (with the above-mentioned features). The candidate will have hands-on experience in both open-source and Lam‚Äôs CV tools and libraries, and will work closely with Lam‚Äôs expert Data Science team in Singapore.

Other Job Responsibilities

Minimum Qualifications


 Post-Graduates (Final Year Students - Master / PhD Program) with strong passion and understanding of Deep Learning (DL), Machine Learning (ML), and Computer Vision (CV) 


Preferred Qualifications


 Good understanding in machine learning, deep learning, image processing / computer vision. 
 Strong proficiency in Python programming and debugging, Model deployment and versioning, MLOPs and associated libraries like OpenCV, PyTorch, PyQt, GUI, NumPy, etc. 
 Previous relevant works in MLOPs, Model Versioning and Deployment, or related fields. 
 Self-driven personality with the team-work mindset and self-reliant working style. 


Our Commitment

We believe it is important for every person to feel valued, included, and empowered to achieve their full potential. By bringing unique individuals and viewpoints together, we achieve extraordinary results.

Title: Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Location: Singapore, Singapore

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.

Position Summary:

At Thales Research and Technology (TRT), we extend the influence of Thales within the scientific and technical communities, offering a platform for innovation and knowledge sharing, and attracting talented science graduates to build on our acquired expertise. The ideal candidate joining the team will participate in the development of relevant multiphysics model for material applications (e.g. Acoustic, Piezoelectric etc). In the course of your work, you will learn, understand and appreciate the processes involved in engineering design.

Main Tasks & Responsibilities:


Picking up COMSOL modelling for acoustic, heat transfer and electric module.
Learn the mechanism of operation for the application and identify the physics required for model implementation
Design and develop working multiphysics models using COMSOL Multiphysics.
Develop the process required to implement 3rd party automation tools such as modeFRONTIER or using MATLAB / Python scripts to automate parametric studies in COMSOL.



Requirements: 


Keen interest in data analysis and multiphysics simulation modelling
Experience of CAD and building physics models welcomed
Skills in scripting/programming (MATLAB, Python)
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Proactive in providing assistance to team members



Learning Outcomes:

At the end of your internship, you will have:


Multiphysics modelling using COMSOL Multiphysics
Automation scripts using MATLAB / Python
Data analysis, validation with experimental results and evaluation report relating to the models generated.
Experienced the dynamic working environment in a research centric department



At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

This will be done using machine learning engineering and tools available as a part of the SAP product portfolio.  Assist with technology exploration for new AI and technology trends in-line with SAP‚Äôs overall Strategy direction

Required

Optional

We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. Title: Algorithm Engineer Intern (TikTok Recommendation Dedup) - 2024 Start
Description Snippet:
About the job
Responsibilities

 TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. 

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 
Join us.

About the Team
TikTok RecCore Dedup team conducts research and introduces cutting-edge AI technologies to our products. In order to provide the best user experience, we build large-scale systems and support various production strategies including video deduplication, originality recognition, copyright detection, content safety, and content moderation.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2024. Internships at TikTok aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok. 

Successful candidates must be able to commit to the following internship cycle
below: -
1. Summer Internship - 06 May 2024 to 26 July 2024 (12 weeks)
2. Off cycle / Credit bearing internship happening within 2024

We will prioritize candidates who are able to commit in either internship period. Please state your availability clearly in your resume (Start date, End date).

Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

Responsibilities
- Build the Dedup and Copyright system, supports billions of users all over the world
- Based on the product requirements, develop models and systems to detect duplicated and similar materials among billions of videos
- Introduce new AI technologies to our online system and improve the performance
- Improve the reliability of the system, manage the challenges of scale and complexity
- Support the production of scalable and optimised AI/machine learning (ML) models
- Focus on building algorithms for the extraction, transformation and loading of large volumes of realtime, unstructured data to deploy AI/ML solutions from theoretical data science models
- Run experiments to test the performance of deployed models, and identifies and resolves bugs that arise in the process
- Work in a team setting and apply knowledge in statistics, scripting and programming languages required by the firm
- Work with the relevant software platforms in which the models are deployed 

Qualifications

 - Bachelor or higher degrees in computer science or related discipline;
- Min 1 year of experience in Machine Learning, familiar with at least one DeepLearning framework, e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow.
- Experienced in Multimedia or Computer Vision, e.g. Image/Video/Audio retrieval, Representation Learning, Re-Identification, Unsupervised/Self-supervised learning.
- Experience or knowledge of recent advances of LLMs, VLMs etc. 

Preferred Qualifications
- Authors of published papers in top academic conferences;
- Winners of algorithm and machine learning competitions such as ACM and Kaggle.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at apac-earlycareers@tiktok.com.

Title: The Straits Times Specialist Internship ‚Äì Interactive Graphics (4 to 6 months)
Description Snippet:
About the job

At SPH Media, our mission is to be the trusted source of news on Singapore and Asia, to represent the communities that make up Singapore, and to connect them to the world.

We aim to bring out the best in our people and give them a platform to shine and make an impact. We support our people's career ambitions.

Data Visualisation Developer

developing and designing data visualisations;
finding and analysing data to support or drive a story;
storyboarding and collaborating with other team members and newsroom colleagues;
learning and documenting our development processes and have experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Svelte, React, d3.js and WebGL experience is an advantage;
experimenting with new and emerging technologies like augmented reality, AI and beyond




We will evaluate your application based on your portfolio (published and unpublished works) and your passion for news and visual storytelling.




The role will require a commitment period of 4 to 6 months. Interested applications can submit their application directly to internships@sph.com.sg .

Title: Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
About TEAM LEWIS

We are a global marketing agency that has gone from start-up to multi-national in little over two decades. Our success is due to a combination of factors. Talented people delivering award winning campaigns. Expanding client relationships into new markets or services. Making strategic acquisitions. TEAM LEWIS has won many prestigious awards, including Cannes Lions, PRovoke Media, ICCO, European Excellence, PRCA Digital, Digital Impact, Global Digital Excellence.

At the heart of the business is the TEAM LEWIS Foundation (TLF). A non-profit charitable entity, funded by TEAM LEWIS, the TLF makes grants to support individuals undertaking charitable activities and charitable organisations in achieving their goals. The TLF plays a constructive role in promoting social, cultural, economic and environmental innovation that benefits society. It aims to strengthen the bonds between the communications industry, businesses, governments and non-profits. In 2022, the TLF granted $700,000 to local causes alone. Community charities are championed by TEAM LEWIS‚Äô employees, who volunteer their time and skills to provide marketing and comms support to maximise the grants‚Äô effectiveness.

Purpose of the Role

The Intern provides administrative support to the wider Account Servicing team. The role requires the ability to handle a number of tasks and projects at any one time. The Intern will develop a clear understanding of the team‚Äôs requirements and objectives, be proactive in attitude and supportive to the team at all times.

Key Responsibilities And Tasks

Client Management 


Supports the new business process by providing research and coordination 
Assists with the coordination of press tours, events and review programmes 


Media Relations 


Researches and identifies appropriate journalists, bloggers and analysts on an on-going basis 
Monitors relevant news sources and alerts the team to relevant breaking news opportunities 
Organises and coordinates media interviews and press briefings


Content


Drafts a broad range of written materials 
Creates press materials and compelling content for both traditional and digital media 
Simple social media management (Must be fairly familiar with Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn)


Reporting and analysis


Tracks and reports on media activity, including coverage reports, press clippings, online media engagement, showing progress using metrics 
Communicates account performance internally at account reviews 
Provides reports to the Campaign Director or senior management team on request


General


Supports the Account Servicing team on ad hoc initiatives and projects 
Takes a proactive role in promoting the TEAM LEWIS brand, its work, identity and values


Requirements


Inquisitive nature 
Calmness under pressure and ability to deliver to tight deadlines 
Excellent communication skills (written and spoken) 
Good English proficiency 
Attention to detail 
Professional and approachable telephone manner 
Flexible attitude
Interested in building a career in integrated marketing ‚Äì across PR, social, data, digital 
No experience needed


This will be a 3 or 6 month internship role, with a view of a permanent role at the end of internship depending on business and individual performance.

This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of the responsibilities for this role. Other responsibilities may be added from time to time.

TEAM LEWIS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating and fostering an environment focused on equality, empowerment and respect. We strive to create an inclusive workplace that supports and celebrates our diversity. We continue to invest in our efforts to ensure that TEAM LEWIS is a place where everyone can thrive.

TEAM LEWIS is a global marketing agency that has grown from start-up to multi-national in a little over two decades. Its success is due to a combination of factors: talented creatives delivering award winning campaigns; expanding client relationships into new markets or services and its independence from outside investors. The agency, its people and client campaigns have won many awards, including Cannes Lions, PRovoke Media, ICCO, European Excellence, PRCA Digital, Digital Impact, Global Digital Excellence.
