Title: Uni Internship May to Oct 2024 - Public Healthcare Cybersecurity Exercise 2024
Description Snippet:
About the job
Synapxe is the national HealthTech agency inspiring tomorrow‚Äôs health. The nexus of HealthTech, we connect people and systems to power a healthier Singapore. Together with partners, we create intelligent technological solutions to improve the health of millions of people every day, everywhere.

Are you someone who enjoys problem solving, has a creative and curious mind, and strives to create a better and healthier tomorrow? If you say yes to all, do check out our website and find out more about Internship@Synapxe .

Join Synapxe as an intern and see how you can contribute in powering a healthier Singapore. We aim to deliver the best experience for all interns, to create exponential growth and paving your future in the tech industry.

Public Healthcare entities are required to participate in cybersecurity exercises annually to exercise the (a) processes established in relevant plans including, but not limited to Cybersecurity Incident Response Plans (CIRP), Business Continuity Plans (BCP), Disaster Recovery Plans (DRP), etc; & (b) coordination and collaboration between interdependent entities; in order to ensure continuity of essential services in our Public Healthcare Institutions in the event of a cybersecurity incident.

Interns on this project will join our Project Management Team to plan, organise and coordinate the delivery of the cybersecurity exercise for 2024. In the process of managing this project, the intern will learn how theoretical knowledge of cybersecurity in an academic environment can be practically applied in Singapore‚Äôs Public Healthcare ecosystem.

This can be achieved when the interns interacts with various stakeholders identified in the relevant plans ‚Äì to discuss


Various scenarios that can lead to a cybersecurity incident;
Possible impacts and the resulting disruptions in each of these scenarios;
Expected responses to mitigate the risk arising from such scenarios;



In addition to the opportunity to observe an incident lifecycle from end to end, the interns will also gain hands-on experience in the process of scenario design, exercise delivery and post-exercise learning. This is akin to the process of game development where the goals(s) is/are established, challenges designed and issued to the players as well as identifying lessons learnt in order to facilitate better team performance should the need arises.

This project will help the interns put the various modules they‚Äôve learnt about cybersecurity in perspective holistically within 24 weeks. Interns with experience in as a participant or as part of the Exercise Planning/Control Team (EPCT) will be advantageous. Interns with wit and good knowledge of the Cyber Kill-Chain are welcome to apply too.

The Objectives For The Interns Are


To learn about the processes required in response to a cybersecurity incident
To learn about stakeholder engagement
To experience the steps required in the design and conduct of an exercise as well as the identification of lessons learnt



The interns will understudy and be guided by a mentor in the following tasks:


Facilitate stakeholder engagement during the scenario design, exercise delivery and post-exercise reporting phases
Organise, coordinate and facilitate workshops required for the design of scenarios, delivery of injects and identification of lessons learnt
Support the preparations, setup and disassembly of the exercise environment
Support the delivery of exercise injects
Facilitate the consolidation of lessons learnt



Skills Developed Through This Internship


Cybersecurity Incident Responses & Crisis Management
Scenario Design, Inject Delivery & Identification of Lessons Learnt
Management & Coordination of Organisational & System interdependencies
Stakeholder Management
Event planning & organising



About You


Be pursuing a Bachelor in Cyber/IT Security, Information Security, Information Systems, Business Analytics or related discipline
Graduating in May/Dec 2025 or May 2026
Possesses knowledge of Cyber Kill-Chain and the NIST Framework
Awareness of the Cyber Security Act 2018, Regulations and National Cyber Incident Response Framework (NCIRF)
Possess strong analytical skills & wit
Innovative, proactive and a multi-tasker with an inquisitive mind
Ability to multitask and work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team
Exhibit leadership qualities with good verbal and written communications skills
Passionate and keen to make a difference to re-imagine the future of HealthTech

Our team partners with Product Specialist & Engineering teams to resolve issues, fix bugs & ensure the VOC of the customer is fed back into the products we develop for our team. - Perform regular monitoring of key operational metrics, to provide on-time feedback relevant stakeholders of the outliers or actionable trend observed

- Conduct in-depth analysis on operational metrics (SLAs, Ticket Trend, capacity/utilization) to identify areas to increase efficiency, collaborating with stakeholders on improvement area
- Provide ad-hoc analytical support to MPO leaders on high-impact projects and initiatives, be able to deep dive into transcript to identify SOP gaps and improvement areas
- Safeguard internal dashboards and tools to ensure data sanctity and support teams data needs
- Support team engagement initiatives (All Hands, Offsites), plan/conduct events for teams globally 
- Maintain team documents to ensure relevance (e.g. data mapping, support schedules)
- Collaborate with operational leaders to ensure smooth project execution, drive stakeholder communication/alignment, govern project timeline and ownership 

Qualifications

 Minimum requirements:
 - Undergraduate or Postgraduate with strong business data analytical skillsets (e.g. Data/business analytics programs)
 - Advanced Excel, Google Studio skills;
 - Excellent English written (clear document writing, presentation making) and verbal communication skills;
 - Strong ownership & down to earth mentality, willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the necessary work done;
 - Ability to work cross-functionally with multiple teams and stakeholders with collaborative mindset

Preferred requirements:
 - Practical experience/skill of SQL, python with data analytics;
 - Prior internship experience with tech companies or operational functions

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Title: SAP AI Singapore Intern - Data Science Developer
Description Snippet:
About the job
We help the world run better

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

SAP is a global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. The group significantly contributes to SAP's product portfolio and extends its leading position in the market by identifying and shaping emerging IT trends and generating breakthrough technologies through AI.

SAP AI teams combine the creativity and agility of a start-up with the backbone of a world market leader in business software. The focus of the team is to embed and develop Machine Learning solutions into business enterprise solutions. In collaboration with leading universities, partners, customers, and SAP product groups, SAP drives the development of promising ideas and prototypes into market-ready software for maximum customer value.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS 

You will work as a student intern in fast-paced research projects and apply software engineering principles and concepts to help create new and innovative research prototypes. This internship gives you the unique opportunity to work on both research ‚Äì developing novel Machine Learning models, and production ‚Äì deploying said models for large-scale commercial use. Your work in this internship will directly impact the millions of people currently using SAP solutions. The duration of the internship is 3-6 months full-time.

You have excellent communication skills: oral, written, and in presentations 
You have hands-on experience in programming languages such as Java and Python

"At SAP, you can impact the way business is run."

#SAPLabsSG, #SAPBusinessAICareers

We build breakthroughs together

Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. Description Snippet:
About the job
680094BR

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems?  Data Science Intern

Location:

Singapore, SG-Singapore, SG

Req ID: 181728

Worker Category: On-site

Job Responsibilities

We are looking for an internship candidate who wishes to enhance his / her skills in Machine Learning (ML) / Deep Learning (DL) with the focus in Image Processing / Computer Vision (CV). In general, data labeling is the crucial part of segmentation model development pipeline and it is both cumbersome and time-consuming. To ease this burden, the successful candidate will focus on active learning, ML-based label quality scoring, assistive data labeling, and data management tool for image segmentation. Specifically, the intern will be involved in the design and development of iterative and assistive data labeling tool backed by Lam‚Äôs powerful image segmentation DL models. The candidate will have hands-on experience in both open-source and Lam‚Äôs CV tools and libraries, and will work closely with Lam‚Äôs expert Data Science team in Singapore.

Other Job Responsibilities

Minimum Qualifications


 Post-Graduates (Final Year Students - Master / PhD Program) with strong passion and understanding of Deep Learning (DL), Machine Learning (ML), and Computer Vision (CV) 


Preferred Qualifications


 Good understanding in machine learning, deep learning, image processing / computer vision. 
 Strong proficiency in Python programming and debugging, associated libraries like OpenCV, PyTorch, PyQt, GUI, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc. 
 Self-driven personality with the team-work mindset and self-reliant working style. 
 Previous relevant works in image segmentation, UNET, SAM, is a big plus.

We believe it is important for every person to feel valued, included, and empowered to achieve their full potential. By bringing unique individuals and viewpoints together, we achieve extraordinary results.

Title: Commercial Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Campari Group today is a major player in the global branded spirits industry, with a portfolio of over 50 premium and super premium brands, marketed and distributed in over 190 markets around the world, with leading positions in Europe and the Americas.

Headquartered in Milan, Italy, Campari Group owns 22 plants worldwide and has its own distribution network in 22 countries, and employs approximately 4,000 people.

Shares of the parent company Davide Campari - Milano N.V. are listed on the Italian Stock Exchange since 2001. Campari Group is today the sixth-largest player worldwide in the premium spirits industry.

Job Purpose:


The role supports the Regional Commercial Director of APAC region with insightful analysis to improve decision making process. In addition, the incumbent will support the consolidation of multiple data sources (both internal and external) and provide a single source of truth to internal stakeholders. 
Key deliverables will be the output from key projects that helps translate data into actionable insights with clear recommendations on actions to drive revenue and margin growth. 


Key Responsibilities: 


Perform descriptive, diagnostic and predictive analytics using multiple data sources. 
Specific focus areas include:
Pricing elasticity analytics for profit optimization, 
Correlation/ Cause & effect analytics to support business investment decisions. 
Part of the role would include consolidation of multiple data sources in the form of Power BI dashboard for democratized access within company. 


Requirements: 


Education
Undergraduate or graduate student from local universities such as NUS, NTU, SMU. 
Discipline of study: Decision Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science or related field. 
Language
English is mandatory, Knowledge of other Asian languages a plus but not a must. 
Experience & Skills
Strong analytical skills, excellent knowledge of excel, developing Power BI dashboards. Knowledge of programming skills like R or Python would be a plus. 
Prior experience in statistical modelling using linear and multiple regressions, elasticity modelling. 
Able to perform complex data analysis and translate them to actionable insights. And ability to articulate it to broader audience through data visualization. 
Able to communicate well and make good presentations using Powerpoint. 

Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

At Campari Group we believe in building more value together, thus we see diversity in all forms as a source of enrichment. Our employment policies and practices ensure that we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities in all aspects of employment without regard to any individual‚Äôs race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or characteristics or expression, political affiliation or activity, age, veteran status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Note to applicants:

Your application will be assessed based on your abilities, expertise, general knowledge and experience, not because of any confidential, proprietary or trade secret information you may possess. You must not disclose to Campari Group any such information. In the event that you are asked a question that cannot be answered without disclosure of any confidential, proprietary or trade secret information (including from a current or prior employer or their vendors or customers), you must decline to answer the question.

Notice to third party agencies:

Please refrain from cold-calling or emailing our executive leadership team or the HR community directly. The Talent Acquisition department manages centralized recruiting operations globally, including the selection and management of external suppliers. Currently, our preferred supplier list is at full capacity. To ensure we have your information on file for future consideration, we kindly request that you complete the online form provided here.

Title: Business Intern, Business Analytics
Description Snippet:
About the job
Who We Are

Build your best future with the Johnson Controls team

As a global leader in smart, healthy and sustainable buildings, our mission is to reimagine the performance of buildings to serve people, places and the planet. Join a winning team that enables you to build your best future! Our teams are uniquely positioned to support a multitude of industries across the globe. What‚Äôs more, we‚Äôre achieving it in a company that we‚Äôre in control of. In an environment that we‚Äôre co-creating. And a culture that‚Äôs uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn‚Äôt a question.

We are looking to provide a learning opportunity for an Intern who is interested to broaden their knowledge in demand planning, S&OP and supply chain processes in the local market. The Intern will work under the supervision of the Demand Planning and Customer Service Lead in Singapore and will be required to collaborate with other functions, mainly supply chain hub and commercial functions (Marketing/ Trade Marketing/ Sales).

Number of internship positions: 1

Key Responsibilities

Analyse sales trend vs forecast.

Review and update Excel files with latest information. 



Learning Outcomes

Throughout the course of the internship, you will attain the following learning outcomes:


Learn and understand the business mechanics, eg. Base business, promotions, new launches.
Learn how to view historical trends and translate to forecast.
Communicate with other functions in the right language.
Identify supply risk and learn the various methods to mitigate supply gaps.
Collaborate and work in a team. 



Why You?

We are seeking candidates with the following skills and competencies:


Educational background ‚Äì Business related disciplines.

Interest to support business activities from supply chain.

Proficient in use of IT and software/systems.

Deadline-driven, flexible with self-reliance to work in an empowered environment.
Demonstrated ability to take initiative, think and work independently, and problem-solve.
Strong drive for performance and attention to details.
Ability to think and plan long-term.

Title: Strategy Intern (T&P)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Who are The&Partnership?

We at The&Partnership bring ideas and technology together to power brands and businesses. As one of the world‚Äôs fastest-growing independent agency networks, we are increasingly known for developing bespoke new model agency solutions for clients across the globe.

We call this &Model and the premise is very simple. Agency Creative, Strategy, Media, PR and Data, all working side by side, solving problems as one collaborative team with the client.

A rapidly changing market requires a radical new approach to marketing. We work alongside our clients‚Äô marketing departments ‚Äì often with other agency partners ‚Äì in new, nimble ways to deliver highly creative, data-driven work quickly and efficiently.

Backed by the might of WPP and GroupM, we‚Äôve seen record growth over the past two years ‚Äì expanding across 17 new markets and doubling in size against a challenging industry backdrop.

Our ambition is to be the most important place in our people‚Äôs careers, and with a model that sees some teams embedded with clients, others ‚Äòbeside clients‚Äô or in one of our head offices, there are plenty of opportunities for variety and stretch.

Over the years, we‚Äôve learnt that these principles are what set us apart and keep us fresh:


It‚Äôs not who you are it‚Äôs what you bring
We is always stronger than ME
Don‚Äôt stay put, stay curious
Never stop asking, ‚Äòand?‚Äô


About The Role

In an industry not known for taking in planners/strategists at entry level, this is an opportunity to get hands-on experience with live work across the region.

What You‚Äôll Do


To assist in developing the brand and marketing communications on some of Singapore's largest brands, on a highly-integrated team that works on everything from advertising to digital experiences.
This involves undertaking consumer research and competitive analysis to derive well-informed strategic recommendations for our clients, and contributing to end-of-campaign reports and case studies.
Successful applicants will have opportunities to gain end-to-end exposure to being an ad agency planner, and (if timings fit) may even emerge with some ‚Äòlive‚Äô work to show for it.


What You‚Äôll Need


We don‚Äôt have an onerous list of prerequisite knowledge or academic qualifications (seriously, it‚Äôs an internship). But we do have some must-haves:
Hunger to learn about all things advertising and marketing
Curiosity about the macro (business) and the micro (human motivations)
Excellent writing and verbal ability
A problem-solving attitude that multidisciplinary teams will value

And Some Great-to-best


Able to conduct both desktop and some primary research
Analytical to dissect problems and creative to approach them in interesting ways
Available for a period of at least three months, preferably more


How We‚Äôll Support You

The&Partnership embraces and celebrates diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide creative agency that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more brilliant work we can create together.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.

Title: Software Engineer Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Location: Singapore, Singapore

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.

[Main] Collaborate with other NPI engineers to develop recurrent banking product configurations.
Conduct validation campaign on banking configurations.
[Secondary] Create (standalone or web) tools for internal usage.



Requirements


Bachelor of Science in Electrical and Electronic Engineering/Computer Science
Able to commit for 5-6 months
Programming skills in Java or Python.
Experience with microcontroller/ microprocessor (assembly language) is an edge.
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.



Learning Outcomes


Understand the full software development life cycle from planning, development, testing to integration.
Be mentored by experienced product & software engineers.



At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Title: Backend Engineer Intern (TikTok Recommendation) - 2024 Start
Description Snippet:
About the job
Responsibilities

 TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. 

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 
Join us.

The team is responsible for the engineering and stability of the entire TikTok recommendation services. The supported business is one of TikTok's most important (bringing the largest user increment) algorithm teams. Our goal is to build an easy to use recommendation infra with simple interface, stable performance and sustainable architecture to support first-class research and development of the algorithm team. We look forward to people who are smart and want to get things done to join us.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2024. Internships at TikTok aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok. 

Successful candidates must be able to commit to the following internship cycle
below: -
1. Summer Internship - 06 May 2024 to 26 July 2024 (12 weeks)
2. Off cycle / Credit bearing internship happening within 2024

We will prioritize candidates who are able to commit in either internship period. Please state your availability clearly in your resume (Start date, End date).

Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

Responsibilities
1. Responsible for the engineering work of TikTok's Recommendation System.
2. Model Efficiency: Optimize storage, computation (GPU, CPU), latency and stability of deep recommendation models.
3. Development Efficiency: Optimize online code performance and maintainability, optimize offline/ online storage and computing systems (Clickhouse/Hive/etc), accelerate algorithm iteration in heterogeneous data centers, and develop configurable compliance check tools.
4. Stability: Develop CI/CD systems, real-time/offline monitoring and alert systems. 

Qualifications

 - Undergraduate or Postgraduate currently pursuing a Degree/Master/PhD in Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline
- Proactive thinking, strong proactiveness
- Good understanding of data structures and solid programming skills (no specific language requirement)
- Bonus: ACM-ICPC experience
- Keen to become great engineers


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at apac-earlycareers@tiktok.com.

Title: Silicon Design / IC Design Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences ‚Äì the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world‚Äôs most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

LOCATION: Singapore

CRITERIA: Current students studying in Universities which are based in Singapore

INTERNSHIP DURATION: minimum 20 weeks full time commitment with the option of extending up to a further 12 weeks.

Intern - Silicon Design / IC Design

What You Can Expect To Learn


Gain industry experience working on the latest technology process nodes.
Join us and learn about how fulfilling a career in IC design can be!
As we have various disciplines within IC design, we would get to know you better through the application process and assign you to the most suitable team to best fit you!



Project Overview

Jump start your IC design journey by being part of a dynamic team covering many areas including but not limited to analog design and implementation, digital design and implementation, functional verification, post-silicon validation, and many more!

You will be part of the SerDes Technology team and get the opportunity to collaborate with our teams around the globe. Being alongside engineers across different disciplines means that you would get a better understanding of the differences between different disciplines so that you are able to make an informed decision on which path to pursue when you join us after your graduation.

Key Responsibilities


First few weeks
Get to know more about Singapore Design Team at AMD
Strengthen foundational technical IC design knowledge
Get comfortable working independently as well as in a team environment across multiple geographical sites.
Next few months
Develop soft skills such as communication and presentation by participating in technical discussions and conduct knowledge sharing sessions
Be able to appreciate the considerations when making engineering judgement decisions
Work on projects as part of specialization (see details in section below)
Throughout the internship
Participate in company/department events, social events, recreation events, etc

Who Are We Looking For


A self-driven individual with a willingness to learn, resourceful and passionate about technology. Willingness to learn with a good attitude. Willing to work hard and play hard!



Relevant Skillsets


Degree/Master/PhD in Electronics/Electrical/Computer Engineering/Computer Science
Scripting skills (eg. Perl, TCL, shell, Python) beneficial
Fast learner and ready to solve problems
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment



SPECIALIZATIONS: (would be attached to one of the following)


Analog design
Design and development of high speed analog and mix signal circuit and its auxiliary circuit block design (112Gbps and above) in advanced technology node (3nm, 7nm)
Use, simulate and analyze log and report generated from EDA tools and make design trade-off to get the required results within the scheduled milestones
Learn the architecture and design of SERDES block (Transmitter, receiver, pll etc)
Basic scripting and programming (Unix, Pytthon, Perl)
Familiarization with IC design tools (Cadence ADE/Spectre, Synopsys Hspice/XA, etc)
Learn and understand IC design flow to implement circuit design
Candidates will have the opportunity to explore cross function experience eg RTL/Layout/STA/Verification
Analog layout implementation
Layout implementation in high speed circuit and its auxiliary circuit block design (112Gbps and above) in advanced technology node (3nm, 7nm)
Perform various physical verification checks such as Layout-versus-Schematic (LVS) and Design Rule Check (DRC) to meet circuit function, performance, and process requirements
Understand basic Process Design Rules and differences in metal schemes.
Basic scripting and programming (Unix, Pytthon, Perl)
Familiarization with IC design tools (Cadence Virtuoso , Calibre, etc)
Learn and understand IC design flow to implement layout design
Candidates will have the opportunity to explore cross function experience eg RTL/Circuit /PnR/STA/Verification
Analog static timing analysis
Developing timing models for advanced technology nodes mixed signal circuits and complex standard cells. 
To enable a good static timing analysis run, work with various stakeholders (design, layout and integration team) to build constraints, tune design hierarchy level, review timing report to have a timing model generated.
To ensure quality of models generated, developing and updating quality check scripts. 
Release and maintenance of the timing model databases. 
Evaluate best in class EDA tools and flow in the industry.
Digital design
Roles
Digital Design
Low Power design explorations 
Design digital logic blocks in Verilog (RTL)
Develop testbench and functional verification of developed digital logic blocks.
Silicon validation
Develop Emulation platform using Python and CocoTB (https://www.cocotb.org/ )
Post silicon validation, testing and debug of block functionality on prototype silicon.
Next generation RTL/AI tool
Explore new approaches to improve RTL quality and productivity.
Explore AI/ML to improve RTL methodology.
Preferred skills
Good fundamental of digital logic design is preferred.
Experience in Verilog and/or VHDL is preferred.
Good programming/scripting skills (Python, OOP concepts, Perl, etc) is preferred.
Digital IP development (AI/ML & network security)
Overview
We are seeking a highly motivated and technically proficient Network Security Intern with a focus on Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) and Field-Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs). The successful candidate will work closely with our team to develop and implement cutting-edge FPGA intellectual properties that leverage AI/ML techniques to enhance the network security.
Roles
AI/ML Integration:
Collaborate with the network security team to identify opportunities for integrating AI/ML algorithms into existing security protocols.
Implement, test, and optimize machine learning models for threat detection and anomaly identification.
FPGA Development:
Design, develop, and optimize FPGA-based solutions to accelerate key network security functions.
Implement hardware-accelerated algorithms to enhance the performance and efficiency of security measures.
Network Security Enhancement:
Investigate and address security vulnerabilities through the implementation of advanced technologies, including AI/ML and FPGA-based solutions.
Research and Innovation:
Stay abreast of the latest developments in AI/ML, FPGA technology, and network security.
Conduct research to identify emerging threats and propose innovative solutions to strengthen network security.
Preferred skills
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, C/C++, or Verilog.
Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and FPGA development tools.
Understanding of network security principles, protocols, and common attack vectors.
Solid understanding of hardware/software co-design and optimization.
Experience with FPGA development boards and toolchains.
Knowledge of hardware-accelerated computing and parallel processing.
Familiarity with cybersecurity best practices and methodologies.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Digital implementation
Get proficient working in UNIX/LINUX environment to use Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools such as Synopsys Design Compiler, IC Compiler 2, Fusion Compiler
Implement P&R designs using the latest technology from 3nm to 16nm node process 
Develop and implement plans to synthesize and close timing on complex digital integrated circuits at the block, subsystem or device level (100K to 10M+ gates) which are coded in VHDL/Verilog.
Design complex clock structure to meet tight skew requirements
Work with various design groups across different disciplines (Logic, Circuits, DFT & Layout) to meet timing closure, area, power, and performance requirements.
Ensure the implemented design meets all DRC required for process node below 16nm as well as DFM.
Communicate regularly with the project teams world-wide to resolve issues and to ensure meeting targeted goals and schedule.
Digital static timing analysis
Get proficient working in UNIX/LINUX environment to use Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools such as Synopsys PrimeTime
Develop timing constraints to enable static timing analysis
Simulate and analyse logs/reports generated from EDA tools (mainly ICC2 and Primetime) and make design trade-off to get the required results within the scheduled milestones.
Functional verification
Roles
Functional verification of SerDes and/or Security IP design blocks
Participate in testbench environment design and implementation in SystemVerilog/UVM-based framework and/or Python-based framework.
Execute and manage regressions and work closely with design team to debug, identify, and resolve design bugs.
Perform coverage analysis to ensure all design features are verified.
Simulation framework development
Participate in development of automation and/or hardware acceleration to improve engineering efficiency and productivity. 
Participate in exploration of incorporating AI/ML into automation framework.
Next generation verification methodology exploration
Participate in exploration of new approach to improve verification quality and productivity.
Participate in exploration of incorporating AI/ML into verification methodology.
Preferred skills
Good fundamental of digital logic design is preferred.
Experience in SystemVerilog and/or UVM is preferred.
Good programming/scripting skills (Python, C/C++, Perl, Ruby, Java, etc) is preferred.
Experience in AI/ML related project is preferred.
Post-silicon validation
Roles
Post silicon validation of high speed SerDes.
SerDes bring up, functional verification and performance optimization.
Develop validation methodology and automation scripting to characterize the latest SerDes design.
Work with design engineer on SerDes silicon issue debug.
Tune and optimize SerDes configuration and validate SerDes for meet various industrial compliance standards in PVT environment.
Preferred skills
Strong programming/scripting skills (eg. Python, C/C++, Perl, TCL et.) for firmware development, test methodology development and test automation
Knowledge of common lab equipment, including BERT, analyzers, oscilloscopes, PNA/VNA etc.

Title: RPA intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Location: Singapore, Singapore

Thales people architect solutions that enable two-thirds of planes to take off and land safely. We create in-flight entertainment systems that engross 50 million fliers every year and we develop the avionics that control the world‚Äôs largest commercial aircrafts. Our simulators train the next generation of pilots for fighter jets, transporters and search and rescue helicopters. And, together, each and every member of our aerospace team makes a difference.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.

Position Summary:

Thales AVS in Singapore conducts manufacturing and repair activities for aircraft OEM and airlines respectively.

This position is with the AVS repair unit in Singapore. The person joining will be working on Operations Support activities for the repair unit. The repair unit (ARU, Autonomous Repair Unit) is responsible for avionics, in-flight entertainment and electrical systems maintenance, repair and overhaul activities.In the course of your work, you have the opportunity to participate in the processes relating to different products, such as flight control, communication, navigations, in-flight entertainment, electrical conversion systems, etc. There will be opportunities to learn how the different operational processes in repair, engineering, supply chain, logistics, etc to deliver the required support to airlines, allowing their aircrafts to depart and operate seamlessly, safely and timely

Main Tasks & Responsibilities:

Main tasks and responsibilities involve:


Design, developing, document and testing for process automation with RPA Robotic Programming.
To assist (and potentially lead) in trials, pilots and full-scale deployments of projects or initiatives leading to the transformation of operational processes.
To support and monitor the RPA operations and communicate with the end users.
Find ways to automate, improve the management of RPA operational processes.
Opportunities to participate in LEAN/Problem solving activities.



Requirements:


Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (word, excel, powerpoint)
Proficient in Net, SQL, PowerBI, VBAMacros, Perl, Python, or similar programming languages a plus
Is comfortable managing Robotic programming (UiPath Studio and products)
Good interpersonal skills, writing and verbal skills.
Willingness to learn, able to grasp new ideas, working independently and extending the projects independently.
Able to commit to a full-time internship duration.



Learning outcomes: At the end of your internship, you will be able to achieve the following:


To have the inside (backstage) view how aircrafts are kept flying.
Experience working in a complex, multi-faceted MRO business. 
Opportunity to learn new tools (UiPath, SAP etc.), participate to scrum team.
Contribute to the operations management and support to deliver more efficiently.



At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Title: Intern - Strategy and Transactions, Valuation, Modelling, Economics (2024 Summer internship)
Description Snippet:
About the job


What if your curiosity could help build the world we all imagine?

Here at EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We‚Äôll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you‚Äôll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future ‚Äì all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The opportunity: your next adventure awaits

Strategy and Transaction (SaT) works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimizing, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within SaT include Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) ‚Äì that will bring together Transaction Diligence (TD), Valuation, Modeling and Economics (VME), and Lead Advisory (LA). Uniquely, SaT brings together a world-class strategy practice in EY-Parthenon, an unmatched Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) capability and the deep Tax expertise delivered via International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS). Given the longstanding and deep relationships of these competencies with our clients, our sub-service lines will allow our practice to drive further growth to an already successful practice and continue to be key drivers of innovation within our business.

VME practices are the means by which we continue to bring our deep financial, economics and analytics skills to bear in order to support our clients with better decision-making involving transactions, funding capital expansion and optimizing capital efficiency (such as capital allocation to help adjust risk, cash release opportunity, capital budgeting with skill sets on measuring and valuating not just assets but also litigation or life).

What we look for

 
You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We‚Äôre looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
You are curious and purpose driven. We‚Äôre looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
You are inclusive. We‚Äôre looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust. 
 

Qualifications:

 
Pursuing university degree related to Accountancy or Economics 
Demonstrated passion in or basic knowledge of visualization techniques and tools (e.g. Power BI, Spotfire) and data sourcing/capture, data preparation and data transformation techniques. This passion could be demonstrated via university projects, internships, conferences, self-study, etc.
Basic understanding of analytical techniques and tools for predictive and descriptive analytics. E.g. R, Python, VBA, Alteryx. Python preferred. Any practical experience during and outside of school would be advantageous.
Familiarity with machine learning and optimization techniques, cloud technologies and DevOps tools are considered a plus.
 

What‚Äôs in it for you

 
Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs.
Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds ‚Äî both professionally and culturally.
Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development.
Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society ‚Äì building a better working world, together.
 

What you can expect

 
You may expect an interview round with the hiring team.
Please note that for your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application: 
Full detailed resume
Latest university transcript
 
Please note that applications are shortlisted on a rolling basis. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified
 

To learn more about careers in EY, please visit Careers at EY or connect with us on social media (Facebook or Instagram) to hear from our people about their EY careers.

Title: Associate Intern
Company: Tony Blair Institute for Global Change
Description Snippet:
About the job
We don‚Äôt just talk, we do. Lead the change with us.

At the Tony Blair Institute for Global Change, we work with political leaders around the world to drive change. We help governments turn bold ideas into reality so they can deliver for their people. We do it by advising on strategy, policy and delivery, unlocking the power of technology across all three. And by sharing what we learn on the ground, so everyone can benefit. We do it to build more open, inclusive and prosperous countries for people everywhere.

We are a global team of nearly 800 changemakers, operating in more than 30 countries, across five continents. We are political strategists, policy experts, delivery practitioners, technology specialists and more. We speak more than 45 languages. We are working on over 100 projects, tackling some of the world‚Äôs biggest challenges. We‚Äôre all here at TBI to make a difference.

In a world of ever more complex challenges, we believe diversity of background and perspective is a strength. We pride ourselves on a culture that values and nurtures difference. We are dedicated to unlocking potential, not only for the countries we work in but also for each of our team members. No matter where you‚Äôre from or who you are, if you‚Äôre passionate about the transformative power of progressive politics, we invite you to build a better future with us.

Role Summary

The TBI Advisory Asia Pacific team is looking to hire exceptional Associate Interns for eight to ten weeks to support our growth and expansion within the region. This role is for exceptional candidates who are passionate about politics and the ability to create change by working in and with governments.

Our internship will provide you with a variety of experience, working with colleagues across the globe as well as regional stakeholders. You will have the benefit of challenging work during which you will help support our growing project portfolio, business development activities and expertise to our clients.

Our internship will provide you with a real insight into TBI‚Äôs work and allow you to understand how we are problem-solvers able to support political leaders across all the dimensions at which we offer advice.

During the internship, you will support specific projects, help create impactful change, be mentored by colleagues, and receive a holistic understanding of life at TBI. For those who enjoy our internship and are excited by the growth and impact of TBI, you will have a solid foundation from which to apply for a full-time position at the TBI: Whether our colleagues are at TBI for a few years, or a large share of their career as they grow and progress within the Institute, their experience positions them to have a huge global impact.

Please note that applicants must have the right to work in Singapore.

Key Responsibilities

Our internship will provide you with the opportunity to do some or all the following:


Develop research, analysis, written insights and other deliverables for clients and senior leadership within TBI
Support projects and/or regional client or development opportunities as TBI advises political leaders on strategy, policy, and delivery with technology as the enabler across all three dimensions
Support delivery of high levels of project impact, facilitating nimble performance tracking and coordination where required
Help develop presentations for new country clients and senior government officials
Apply and learn from new and innovative approaches to supporting change and deliver impact
Help develop strategies/frameworks and approaches
Support project teams in the development of reports, presentations, and other relevant documents
Provide general administrative support to the team, including data entry, file management, and document preparation


Person Specification 


This is a part-time role with a possible start date of mid-February to early March.
This role is for 3 months with possible extension
We welcome applications from those finishing or who have completed an undergraduate degree or post graduate degree
You should have a personal passion for politics and strong political acumen
We are looking for candidates who have:
Have a work ethos focused on team success with genuine motivation for colleagues‚Äô performance, growth, and well-being
An insatiable curiosity for data
A deep interest in generating original insights and performing in-depth analysis
Experience of being an entrepreneurial self-starter
You should be comfortable in performing challenging analysis and structured problem solving
We welcome applications from candidates who have a proactive and hands-on attitude, not afraid to roll-up their sleeves to get the job done and take ownership of their work

About Our Team

Located in Singapore, our team collaborates with partners in Bangkok and London, embodying innovation, diversity, and technological expertise. Our vision is to employ technology to create a financial ecosystem that is efficient, ethical, and sustainable.

The Opportunity

As a Software Engineering Intern within the Sustainable Finance & Innovation Team,, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and sustainable finance. This role offers exposure to a diverse tech stack and the chance to apply your skills in a real-world setting.

What You'll Do


Work with a Leading-Edge Tech Stack: Gain exposure to technologies including Python or JavaScript, Terraform, AWS, and serverless architectures like DynamoDB, API Gateway, and Lambda functions.
Lead a Capstone Project: Oversee a capstone project from start to finish, with guidance from senior team members, applying your technical skills to a tangible project within the realm of sustainable finance.
Deep Dive into Sustainable Finance: Acquire deep insights into sustainable finance, positioning yourself at the forefront of this transformative industry.
Experience Multicultural Collaboration: Be part of a vibrant, multicultural team, benefiting from the diversity of thoughts and innovations.
Receive Mentorship: Enjoy mentorship from industry leaders eager to share their knowledge and contribute to your professional growth.


Who We're Looking For


Enrolled in a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field, with a strong interest in applying technology to societal challenges.
Curious about the potential of technology to drive positive change and keen to explore new solutions.
Possesses strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop creative and effective solutions to complex challenges.
An effective communicator, capable of working well within a diverse team environment.
Adaptable and open to learning, ready to engage in a vibrant and evolving setting.


Required Skills And Experience


Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python or JavaScript. Familiarity with both is a plus.
Web Development: Experience with React, or a strong interest in learning it.
API Development: An understanding of RESTful APIs, with experience in API Gateway and Lambda functions considered a plus.
Serverless and Cloud Technologies: Familiarity with AWS and an understanding of serverless architecture is considered a plus.
Microservices Architecture: An understanding of microservices architecture principles, beneficial for designing and developing scalable and maintainable applications.
Software Development Practices: A foundation in software development principles, including version control (e.g., Git), and CI/CD pipelines. Experience with containerization tools like Docker is a plus.
Database Technologies: Knowledge of or willingness to learn database technologies, especially DynamoDB, or experience with other NoSQL databases.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively.


What's In It For You


A Pathway to Your Future: This internship is a gateway to the dynamic world of sustainable finance, equipping you with essential skills and knowledge for a thriving career in technology.
A Diverse and Inclusive Experience: Join a team where diversity and inclusion are celebrated, and your unique perspectives are valued.
Personalized Mentorship: Receive direct mentorship from experienced professionals dedicated to your learning and professional development.


How To Apply

Please submit your resume, optionally including any relevant projects or experiences that highlight your skills and interests in technology's role in sustainable finance.

We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace and encourage applications from all technical backgrounds.

Application Deadline: 30 April 2024

Dive into the transformative world of sustainable finance with us. We're eager to see the unique contributions you will bring to our team!

LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.

Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.

Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.

LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.

We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone‚Äôs race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.

Title: Technical Designer Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Company Description

CREATOR OF WORLDS

Ubisoft‚Äôs 20,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come.

Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Since opening its doors in 2008, Ubisoft Singapore has become the biggest AAA game development studio in Southeast Asia. The 500-strong studio is home to 35+ different nationalities focused on delivering ambitious gaming experiences to our players. Ubisoft Singapore has been contributing to all the Assassin‚Äôs Creed¬Æ titles since Assassin‚Äôs Creed¬Æ II. It innovated within the franchise as the studio behind the naval battle gameplay and water technology in Assassin‚Äôs Creed¬Æ III, Assassin‚Äôs Creed¬Æ IV Black Flag¬Æ and most recently in Assassin‚Äôs Creed¬Æ Valhalla. Its expertise in AAA and live operations, combined with a passion for naval gameplay, pushed the team to lead the development of Skull and Bones‚Ñ¢ revealed at E3 in 2017.

Job Description

YOUR PURPOSE

As a Technical Designer Intern, you will collaborate with our experienced game design and development teams to bring engaging and technically sound gameplay experiences to life. This internship provides a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the intersection of design and technical implementation, contributing to the creation of groundbreaking games.

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Game System Design



Work closely with the design team to conceptualize, prototype, and implement various game systems and mechanics.
Learn and understand the systems used or developed to create the features worked on.



Content Implementation



Translate design concepts into functional gameplay elements. Implement and integrate game content, including assets and features, into the game engine.
Learn how to and set up data for the features worked on within the Anvil editor.



Bug Identification and Resolution



Assist in identifying and resolving technical issues and bugs, collaborating with the QA team to ensure a polished and seamless gaming experience.



Documentation



Create and maintain comprehensive design and technical documentation for gameplay systems and features.
Ensure that the other members involved in the features have all the necessary technical information.



Cross-Functional Collaboration



Collaborate with artists, animators, and sound designers to integrate assets seamlessly into the game environment.
Learn and understand the requirements and constraints of the different job families involved in the features worked on.
Provide team members with any needed technical support related to systems or data setup for the features worked on.
Initiate and participate in knowledge sharing, problem solving, and technology research with other team members.
Actively communicate all dependencies, changes and task completion to Production Manager and reporting Manager.



Qualifications

WHAT YOU BRING

Title: Project Support Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description

Are you detailed and meticulous who enjoys building your capabilities in a global organisation? We need employees, all eager to engage actively in building a successful department, valuing collaboration, quality and fun in the everyday life!

We are hiring for an internship from July 2024 with a minimum commitment of 3 months. Please indicate your available dates in your Cover Letter and submit your CV together with unofficial transcripts.


Core Responsibilities





Project Support Overall project support, follow up on progress and support on deadlines, risks, problem solving, challenge new requests and future demand, center of daily business, status reporting
Coordinator ability to traffic creative work ‚Äì from brief of concept through to artwork & delivery. Ensuring projects are run on time and to budget, chasing creatives, vendors, generating timing plans and cost estimates.
Collaborator success in the project management team all comes down to effective project team management through individuals. 




Together with the Partner & Project Management team in The LEGO Agency Asia (Singapore), the role of Project Support Intern provides support to the PPM team as part of the major interface of the LEGO Agency Shanghai into the BU marketing partners.

The PPM organization is responsible for working very closely with the market BU marketing teams, translating their marketing requirements/calendar into an annual project calendar for TLA, and ensuring that sufficient capacity for the markets is available either through LEGO resourcing or the external partner network. In collaboration across the full PPM team across TLA Asia and the global PM network, to help identify and contribute to global teams to drive further efficiencies and establish a consistent way of working in the Singapore office.

In collaboration with the planner and creative team, help translate marketing business objectives into campaign needs and operational plan for the APAC hub, delivering high quality work to our consumers and shoppers.

The role will require strong interpersonal & organization skills, plus inquisitive mindset to learn and contribute collaboratively to the team.

Play your part in our team succeeding

The LEGO Agency is sits are part of the Product and Market development area at TLG and is part of the organisation that focuses on delivering best-in-class campaigns, insight driven & fit for purpose solutions across the LEGO group, covering 4 main regions ‚Äì AMS, EMEA, China & APAC.

The LEGO Agency Asia, serves the Asia markets, covering both China and APAC markets and is focused on developing campaign for the whole Asia region with special focus on China ‚Äì occasion campaigns/amplifying global campaigns ‚Äì full value chain from campaign strategy to final ins-store solutions.

The Project Support position will be placed in the LEGO Agency Partner & Project Management organisation, based in Singapore.

Do you have what it takes?





Strong Project Management skills & toolbox
Strong Communication skills
Collaborative mindset and strong team leadership skills
Agency and/or marketing background an advantage
Digital and content management experience an advantage




What‚Äôs in it for you? 

Here Are Some Of What To Expect





Family Care Leave ‚Äì We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.
Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.
Wellness ‚Äì We want you to be your best self, so you'll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based.
Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.
Bonus ‚Äì We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.
Your workplace ‚Äì When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.




Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g. race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Overview

Blockchain, Cryptocurrencies and AI are three of the most transformative technologies of our time, and their convergence is set to redefine the tech industry. Blockchain technology itself is making strides in different sectors like insurance, healthcare, and gaming by making information flow more transparent and accessible. The growing use and integration of elements like NFTs and tokenomics promises to redefine the future of PC, online and mobile gaming.

The WEMIX Singapore internship program provides practical experience in a fast-paced, challenging environment. You will get to tackle real-world communications challenges and learn more about the continually evolving scope demanded of today‚Äôs professionals. You will get the opportunity to deal with a range of actual scenarios and develop skills that are required to be competitive in today‚Äôs business environment.

The selected candidates will be able to learn and develop skills across the full spectrum of engaging in strategic research and development, collaborating closely with the team to analyse market trends, assess competitive landscapes, and identify growth opportunities within the dynamic business environment. Multi-tasking, critical thinking, effective communication, and persuasive presentation skills are key areas that you will learn to excel in.




Job Requirements and Scope of Work

Collaborate cross-functionally across the Global Expansion Team at WEMIX.
Conduct quantitative & qualitative research on the blockchain industry/sectors, and highlight insights & recommendations to support WEMIX's business expansion.
Research and identify potential industry partners that WEMIX can collaborate with 
Research regulations across different jurisdictions, identify opportunities and risks for WEMIX's existing product portfolio & develop mitigation strategies across regions 
Support Global Expansion Team with ongoing initiatives (e.g. preparing of powerpoints, presenting to external stakeholders)
Any other ad hoc tasks as required




Candidate Qualifications

Strong interest in the gaming/blockchain / web3 industry, with a demonstrated understanding of key concepts and emerging trends.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Excellent analytical and organisational skills, with outstanding attention to detail.
Ability to compile relevant information, conduct strategic analysis, and present and initiate ideas.
Previous internship experience in a consulting/strategy role is a plus.




Benefits

Lunch allowance: SGD 15 per meal
Work-from-home: 1-day WFH/week




Additional information

No credit-bearing
Able to start immediately

Title: Intern - Instrumentation & Control Engineer (July - Dec 2024)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Us

At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.

We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society‚Äôs evolving needs. Learn more about our What and our Why and how we can work together .

ExxonMobil in Singapore

ExxonMobil is one of Singapore‚Äôs largest foreign manufacturing investors with over S$25 billion in fixed asset investments.

We have manufacturing facilities that include an integrated world-scale refining and petrochemical complex in Jurong and Jurong Island, a network of service stations under the Esso brand, operate a lubricant plant and are a supplier of cylinder cooking gas. ExxonMobil provides customers and commercial markets in the region with ground transportation, industrial, aviation and marine fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and liquefied natural gas (LNG).

As Singapore serves as the AP hub for some of our businesses, we employ about 3,500 people across positions in operations, projects, commercial, corporate support functions and others.

ExxonMobil also contributes to community programs in Singapore that support the arts, education, health and the environment.

For more information, visit www.exxonmobil.com.sg or follow ExxonMobil Singapore on LinkedIn and Instagram.

What You Will Do

Through our internship program, you will gain first-hand experience with an industry leader in the refining and petrochemical industry. Your work, and that of the teams, contributes to the growth and future of our business, as we provide energy, products, and solutions for society. In addition, it will be an excellent platform for you to explore your career aspirations while delivering tangible benefits throughout our business from invaluable on-the-job-experience. Beyond that, you will not be alone as you will have a supervisor and engineer assigned to you who can help you navigate the organization, give advice on your development and help you learn what it takes to achieve your goals.

As part of the assessed internship, you will have a formal final review on project delivery and performance by your supervisor. You will also be asked to prepare a final presentation or report out about your project. Possible internship scopes include:


 Opportunity to support some of technical activities including monitoring, troubleshooting and other day-to-day activities that an Instrumentation & Control Engineer does in a manufacturing environment. 
 Improvement initiatives and programs for existing instrument fleet to achieve safe, reliable, and optimized unit operation. 
 Involvement in real significant Instrumentation projects. Take part in project development, gain insights into operational fundamentals, and contribute to business needs. 



Our internship programs are assessed, and outstanding candidates may be offered a full-time job offer to kickstart your career. We do prioritize our employment offers to outstanding candidates from our internship program over those without internship.

About You

Skills and Qualifications

To be eligible for our Internship Program, you should be:


 Preferably in your 3rd year of study 
 A degree in Electrical / Electronic Engineering, preferably potential Second Upper Honors and above, and / or with leadership experience in non-academic areas such as Co-curriculum activities or National Service. 
 Willing to work at one of our assigned manufacturing locations in Jurong Island or Pioneer Road 



Stay connected with us:


 Learn more at our website 
 Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram 
 Like us on Facebook 
 Subscribe our channel at YouTube 



Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunity in conformance with all applicable laws and regulations to individuals who are qualified to perform job requirements. The Company administers its personnel policies, programs, and practices in a non-discriminatory manner in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, work assignment, promotion, transfer, termination, wage and salary administration, and selection for training.

Please be informed that only shortlisted candidates will be notified, and you can find out more about our hiring process  here .

We thank you for your interest in ExxonMobil.

Nothing herein is intended to override the corporate separateness of local entities. Working relationships discussed herein do not necessarily represent a reporting connection, but may reflect a functional guidance, stewardship, or service relationship.

Exxon Mobil Corporation has numerous affiliates, many with names that include ExxonMobil, Exxon, Esso and Mobil. Title: [2024 H2 Term-time Internship] Email Marketing Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job

What The Role Is

About CPF Board

The Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. As the trustee of the nation‚Äôs retirement savings, we serve CPF members knowing that we make a difference. At CPF Board, we believe in developing individuals who are inspired to do their life‚Äôs best work, through 3Ps: Purposeful Work, Professional Growth, People & Culture.

Purposeful Work ‚Äì We're not just your typical pension fund; we're a national social security organization, and we take pride in the difference we make.
Professional Growth ‚Äì Embark on a journey of learning and skill development. Even though you're starting with one organization, you're opening doors to a myriad of career opportunities down the road.
People and Culture ‚Äì Be part of a mission-oriented organisation with a strong culture of teamwork, collaboration, and innovation. We treasure our people as our most valuable asset, promoting a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusivity. We believe in ensuring that everyone's voice is not just heard but celebrated.

Apply for our internship programme and be a part of #TeamCPF today, to make a difference in the lives of others and in the future of Singapore.

About The Team

Media & Publicity Department Strengthen CPFB‚Äôs reputation, sustain Singaporean‚Äôs trust in CPFB schemes and systems, and influence behavioural change in members. Inform, educate and help Singaporeans understand the benefits and options they have with CPF through campaigns and mainstream, social and digital media so that they can make the best use of their savings to build a strong foundation for their retirement.

What You Will Be Working On

What you will be working on

In Support Of The Board‚Äôs Email Marketing Efforts, The Intern Will Work With Various Stakeholders And Vendor To Create And Deploy Electronic Direct Mailers (eDMs) To Members And Employers. You Will Be Exposed To The Full Spectrum Of Email Marketing ‚Äì From Executing The Segmentation Strategy To Supporting The EDM Content Creation As Well As Data Analysis And Optimisation Efforts On The EDM Channel. Your Scope Will Include, But Is Not Limited To

End-to-end deployment of eDMs that serve to educate and drive key actions. This includes identifying the right target audience for various eDMs and working with the vendor to set up and schedule the eDM
Supporting the development of eDM content
Management of eDM assets and calendar
Analysing eDM data to derive useful insights
Supporting optimisation efforts such as the development of A/B tests and other research
Supporting paid media requirements on an ad-hoc basis
Other ad-hoc tasks as briefed by supervisor

What We Are Looking For

What you can expect

During Your Internship With CPF Board, You Can Expect

Learning Opportunities: Gain valuable hands-on experience in email marketing as well as data analytics and research.
Mentorship: Receive guidance and mentorship from experienced digital marketing professionals.
Exposure: You will be exposed to the inner workings of the public service sector, and understand the role of communications in the government sector.
Networking: Connect with professionals in the digital marketing field and build your network within the public service sector.

What we are looking for

We Are Seeking Candidates Who Meet The Following Criteria

Available full time (5 days/week) from Aug to Dec 2024.
Currently pursuing a Diploma/ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Communications, Social Media, Business or related field
Interest in digital marketing, particularly the use of data-driven approaches to deliver the right messages to intended audiences on the eDM channel
Knowledge of email marketing tools such as Adobe Campaign Standard will be an advantage
Copywriting and graphic design skills. Adobe Photoshop/ Illustrator skills will be a plus

To learn more about what it's like to work at CPF Board, visit www.cpf.gov.sg/careers.

Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.
