Description Snippet:
About the job
About GlobalFoundries

GlobalFoundries (GF) is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world‚Äôs most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GF makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. For more information, visit gf.com

Development of Semiconductor Sensors and Characterization

Project Objective 

Semiconductor sensors like optical sensors and magnetic sensors are key devices that could be employed for a wide range of applications. In this work, the student will focus on enabling the automated testing and characterization of semiconductor sensors.

Project Description

The intern will get exclusive insights and hands-on experience in GlobalFoundries‚Äô state-of-the-art semiconductor characterization facility. He or she will develop programs using commercial software, Labview and/or C/C++ to automate the testing and carry out extensive characterization on semiconductor devices. In the course of development, additional hardware design on PCB might be required to enable specific characterization.

During the final phase, the student will validate the setup by characterizing the devices.

Project Outcome

Intern will gain real-world experience in semiconductor device testing methodology, and get the chance to develop and build automated testing capability for state-of-the art optical/magnetic sensors.

Required Qualifications


Degree in Electrical / Electronics / Computer engineering or equivalent 
Experience in programming languages, eg. C/C++ or labview

Title: TVSD Internship (6 months) - Product Intern (Autotech)
Description Snippet:
About the job

About Us

TVS Digital is a digital technology start-up headquartered in Singapore and backed by a large conglomerate. We are on a mission to deliver digital solutions that help address real-life business challenges of global companies within the Automotive, Financial Services and Manufacturing industries by harnessing the power of exponential technologies, including Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI & ML), Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR). Within the automotive services domain, we are building an ‚ÄúAutotech‚Äù portfolio focusing on SaaS products transforming the global consumer car buying experience.




We seek a passionate, creative and hard-working individual to join us for the Product Intern (Autotech) role.




This role requires a proactive, highly motivated individual with an aptitude for customer focus and critical thinking. You will be expected to take the Internship and drive positive results within the product portfolio. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, analytical, detail-oriented, and able to work well with cross-functional teams.

You must develop a solid understanding of our product strategy, development processes and capabilities. 




Experience in a similar role or background would be beneficial but optional. We seek aptitude, enthusiasm, resourcefulness, and a strong desire to learn and contribute within a start-up environment.




A Product Intern oversees the development of products from start to finish to ensure they meet clients' needs and preferences. Their primary duties include determining the overall vision of products, managing various backlog items, and deciding which features each product will have according to the client‚Äôs preferences.







What Does a Product Intern Do?

Product Interns are members of the Autotech team who manage an organisation's entire product development process. They research the client‚Äôs needs to determine which features to include in products and pitch ideas for product features to stakeholders. They are the primary contact between the scrum teams, product development departments, and stakeholders. 

They‚Äôll collaborate closely with the scrum and product development departments to ensure the products meet specific objectives outlined by stakeholders and clients. After product completion, the product Intern will conduct a final review and submit approval before releasing the product to clients.




1. Defining the vision

The agile product Intern is the point person on the product development team. They use their high-level perspective to define goals and create a vision for development projects.

Product Interns communicate with stakeholders, including customers, business managers, and the development team, to ensure the goals and vision align with business objectives.

A product Intern with a higher perspective ensures that the team maintains a cohesive vision despite agile product development's flexible and often fast-paced nature. Everyone must be on the same page for a project to work effectively.

A product Intern can help the team maintain that vision by creating a product roadmap. The product roadmap is a high-level, strategic visual summary that outlines the vision and direction for the product offering over time. It is a strategic guide for stakeholders to reference and an execution plan.




2. Managing the product backlog

One of the most critical responsibilities for a scrum product Intern is managing the product backlog. This is the development team‚Äôs project to-do list.

The product Intern is responsible for creating the list of backlog items and prioritising them based on the overall strategy and business objectives. The product Intern must also map out project dependencies to inform the necessary development sequence.

The product backlog isn‚Äôt a static to-do list, though. It is a live document that should be continually updated based on evolving project needs throughout development.

Because the product backlog will change frequently, the product Intern must make a list accessible and available to all stakeholders (mainly developers) to ensure optimised performance and project outcomes.




3. Prioritizing needs

Another critical role of the product Intern is to prioritise needs. In other words, they must juggle the scope, budget, and time triangle, weighing priorities according to stakeholders' needs and objectives.

For example, if the product under development needs to launch within six months, that constrains the project's scope. As the project evolves, the product Intern must gauge which areas have flexibility and which don‚Äôt to determine how and when each iteration and product element will be developed.




4. Overseeing development stages

With the vision, strategy, and product priorities set, the product Intern should spend a significant amount of time overseeing the actual development of the product. They are vital throughout each event, including planning, refinement, review, and sprint.

During the planning stages, the agile product Intern works with stakeholders to identify and organise the steps required for the next iteration. They will then meet with their team to refine the process, identify areas for improvement, and support the sprint.




5. Anticipating client needs

The successful scrum product Intern will be an expert at understanding and anticipating the client‚Äôs needs to manage the development process more effectively.

Their deep market knowledge and communication skills allow them to anticipate and address problems or needs.

Stay one step ahead of your clients with customer journey mapping. These visuals create a shared vision for the customer experience. You'll save time and effort, so you can put all your energy into reading and wowing your customers' minds.




6. Acting as primary liaison

The product Intern is the primary communicator and link between stakeholders and teams. As such, they must be expert communicators, ensuring stakeholders' buy-in on all significant decisions and strategies and clear instructions and deliverables for the developers.




7. Evaluating product progress at each iteration

The product Intern is accountable for each stage of the development process and the final product. They take a primary role in inspecting and evaluating product progress through each iteration. The product Intern makes the judgment call on the performance, deciding if the team needs to go back to the drawing board or if they can move on to the next steps.

Agile product Interns wear many hats. So, they need tools and solutions that can adapt to their changing roles as quickly as they do.

Visuals can assist your scrum team through every step of the development process, making it easy to transition from outlining the customer journey and mocking up product designs to mapping product dependencies and sharing your work with stakeholders.




Duties & Responsibilities 

As part of their role on a product team, a successful Product Intern should fulfil the following duties and responsibilities:

Collaborating with prospective users and clients to understand and anticipate their needs and translate them into product requirements
Defining the vision for the team‚Äôs product
Creating a product roadmap based on this vision
Managing the product backlog and prioritising them based on changing requirements
Overseeing all stages of product creation, including design and development
Helping the Design team develop user stories
Monitoring and evaluating product progress at each stage of the process
Liaising with the product team and end-users to deliver updates
Participating in Scrum meetings and product sprints
Drive the vision and delivery of new products and features for existing products.
Conduct market and customer research to identify potential features or enhancements.
Be the voice of customers and ensure a high-quality customer experience.
Own the product roadmap, prioritise opportunities, refine feature ideas, and maintain existing features based on data and customer feedback.
Produce high-level product requirements and engage in regular iteration with our customer success, data, and engineering teams.
Coordinate go-to-market strategies when launching a new product or feature.
Work closely with all stakeholders to ensure successful end-to-end delivery of products.
Keep up with cutting-edge and emerging technologies relevant to the Autotech domain.
User Acceptance criteria development







Qualification & Skills Required: 

They should also have a good knowledge of software development and other relevant web technologies and be familiar with agile processes. A Product Intern will learn to manage all product life cycle stages. They should be able to stick to timelines and measure progress during development. 




Currently Studying Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related fields. 
Proven ability to coordinate, plan, execute, and project manage from beginning to end.
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to think outside the box and roll up one‚Äôs sleeves to finish the job.
Taking individual leadership and showing intense Internship of critical deliverables. 
Self-starter, able to work and thrive in a fast-paced and hands-on environment.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Curiosity and learning-oriented mindset for financial solutions and technologies.
Collaborative mentality and solid team player. 
MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint skills are essential.







Plus Points:

Previous experience in Automotive (but not must) product management and marketing roles. 
Exposure to Design Thinking, Agile process and tools & methodologies.

Title: Intern - Assessment, Outreach and Compliance
Description Snippet:
About the job
What The Role Is

To assist the Assessment, Outreach and Compliance (AOC) branch in the development and implementation of a Gen AI solution for risk detection

What You Will Be Working On

The intern will work on 1 Gen AI/Analytics project.

The Intern Will Also Be Given Opportunities To


 Develop/enhance Gen AI or LLM solutions, e.g. content generation models, to address business issues
 Present their proposals at key management meetings
 Provide research support to ongoing analytics projects or analysis work



Key Learning Outcomes/Exposure


 Understanding of users, operations through a data-first mindset
 Understanding of stakeholder management
 Derive useful and actionable insights from data analysis for stakeholders
 Translating business needs into analytics/Gen AI solutions
 Exposure to various generative AI or LLM techniques such as GPT-3.5, BERT etc.
 Experience in developing and implementing Generative AI or LLM models, including fine-tuning, transfer learning and model evaluation



What We Are Looking For


 Have a good understanding and/or strong interest in generative AI
 Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills
 Good self-management skills, including an ability to be self-directed to meet project deadlines



The intern will be required to commit to a minimum of 3 months from May to Jul 2024/ Aug to December 2024

Title: Solutions Delivery Intern - KYC
Description Snippet:
About the job
3476

Moody‚Äôs is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don‚Äôt meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody‚Äôs, we‚Äôre taking action. We‚Äôre hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We‚Äôre educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Moody's Analytics KYC team is seeking a motivated Solutions Delivery Intern to join our dynamic team as a Product Consultant. This internship offers a unique opportunity for individuals with a technical background or a demonstrable interest in technology to gain hands-on experience in a role that bridges technology, product, and client interaction. Title: Finance Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn‚Äôt about conforming to somebody else‚Äôs ideal. It‚Äôs about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.

THE ROLE

Division: Travel Retail Asia Pacific

Job Title: Finance Intern

About The Role‚Ä¶

FP&A Intern is a co-pilot role within the Travel Retail Finance function. The intern would be closely partnering with the finance team and the multi-functional team spread across the region. The incumbent will get exposure to working across functions and markets in an exciting and fast-paced environment of the duty-free world.

This role will assist with all end-to-end planning, reporting and analysis activities for the Cluster to deliver a high standard of reporting and analytical support to the business. Support includes financial, business and market analysis and special projects as required.

Key Responsibilities

In this role you will be responsible for:

Financial Planning and Analysis (Capex -investments)


Drive Capex PR/PO creation request - (From receiving request, including budget top-up to successful PO creation)
Updating Capex tracker
Complete ad-hoc PR/PO creations according to deadline communicated
Ad-hoc support Vendor Master Updates 


Budgeting and reporting


Assist the Brand Finance Controller with Budget management and tracking 
Prepare and provide meaningful financial management information
Ensure reports are submitted in a timely fashion, completely and accurately, in particular the Monthly Business Update (MBU)
Coordinate Price approval tracking and prepare Price Change Report in a timely manner for submission to Compliance Team
Lead and/or participate in ad-hoc projects as required 


What You‚Äôll Bring

ESSENTIAL:


Able to commit for at least 6 months (July to December 2024) for a full-time internship.
Skilled in the use of MS Office tools including Outlook (or related email tool) Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Self-Motivated, with a strong work ethic and a sense of confidentiality.
Possesses cross-cultural awareness and high emotional intelligence.
Articulate, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Good balance of a professional attitude while having fun.
Strong interest in consumer goods, makeup and beauty products.
Strong desire to learn along with a strong sense of ownership.
Persuasive, resilient and flexible, able to easily adapt to new challenges.
Passionate, enthusiastic and driven to regularly follow-up with loose ends.
Able to thrive despite challenges while adopting a positive attitude under pressure.


DESIRABLE


Under Graduates with Finance/Accounting as major and interest towards FMCG/Luxury 
Advanced knowledge of Excel, Well versed with SAP, Introduction to Hyperion preferred
Planning, organizing and coordinating ‚Äì able to plan and coordinate efforts both within areas of functional responsibility and across divisions and geographies. 
Analytical capability ‚Äì strong analytical capabilities with a solid understanding of key business drivers and ability to add value to the decision-making processes of the business through high level, strategic analysis and insights 
Leadership ‚Äì able to lead by example, inspire, motivate, engage, and drive results through others ensuring alignment to organisational priorities, goals and targets 
Presentation skills ‚Äì ability to present and communicate with confidence. 
Influencing skills ‚Äì able to demonstrate above average negotiation and relationship building capabilities. 
Change leader ‚Äì able to embrace and accelerate change in a fast-paced environment and pioneer new ideas and approaches ''


LEARNING OUTCOMES


Understanding of interlinkage of financial systems
Basics of role as a Financial Planning and Analysis Professional
Role of Finance as business partners and custodians of the company

Title: Off-cycle Internship Equity Derivatives Sales and Trading Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Singapore

Macquarie is Asia‚Äôs leading Structured Warrants issuer, with presence in Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand and Malaysia. Join our team as an Equity Derivatives Sales and Trading Intern.

At Macquarie, we are working to create lasting value for our communities, our clients and our people. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 54 years of unbroken profitability. You‚Äôll be part of a supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drive outcomes.

What role will you play?

As an intern, you will contribute in our sales and trading function where you will learn the warrants product and market making system and speak with retail brokers to promote our products. You will identify new opportunities to promote our product and grow market share, and work with vendors and marketing agencies to effectively promote on different platforms. You will contribute to producing content including market commentary and educational articles and identify advertising channels to drive product sales.

What You Offer


Undergraduates or graduates who have a relevant degree in business, finance and economics and can commit full time from April to October 2024 (6 months)
Strong interest in equity markets, sales and marketing
Strong attention to detail, creative and quick thinking with an ability to multi-task
Enjoy working in a team, with strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strive for excellence in your work and understand the importance of professional and ethical standards Possess strong coding skills including Python, C# or similar
Fluency in English to facilitate discussions with key stakeholders.


We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.

Benefits

Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria and location, include:


Hybrid and flexible working arrangements
One wellbeing leave day per year
Paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent
Paid volunteer leave and donation matching
Range of benefits to support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing
Access a wide range of learning and development opportunities
Employee Assistance Program, a robust behavioural health network with counselling and coaching services
Recognition and service awards


About Commodities And Global Markets

In Commodities and Global Markets you will be part of a global business offering capital and financing, risk management, market access, physical execution and logistics solutions to its diverse client base.

 Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.

If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.

A career at Macquarie means you‚Äôll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we‚Äôre empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.

Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Title: Intern - Strategy and Transactions, Valuation, Modelling, Economics (2024 Summer internship)
Description Snippet:
About the job


What if your curiosity could help build the world we all imagine?

Here at EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We‚Äôll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you‚Äôll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future ‚Äì all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The opportunity: your next adventure awaits

Strategy and Transaction (SaT) works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimizing, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within SaT include Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) ‚Äì that will bring together Transaction Diligence (TD), Valuation, Modeling and Economics (VME), and Lead Advisory (LA). Uniquely, SaT brings together a world-class strategy practice in EY-Parthenon, an unmatched Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) capability and the deep Tax expertise delivered via International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS). Given the longstanding and deep relationships of these competencies with our clients, our sub-service lines will allow our practice to drive further growth to an already successful practice and continue to be key drivers of innovation within our business.

VME practices are the means by which we continue to bring our deep financial, economics and analytics skills to bear in order to support our clients with better decision-making involving transactions, funding capital expansion and optimizing capital efficiency (such as capital allocation to help adjust risk, cash release opportunity, capital budgeting with skill sets on measuring and valuating not just assets but also litigation or life).

What we look for

 
You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We‚Äôre looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
You are curious and purpose driven. We‚Äôre looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
You are inclusive. We‚Äôre looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust. 
 

Qualifications:

 
Pursuing university degree related to Accountancy or Economics 
Demonstrated passion in or basic knowledge of visualization techniques and tools (e.g. Power BI, Spotfire) and data sourcing/capture, data preparation and data transformation techniques. This passion could be demonstrated via university projects, internships, conferences, self-study, etc.
Basic understanding of analytical techniques and tools for predictive and descriptive analytics. E.g. R, Python, VBA, Alteryx. Python preferred. Any practical experience during and outside of school would be advantageous.
Familiarity with machine learning and optimization techniques, cloud technologies and DevOps tools are considered a plus.
 

What‚Äôs in it for you

 
Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs.
Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds ‚Äî both professionally and culturally.
Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development.
Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society ‚Äì building a better working world, together.
 

What you can expect

 
You may expect an interview round with the hiring team.
Please note that for your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application: 
Full detailed resume
Latest university transcript
 
Please note that applications are shortlisted on a rolling basis. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified
 

To learn more about careers in EY, please visit Careers at EY or connect with us on social media (Facebook or Instagram) to hear from our people about their EY careers.

Title: Intern, Investor Relations
Description Snippet:
About the job
We are a leading financial services provider committed to making decisions easier and lives better for our customers and colleagues around the world. From our environmental initiatives to our community investments, we lead with values throughout our business. To help us stand out, we help you step up, because when colleagues are healthy, respected and meaningfully challenged, we all thrive. Discover how you can grow your career, make impact and drive real change with our Winning Team today.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Manulife US REIT is a Singapore listed REIT established with the investment strategy principally to invest, directly or indirectly, in a portfolio of income-producing office real estate in key markets in the United States, as well as real estate-related assets.

Role


Assist with preparation and review of Annual Report and Sustainability Report
Assist with press releases, presentation decks and FAQ for quarterly financial results and other major announcements
Conceptualise and develop marketing collaterals such as presentation slides, infographics, videos, etc. 
Assist in sustainability-related projects
Produce creative multimedia LinkedIn content to increase engagement, as well as monitor LinkedIn and website performance analytics
Assist with event planning and execution for corporate events such as investor meetings, Annual General Meeting, company CSR events, etc
Perform market research on REIT landscape as needed


Requirement


Able to start work from now till end of year, for at least a three-month period


Interested applicants, please indicate your availability on your resume.

About Manulife And John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Asia, Canada, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2022, we had more than 40,000 employees, over 116,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 34 million customers. At the end of 2022, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, including total invested assets of $0.4 trillion (US $0.3 trillion), and segregated funds net assets of $0.3 trillion (US$0.3 trillion). We trade as ‚ÄòMFC‚Äô on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges, and under ‚Äò945‚Äô in Hong Kong.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

We are looking for talented and motivated students to be with us for a minimum of 3 months. Title: Intern - Strategy and Transactions, Lead Advisory (2024 Summer internship)
Description Snippet:
About the job


What if your curiosity could help build the world we all imagine?

Here at EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We‚Äôll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you‚Äôll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future ‚Äì all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The opportunity: your next adventure awaits

Strategy and Transaction (SaT) works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimizing, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within SaT include Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) ‚Äì that will bring together Transaction Diligence (TD), Valuation, Modeling and Economics (VME), and Lead Advisory (LA). Uniquely, SaT brings together a world-class strategy practice in EY-Parthenon, an unmatched Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) capability and the deep Tax expertise delivered via International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS). Given the longstanding and deep relationships of these competencies with our clients, our sub-service lines will allow our practice to drive further growth to an already successful practice and continue to be key drivers of innovation within our business.

 
TD advises corporate, private equity and government clients on buy-side and sell-side financial due diligence. We work closely with SaT sub-service lines and competencies and other EY service lines to deliver seamless, integrated due diligence to our clients.
VME practices are the means by which we continue to bring our deep financial, economics and analytics skills to bear in order to support our clients with better decision-making involving transactions, funding capital expansion and optimizing capital efficiency (such as capital allocation to help adjust risk, cash release opportunity, capital budgeting with skill sets on measuring and valuating not just assets but also litigation or life).
LA includes tactical and strategic advice for corporates, financial sponsors and family offices, as well as negotiation assistance and other transaction related topics. 
Mergers & Acquisitions team provides sector-focused advice on the sale process from strategic positioning to close, and we help execute acquisitions, alliances and mergers as well as advise C-suite executives and boards on evaluating strategic alternatives in the context of transactions.
Infrastructure Advisory team has extensive experience working with private and public sector organizations on business case and project development strategy, economic analysis, provision of commercial and procurement advice and raising finance on complex infrastructure projects. 
 
 

What we look for

 
You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We‚Äôre looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
You are curious and purpose driven. We‚Äôre looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
You are inclusive. We‚Äôre looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust. 
 

Qualifications:

 
Pursuing university degree related to Accounting, Business, Finance, Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics with demonstrated interest.
Demonstrated passion in related work with strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills to analyze financial and non-financial information to formulate views and conclusions. This passion could be demonstrated via university projects, internships, conferences, self-study, etc.
 

What‚Äôs in it for you

 
Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs.
Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds ‚Äî both professionally and culturally.
Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development.
Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society ‚Äì building a better working world, together.
 

What you can expect

 
You may expect up to 2 interview rounds with the hiring team. Minimum internship period required is 8 weeks.
Please note that for your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application: 
Full detailed resume 
Latest university transcript
 
Please note that applications are shortlisted on a rolling basis. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Title: FRM Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Bunge's FRM Internship provides students with opportunity to support our volatility trading team in building up an analytical toolkit and internal database. The intern will also assist traders in various projects involving both fundamental and technical analysis of market data through quantitative methods with potential of actual deployment in trading strategies.

Main Accountabilities


 Develop new projects assigned by traders that uses quantitative and statistical models to analyze options volatility, supply-demand forecast and portfolio optimization.

 Actual start and end date can be discussed. 
 Able to commit at least 4 working days per week. 


Education/Experience


 Currently studying towards a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Quantitative Finance or any related disciplines. 
 Proficiency in Python and Excel VBA is required. Experience in other programming language is preferred. 
 Project experience in data science or quantitaive research. 
 Ability to read and understand market research reports and databased in Chinese is advantageous. 
 Good in analyst skills

JERA Global Markets (JERAGM) is a leading utility-backed seaborne energy trader. A joint venture between majority shareholder JERA Co., Inc. and EDF Trading, JERAGM‚Äôs shareholders are among the world‚Äôs major utilities.

Title: Summer Internship (Singapore)
Description Snippet:
About the job

The Firm:




Brevan Howard Asset Management is one of the leading absolute return/hedge fund managers, overseeing assets on behalf of institutional investors from around the world, including pension funds, endowments, insurance companies, government agencies, private banks and fund of funds.

Brevan Howard was founded in 2002 and launched its flagship global macro strategy in April 2003. The firm currently manages over $35bn and engages predominantly in discretionary directional and relative value trading in fixed income, FX markets, and equities. BH Digital, a division within Brevan Howard that manages crypto and digital asset strategies was launched in 2022.




The firm currently employs over 1,100 personnel worldwide, including over 400 investment professionals. This global presence gives Brevan Howard the ability to identify and source attractive investment opportunities, as well as investment management talent wherever they may be. Brevan Howard has won several industry awards for excellence in risk management, operational robustness and investment performance.




The firm‚Äôs main hubs are in London, Jersey, Geneva, New York, Austin, Hong Kong, Singapore and Abu Dhabi..




Our six-week summer Internship Programme seeks to hire ambitious and enthusiastic undergraduates who have demonstrated a clear interest in the financial services field. 

Interns will have opportunity to develop their skills through in-depth expert training covering a range of topics related to Financial Markets including (but not limited to): macroeconomics, FX, Digital Assets, Interest Rate Derivatives, Risk Management and Python. Additionally, interns will benefit from key talks, Q&As, and interactions with some of the most respected and talented individuals in their field. They will receive mentorship and contribute to intern projects, complete trading simulations and enhance their knowledge of the industry through short-term department rotations (dependent upon business demand).




This internship is devised to provide candidates with an invaluable education on the workings of a macro fixed income hedge fund and the regulatory environment through a two-way process to determine if Brevan Howard and the intern are a compatible fit.




Successful interns will be offered the opportunity to join our prestigious Graduate Programme the following year.




Work Experience/ Background:




Currently studying a University degree at a recognised institution and on course for a minimum of a 2:1 / 3.5 GPA ‚Äì completed and awarded before August 2025
Preferred fields of include STEM degrees (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) and/or Economics/Business 
An understanding and interest in financial markets / financial products 
Strong mathematic, quantitative, and problem-solving capabilities 
Demonstrated technical capabilities (Excel, VBA, SQL)
Previous Financial Experience not required

The Prime Brokerage team at Maybank Securities is responsible for providing customized and comprehensive solutions to our institutional clients, including hedge funds, asset managers, and family offices. Title: Summer Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job

CRU leads in the field of global commodity market analysis and business intelligence. Our Analysis Division has an exciting new scheme ‚Äì We are offering the opportunity for a talented group of individuals to kick-start their professional career in the world of commodities, and to join us in a paid internship 3-month placement programme in our Singapore office. Applicants must have the right to work in Singapore to be considered.




The industries we work in are vibrant and truly global: a hurricane in Australia, a strike in Peru, or a construction boom in China can influence markets across the world. Our work relies on the best market research, data, and insights because our multi-national customers - leading companies in the commodity space - rely on us to inform and support crucial decisions they need to make in fast-moving and volatile markets.

About the role




We need the best teams, data, and research insights to support this. This provides the opportunity for you to work across commodities, to be part of our research programme and support creation and management of the best data and insights for our customers. For the most successful in role, there is the potential to contribute to analysis output and join as a permanent Research Analyst where opportunity arises.

For the successful individuals, this is a great entry point into a career in the private sector, where you can thrive at the heart of a dynamic, global business intelligence company and will learn about commodity markets. The role gives variety, and allows to develop a wide array of transferable skills, ideal to build a strong CV.




Some examples of how you will be contributing are:

‚Ä¢ Finding, evaluating, and organising data and information that supports the formation of published analysis for major industrial and financial customers

‚Ä¢ Improving systems and processes to allow for more effective and efficient data-led insight generation

‚Ä¢ Applying your academic knowledge and experience and working with others to help find meaning from diverse information sources and types

‚Ä¢ Verifying or improving data that forms the evidence base for key conclusions, forecasts, or expert opinions.




What kind of person might you be?

‚Ä¢ Someone who thrives working in a team and is curious about your colleagues‚Äô work, successes, and challenges

‚Ä¢ Someone who is intellectually curious, eager to learn and push forward their own boundaries

‚Ä¢ Someone who is organised, motivated, dedicated and likes to deliver on tasks




What qualifications should you have?

‚Ä¢ Candidates should be degree educated in Economics, Mathematics or similar, and ideally having completed or working towards a Masters. Degrees should be from a top university, or equivalent level qualification from a leading university. 




What will you gain from working with us?

‚Ä¢ The ability to work with and learn from analysts in a highly respected market analysis and business intelligence business

‚Ä¢ Engaging in real work that makes a meaningful difference to the outcomes for external customers

‚Ä¢ The guidance and support of both a dedicated line manager and project leads in the business who will ensure you are properly briefed and supported

‚Ä¢ The opportunity to work with supportive and like-minded colleagues in a truly global organisation

‚Ä¢ The potential to contribute to analysis output and join as a permanent Research Analyst where opportunity arises

‚Ä¢ Please note you must hold the right to work in Singapore to be considered for this internship.

‚Ä¢ This internship is expected to be for 3 months from June/July and you will receive $1,500 SGD per month pay.

Title: Investment Intern

About the job

About Openspace Ventures

Openspace is a leading Southeast Asian venture capital firm, finding and backing companies creating a transformative impact where tech meets life. With over US$800M in committed capital Openspace manages 6 funds which invest in Series A through Series D stage companies, and has Web3 exposure through our Ocular fund. With a wide-scale operations team and deep on-the-ground coverage, its 38+ professionals actively partner with portfolio companies to help build viable and responsible B2B and B2C businesses. Openspace is co-headquartered in Singapore and Jakarta, with active offices in Bangkok, Manila, and Ho Chi Minh City.

Ocular is a crypto fund based in Singapore managed by Openspace Ventures. Ocular invests in top crypto managers and projects globally. The Ocular team comprises crypto investment professionals with venture capital and data science background. We are looking for an Investment Intern who will play an important role in supporting the team across all areas of investment and portfolio management.




Our team

Our Investment, Portfolio Success and Corporate teams work together to drive greater value creation for our portfolio companies. Through this internship you have the opportunity to:

Source, identify, meet and screen crypto fund and project investment opportunities

Prepare investment research and reports and publish on social media to establish branding and thought leadership for the fund
Join various social channels (Twitter, Discord, Substack, etc) to understand the market / trends, publish social content and build brand.

Penultimate year or above undergraduates/postgraduates in Finance, Economics, Business, or any field.
Proven track record of academic and professional excellence
Previous experience in consulting, investment banking, corporate finance, investor relations, venture capital, private equity, or web3 projects.
Insatiable curiosity of all things related to cryptocurrencies, blockchain ecosystems and decentralized finance (DeFi), etc.
Current knowledge of crypto & web3 investment idea generation
Networking skills and an enjoyment of building relationships with investors
Crypto experience in an investing and/or operating capacity is a plus
Technical skills in relevant crypto fields like zk, smart contract, data science is a plus
Keen eye for detail, thoroughness and accuracy when assigned with tasks
Organized, self starter, open-minded and able to handle constructive criticism
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to make data-driven investment decisions.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic environment in the cryptocurrency space.
Effective English communicator (both speaking and writing) to convey complex investment strategies to diverse stakeholders.
Experienced in writing blogs, reports, PowerPoint slides is a plus




Location: 

Preferably Singapore (but open to be based in another country with similar time zone to Singapore).

Title: Intern, Research
Description Snippet:
About the job
About The Milken Institute
The Milken Institute is a globally minded, publicly supported, non-partisan, and non-profit think tank headquartered in Santa Monica, with offices in Washington, DC, New York, London, Abu Dhabi, and Singapore. For the past three decades, the Milken Institute has served as a catalyst for practical, scalable solutions to global challenges by connecting human, financial, and educational resources to those who need them. Guided by a conviction that the best ideas, under-resourced, cannot succeed, we conduct research and analysis and convene top experts, innovators, and influencers from different backgrounds and competing viewpoints. We leverage this expertise and insight to construct programs and policy initiatives. These activities are designed to help people build meaningful lives, in which they can experience health and well-being, pursue effective education and gainful employment, and access the resources required to create ever-expanding opportunities for themselves and their broader communities.
About The Singapore Internship Program
The Milken Institute Singapore Internship Program, in partnership with Partners Group, aims to cultivate the next generation of leaders who are equipped to tackle the issues that shape the global agenda as they enter the financial, investment, corporate, multilateral, or philanthropic sectors. We create a customized experience for each intern, which is tailored to their interest area and career trajectory as well as emphasizes their professional and personal development. This experience includes opportunities to:

 Interact with high-level business leaders, ambassadors, business leaders, and academic experts as part of our ‚ÄúGlobal Leaders Speaker Series‚Äù 
 Meet and work with the Milken Institute‚Äôs global network of senior executives 
 Learn from senior leaders at the Milken Institute and Partners Group 
 Gain insights into the workings of global financial markets through dedicated workshops 
 Network with an international and diverse group of peers and professionals 

Key Responsibilities

 The Research Intern would participate in projects including but not limited to topics on health, ESG/sustainability, technology, and sovereign wealth funds in Asia. 
 The Research Intern may also be required to work on other topics that the Asia Center focuses on. The work aims to provide guidance to policymakers, business leaders, and investors in the region. 
 They will support the projects by organizing outreach for workshops/meetings, as well as conducting primary and secondary research to produce literature reviews, write-ups, and sections of papers/reports. They will report to and work closely with the Associate Director for Policy & Programs at the Asia Center. 

Qualifications

 The ideal candidate should have excellent written and spoken English, good analytical skills, strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to work in a multi-disciplinary and cross-cultural environment. 
 Fluency in Asian languages is a plus. 
 Currently enrolled or recently graduated from a degree program related to public health, finance, public policy or related fields. Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs graduate is preferred. 
 Singaporean national is preferred. 

 Internship Duration 
We offer a 6 to 12-month internship with flexibility on the dates. Flexible working arrangements can be made for those enrolled in full-time degree programs. In the event of COVID-19 restrictions, we expect interns to be able to work fully remotely as needed, and join team meetings and other calls virtually.
 Note 
We offer a demanding, yet supportive and collaborative work environment where ideas and ingenuity matter. Apply today if you‚Äôre ready to grow and help us make a real impact in the world.
Please submit resume and cover letter illustrating how your experience and skills will contribute to the department and any unique qualities you bring to the position. If applying via Indeed, please upload your resume and any supporting documentation as one attachment. Any application that does not include both a resume and cover letter will be rejected.

Here at EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We‚Äôll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you‚Äôll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future ‚Äì all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The opportunity: your next adventure awaits

Strategy and Transaction (SaT) works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimizing, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within SaT include Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) ‚Äì that will bring together Transaction Diligence (TD), Valuation, Modeling and Economics (VME), and Lead Advisory (LA). Uniquely, SaT brings together a world-class strategy practice in EY-Parthenon, an unmatched Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) capability and the deep Tax expertise delivered via International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS). Given the longstanding and deep relationships of these competencies with our clients, our sub-service lines will allow our practice to drive further growth to an already successful practice and continue to be key drivers of innovation within our business.

The EY-Parthenon team in EY Singapore focuses on addressing CXO agenda in Strategy, Commercial Due Diligence, Integration/divestments and Value Creation. This high-performing team has grown rapidly over the last two years and has experienced hires joining from top management consulting firms. We are very active in the market with several deep accounts focused on key sectors of Consumer, Healthcare & Life Sciences, Resources & Financial Services.

 
Strategy unlocks our clients‚Äô full potential by helping them answer their most complex strategic questions. We rely upon rigorous fact-based analysis and deep sector expertise to deliver insights that provoke unconventional thinking. We help clients create customized and actionable strategies, and then we help to make them happen.
Transaction Strategy and Execution assist clients to integrate acquired assets and businesses, providing strategic transaction advice and supporting execution to attain the value proposition contained in the strategic decision-making process.
Turnaround and Restructuring provides leadership to rapidly solve, execute and ultimately transform the outcome during urgent, critical and complex situations.
 

What we look for

 
You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We‚Äôre looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
You are curious and purpose driven. We‚Äôre looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
You are inclusive. We‚Äôre looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust. 
 

Qualifications:

 
Pursuing university degree related to Accounting, Business, Finance, Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics with demonstrated interest.
Demonstrated passion in related work with strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills to analyze financial and non-financial information to formulate views and conclusions. This passion could be demonstrated via university projects, internships, conferences, self-study, etc.
 

What‚Äôs in it for you

 
Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs.
Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds ‚Äî both professionally and culturally.
Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development.
Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society ‚Äì building a better working world, together.
 

What you can expect

 
You may expect up to 3 case study interview rounds with the hiring team.
Please note that for your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application: 
Full detailed resume - Kindly note that minimum internship commitment period is 8 weeks 
Latest university transcript
 
Please note that applications are shortlisted on a rolling basis. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Title: Commercial Finance Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn‚Äôt about conforming to somebody else‚Äôs ideal. It‚Äôs about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.

THE ROLE

Division: Cross-Bus., Finance, CoPilot

Job Title: Commercial Finance Intern

About The Role‚Ä¶

Through this role, you‚Äôll be able to gain an understanding of:


Commercial finance role: provide support to commercial team (sales & marketing) & working with cross-functional teams (custodian finance, supply chain, customer service, APAC finance team etc) to drive business growth & business operation
Financial planning process (3 year plan, annual budget, monthly forecasting etc)
Financial analysis, understand drivers of variances vs budget/forecast & last year, identify gaps & make recommendations
Preparation of management reports for markets & total SEA region
Financial control & SOX compliance
Evaluating deals (pricing), promotion activities, capital expenditure investment, ROI etc
Monitoring & tracking of expenses
Managing collection & overdue 
Use of Accounting & Business intelligent systems such as SAP, SAP BI, HFM, Power BI dashboard, Hyperion Smartview, Ariba & Kinaxis
Set-up RSP/invoice prices/trade margin in SAP via Nintex


Key Responsibilities

In this role you will be responsible for:

Support Finance Manager in the co-pilot role for Singapore & Malaysia markets


Financial planning (Budgeting & Monthly Forecast)
Prepare monthly key performances / management reports including identify variances & provide commentary on the key drivers
Prepare weekly sales tracker and shipment status
Month-end closing process including preparing of journals and reviewing of P&L
Prepare monthly / quarterly management reports for commercial team, SEA & APAC teams
Monthly / Quarterly financial control & SOX compliance ‚Äì monthly Balance sheet & accruals review, provide evidence / supporting documents etc
Evaluating deals, promotion activities, capital expenditure investment, ROI etc
Monitoring & tracking of A&CP spend, etc.
Monitoring & tracking collection from customers & overdue (DSO)
Assess reasonableness of profit margins for new product developments
Set-up RSP / invoice prices in SAP via Nintex / Pricing controls
Maintaining price updates in Kinaxis / STREAM
Identify process improvement opportunities
Assist in internal audit requests
Assist in new projects


Consolidation & report preparation SEA region


Monthly & Quarterly management reports
Ad-hoc requests from Global & APAC team
Follow up with markets / business units on report submission, due dates etc
Develop user friendly templates for data collection


What You‚Äôll Bring

ESSENTIAL:


Undergraduates who can commit for at least 6 months (Jul to Dec 2024) for a full-time internship.
Skilled in the use of MS Office tools including Outlook (or related email tool) Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Self-motivated and self-starter, with a strong work ethic and a sense of confidentiality.
Possesses cross-cultural awareness and high emotional intelligence.
Articulate, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Good balance of a professional attitude while having fun.
Strong interest in consumer goods, makeup and beauty products.
Strong desire to learn along with a strong sense of ownership.
Persuasive, resilient and flexible, able to easily adapt to new challenges.
Passionate, enthusiastic and driven to regularly follow-up with loose ends.
Able to thrive despite challenges while adopting a positive attitude under pressure.


LEARNING OUTCOMES


Role of commercial finance/co-pilot
Accounting policies & transactions/accounting entries
Processes: management reporting, financial planning process, financial analysis & financial control & SOX compliance
Systems: SAP, SAP BI, HFM, Hyperion Smartview, Kinaxis etc.
Working in a Cross-functional organization / inter-department (markets/business units).

Title: Financial Risk Analyst Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
At Ripple, we‚Äôre building a world where value moves like information does today. It‚Äôs big, it‚Äôs bold, and we‚Äôre already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.

If you‚Äôre ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.

Ripple is building the world‚Äôs next-generation payment network backed by our advanced blockchain technology. RippleNet, Ripple‚Äôs core product, makes it easier than it‚Äôs ever been for our customers to run a high-performance payments business. Ripple‚Äôs Finance organization plays a key role in the intraday and back-office operations required to run the RippleNet payments business.

The Work

Ripple is continuing to build and automate processes that enable the secure and scaled growth of RippleNet and we are looking for someone who is passionate about risk management and financial technology to join our Finance team. The team partners with the Product, Markets, and Sales teams to assess and manage the financial presence in Ripple‚Äôs business. The internship will be a great way to make contributions to the continued success of our products and also get started as an analyst in the fast-paced FinTech industry. You will get to meet and learn from diverse and talented colleagues across Finance, Product and Sales teams.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with commercial teams (Product, Engineering, Trading, Sales, Business Development) to gather customer information and analyze customer risk profiles
Review financial statements and perform credit underwriting for accurate risk scoring
Manage a credit portfolio to proactively mitigate risk
Operationalize risk management processes, procedures, and systems


What We're Looking For


Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or in a graduate program, preferably in a quantitative field, economics, finance, MFE, etc
Experience with SQL, Python or R, and some data visualization tools (ie. Tableau) a plus
Passionate about financial risk management
Familiarity with financial statements analysis
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable collaborating with cross-functional teams using strong written and verbal communication skills
Leads with inclusive actions and has a strong work ethic and team player
Basic understanding of Credit Risk and lending, especially with Moody‚Äôs credit risk products is a plus
Demonstrated interest or experience in markets, crypto, credit/trading is plus


Who We Are

Do Your Best Work


The opportunity to build in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact. A professional development budget to support other modes of learning.
Thrive in an environment where no matter what race, ethnicity, gender, origin, or culture they identify with, every employee is a respected, valued, and empowered part of the team.
Ripple is Flexible First: in-office collaboration for moments that matter is important to our culture, and we give managers and teams the flexibility to decide which 10+ days a month they come in.
Weekly all-company meeting - business updates and ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
We come together for moments that matter which include team offsites, team bonding activities, happy hours and more!


Take Control of Your Finances


Competitive salary, bonuses, and equity
Competitive benefits that cover physical and mental healthcare, retirement, family forming, and family support
Employee giving match
Mobile phone stipend


Take Care of Yourself


Twice a quarter R&R days so you can rest and recharge
Generous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite & virtual programming
Generous vacation policy - work with your manager to take time off when you need it
Industry-leading parental leave policies. Family planning benefits.
Catered lunches, fully-stocked kitchens with premium snacks/beverages, and plenty of fun events


Benefits listed above are for full-time employees. 

Ripple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

Please find our UK/EU Applicant Privacy Notice and our California Applicant Privacy Notice for reference.

Title: RPA intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Location: Singapore, Singapore

Thales people architect solutions that enable two-thirds of planes to take off and land safely. We create in-flight entertainment systems that engross 50 million fliers every year and we develop the avionics that control the world‚Äôs largest commercial aircrafts. Our simulators train the next generation of pilots for fighter jets, transporters and search and rescue helicopters. And, together, each and every member of our aerospace team makes a difference.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.

Position Summary:

Thales AVS in Singapore conducts manufacturing and repair activities for aircraft OEM and airlines respectively.

This position is with the AVS repair unit in Singapore. The person joining will be working on Operations Support activities for the repair unit. The repair unit (ARU, Autonomous Repair Unit) is responsible for avionics, in-flight entertainment and electrical systems maintenance, repair and overhaul activities.In the course of your work, you have the opportunity to participate in the processes relating to different products, such as flight control, communication, navigations, in-flight entertainment, electrical conversion systems, etc. There will be opportunities to learn how the different operational processes in repair, engineering, supply chain, logistics, etc to deliver the required support to airlines, allowing their aircrafts to depart and operate seamlessly, safely and timely

Main Tasks & Responsibilities:

Design, developing, document and testing for process automation with RPA Robotic Programming.

Title: Project Intern [Jul - Dec 2024] - Investment Group/Portfolio Development Group (Singapore)
Description Snippet:
About the job
We are looking for a project intern‚ÄØto join one of our teams in the second half of 2024. You will be working closely with one of our teams (description of hiring teams below) with key responsibilities and opportunities including: 


Support evaluation of investment opportunities in companies through industry/company research and analysis 
Support scoping of value creation opportunities for portfolio companies such as: industry landscaping, peer benchmarking, strategy refocusing, JV/Partnership analysis 
Monitor market trends, performance of portfolio companies and supporting landscaping studies of companies in new sectors 
Prepare financial models and write investment memos 
Work closely with the team to support the preparation of presentations and analysis 


Qualifications/Capabilities


Pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in any discipline, preferably having taken modules in finance, accounting, corporate finance, or economics, and with a passion in investing 
Previous internship experience in investment banking, management consulting, private equity, venture capital or M&A / corporate development is preferred 
High level of interpersonal and communication skills 
Strong financial literacy, analytical skill and spreadsheet modelling skills 
Able to work well with diverse teams and deal with multiple stakeholders 
Self-starter with a proven ability to manage multiple priorities and to work independently 


Application Details 

Please state the following clearly in your resume/CV: 


Availability (Start Date - End Date) 
Team preference in order of ranking from most preferred to least preferred. 


Successful candidates will be assigned to a team based on preference indicated by both hiring team and candidate. We encourage you to apply early, as the application will be reviewed on a rolling basis. 

Team Description

Agri-Food 

The Agri-Food investment team helps innovative Agri-Food companies unlock their potential while making a difference in the world by offering sustainable solutions and delivering better diets. Our sub-sectors of interest encompass the entire Agri-Food value chain, and include alternative protein, vertical farming, digital platforms, and biotechnology among others. With over $10 billion invested since inception, the team‚Äôs investment portfolio consists of many market-leading and innovative companies and includes dozens of breakthrough and disruptive start-ups, of which 8 are unicorns. We are recognized as one of the leading investors and thought leaders in globally in Agri-Food, having been selected as the "Agritech Investor of the Year (2022)" by Agri Investor".

Financial Services 

The Financial Services team, with one of the largest portfolios in Temasek, invests globally in companies that benefit from long term secular themes such as the digitization of commerce and infrastructure. The team evaluates opportunities from early-stage disruptors to more mature cash generative companies listed in public markets, in core focus areas such as i) payments and commerce enablement, ii) capital market infrastructure, iii) financial software, iv) emerging market technology platforms and v) digital assets. 

 

Innovation 

The Innovation team is responsible for identifying and investing in promising early stage and high growth companies globally across sectors. The team is focused on investing in disruptive technology companies at Series C and earlier. There is a global mandate with a core focus in North America, Europe, Israel and SEA. Portfolio companies include Zipline, Perfect Day, Solugen, Truelayer, Solid Energy and PortalOne, among others. 

Industrials, Business Services, Energy & Resources (IBE) 

IBE is a sector-focused team that looks to build deep domain knowledge across the Industrials, Business Services and Energy industries to identify and invest in both public and private companies globally. Examples of IBE‚Äôs investment focus areas include companies which support the clean energy transition, develop circular economies and enable advanced industrial manufacturing.

Impact Investing 

Impact Investing team focuses on investing into innovative business solutions that tackle challenges for the underserved demographic across global emerging markets. Sectors of interest include financial services, healthcare, agriculture, education, and climate.

Our strategy predominantly focuses on fund investments by supporting leading impact fund managers (both private equity and venture capital) while developing a portfolio of direct / co-investments to deepen the impact. Beyond investments, the team also has developed its proprietary Impact Management and Measurement framework and actively engages with the impact investing ecosystem to advance impact practice. The team is also actively involved in broader impact ecosystem building, collaborating with partners in Asia and beyond, incl. Centre for Impact Investing & Practices, GIIN, etc.

Potential candidate should be passionate about making a difference, preferably with skillsets and demonstrated interests in emerging markets, finance / investing and impact methodologies/measurement.

Private Equity Fund Investments (PEFI) 

PEFI invests in many of the world‚Äôs premier Private Equity fund managers. With a portfolio that spans across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we generate many fund and direct co-investment opportunities in different industries globally. The successful candidate will have hands-on experience of both Private Equity fund and direct investments opportunities alongside our global investment team.

POD-Artificial Intelligence (POD-AI) 

The AI Pod aims to build deep expertise and make strategic investments in AI to empower Temasek and its portfolio ecosystem to deliver better commercial outcomes. The AI Pod has set up a number of ventures, including Minden.ai and Aicadium. 

Potential candidate should ideally have an interest in the field of AI, preferably with a background in either finance/VC/investing or software engineering.

 

Portfolio Development Group (PDG) 

PDG is constituted as a focused team to partner select major portfolio companies on strategic repositioning and/or value creation initiatives. It works closely with the Boards and Management of these portfolio companies to (i) perform strategic reviews of current business lines in light of changing industry conditions, (ii) determine point-of-arrival and identify capability gaps, and (iii) evaluate and execute on strategic initiatives that would reposition the company and its stakeholders for sustainable and profitable long-term growth. Examples of strategic initiatives that could be undertaken include - transformational M&A, corporate restructuring, JV/partnerships for new markets, etc. 

South East Asia (SEA)

SEA team invests in companies in SEA region, with a focus on regional companies (mostly Singapore based companies serving the region), Indonesia and Vietnam. The team evaluates opportunities from early-stage disruptors to more mature cash generative companies listed in public markets, in focus sectors such as i) financial services, ii) technology & consumer, iii) logistics, and iv) healthcare.

Structuring & Execution 

S&E is Temasek‚Äôs in-house M&A specialist team within the Investment Group and focuses on structuring and executing large and complex transactions for Temasek. The team has worked on >US$20b of announced deals in 2022, spanning various sectors and geographies. Examples of transactions include public and private M&A, JVs, capital raises and restructuring, among others.

The successful candidate will be joining a lean and highly collaborative team, working closely with various teams across the Temasek ecosystem. This internship also provides the opportunity for candidates to hone their corporate finance skills and a springboard into investment banking, with past interns placing into Tier 1 investment banks / private equity firms.

Technology & Consumer (T&C)

The Technology & Consumer team invests globally along key long term secular themes including technology enablement, digitization and the future of consumption. The team invests across a diverse set of opportunities along the entire life cycle of companies from early stage, growth equity, and late stage/ buyout situations in the private domain, to various opportunities in listed assets. Core focus areas for the team include (i) digital infrastructure and technology enablers, (ii) leading platforms powering digitization across consumers and enterprises, (iii) leading and emerging consumer franchises, and (iv) developing technologies for the next generation of use cases.

About the job

Title: Murex Internship
Description Snippet:
About the job
