Title: Rev-celerator Internship Programme: Creative Marketing Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 40+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 8,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

ABOUT THE REV-CELERATOR PROGRAMME üéì

If you‚Äôre in your penultimate year of study, this one‚Äôs for you. You‚Äôll work with us for three months and get to know everything we do.

First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we‚Äôll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to start working on your skills. After a successful preparation, we‚Äôll launch you into on-the-job training. At this stage, you‚Äôll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own.

About the team:

If Revolut is a rocket ship ‚Äî and we like to think it's ‚Äì Product Marketing is what propels us past the competition in the eyes of our customers üöÄ

Working with Product, Design, Data Science, Engineering, Growth, and just about any other team you can think of, our superstar Product Marketers help develop jaw-dropping products, then show off how beneficial they are to millions of people through killer campaigns.

If that sounds like a blast to you (trust us, it's) come join the #DreamTeam ‚≠ê

We're looking for #NeverSettle #GetItDone Marketing Interns to join the Creative team and keep on bringing our kick-ass products to market. Come join the (always wild, never dull) ride ü¶Ñ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Identifying user needs by deeply understanding our customers, and how our product works globally, to create data-driven, actionable insights for product teams
Supporting go-to-market launch strategies by owning development of audience strategy, value proposition, messaging, positioning, and PR strategies
Developing research plans to uncover customer insights, steer, and validate the product roadmap, and stay on top of the competitive landscape
Working closely with product and marketing teams to brief them with the user insights, value props, and messaging to successfully execute go-to-market campaigns
Supporting experiments to test hypotheses and bring analytical rigour to campaigns to inform the go-to-market strategy
Working on and helping to execute campaigns with a strong bias for growth and business impact
Scaling product marketing efforts globally by operationalising resources such as playbooks for regional marketing teams
Carrying out competitor research to inform and provide actionable points to marketing, product, and sales on our product positioning 


What You'll Need


Excellent project management skills and attention to detail
Fluency in English
An ability to analyse and distil data into actionable insights
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
Great writing skills
Social media knowledge
Proactive attitude
To feel comfortable working as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
A passion for Revolut‚Äôs products, as well as a knowledge of markets and competitive landscape in the Fintech or payments industry


Nice to have


Previous internship experience in marketing area


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Digital Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
We‚Äôre seeking a Digital Intern who is passionate about creating high-quality digital experiences to engage students and staff at Falmouth University. Expanding on the success of our online degree portfolio, you‚Äôll help manage and improve the accessibility of video content to create inclusive learning experience. You will also support continued improvements to our digital delivery, working closely with course teams and the Digital Learning Team to ensure modules are digitally enhanced.

A key part of the role will involve editing transcripts and ensuring accuracy as part of the Digital Learning Team and a small team of Digital Interns. You‚Äôll also be required to work with the wider Digital Learning Team on ensuring digital content and module resources follow best practice guidance and are digitally accessible.

The successful candidates for this role will be a recent graduate from Falmouth University who needs to have excellent IT knowledge, as well as strong skills in Adobe Creative Cloud, Microsoft 365 and Teams. You will have an eye for detail, be good at on-the-spot creative problem solving and have experience in editing content and digital materials. The individual should be enthusiastic and eager to contribute to enhancing the educational experience for students.

We are looking to hear from candidates who have the following skills:


Experience and confidence in using a wide variety of digital tools 
Adaptability and teamwork skills 
Able to prioritise work and be efficient at working to deadlines 
Possess excellent communication skills 



For further details on the skills/experience required for this role, please see the full job description above.

This is a fixed term for 12 months, full-time, 35 hours a week position across Monday-Friday. If you are looking to have an informal discussion about the vacancy ahead of applying, please email recruitment@falmouth.ac.uk.

Although this role is principally remotely based, there will be a requirement for the role holder to occasionally work from our campus in Penryn.

The closing date for this position is Tuesday 19 March 2024.

For more than 120 years, Falmouth University has been a hub of creative and technological education and change. We are Cornwall‚Äôs University, a strong local and anchor institution within its defining rural and coastal community.

Our mission is to deliver exceptional higher education and research, harnessing the fusion of creativity and technology as foundations of the future economy. We use our knowledge and expertise in these disciplines to generate positive and sustainable opportunities for all.

In return for your hard work and commitment, we offer excellent benefits, including:


 Employer Pension Contribution up to 12%.
 28 days + 8 days bank holiday.
 Annual salary increments (Until top of grade reached)
 Enhanced Maternity/Paternity Pay/Adoption Pay
 Salary Sacrifice Car Scheme (Tusker)
 Salary Sacrifice Cycle Scheme
 Salary Sacrifice Home & Tech Scheme
 Life Assurance



Full details on our employee benefits can be found on our careers page www.falmouth.ac.uk/jobs. Alongside these benefits we offer a first class working environment across our campuses with all the facilities you would expect from a leading University.

A successful external candidate for this position would be employed by Falmouth Staffing Ltd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Falmouth University. Employees of Falmouth Staffing Ltd work alongside Falmouth University colleagues in the delivery of Falmouth‚Äôs strategic vision and will adopt Falmouth University‚Äôs HR policies and procedures in full.

Falmouth University welcomes and encourages job applications from people of all identities and backgrounds, particularly those under-represented and/or marginalised, as it is important we have a diverse range of candidates to consider.

Title: Financial Management Development Program Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description Summary

Job Description

GEHC UK Financial Management Development Program Intern

Job Description Summary 

We are looking to employ an enthusiastic and driven Finance Intern (12 months) to play a key role in our Health Care Systems (HCS) or Pharmaceutical Diagnostics‚Äô (PDx) Finance Teams. You would be applying to be considered for one of five select internships, covering areas like Financial Planning & Analysis, Controllership, Commercial Finance and Product Finance. You will be working with Finance Leaders across the business and be exposed to a teams and function in and out of your direct scope. To be successful as a Finance Intern, you should have strong analytical skills, be a clear communicator, proficient in excel and adaptable to working in changing and ambiguous situations.

A Finance Internship within GE HealthCare (GEHC) is designed to enable undergraduates pursing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree to gain hands-on work experience as the foundation of their professional lives. As an Intern you will receive specific supervision from both a direct manager, and a people leader, with the aim of nurturing your technical and soft skills to develop you into a well-rounded finance individual. There will also be the opportunity to, at the end of your internship, apply for a place on the Financial Management Development Program (FMDP), which would start at the end of your studies. By applying for this internship, your application will automatically be considered for a variety of finance roles that match our graduate programs skill set.

Fixed-Term Contract: 12 Months Office-Based in Chalfont St. Giles, Greater London Area, UK. Target Start Date: July 2024

Roles and Responsibilities ‚Äì Change depending on assigned role, but will revolve around:


Contribute to the activities your finance team in the areas mentioned above, developing technical finance skills alongside corporate specific soft skills. 
Partner and collaborate with wider internal business unit teams to drive execution and financial performance of GE HealthCare.
Develop an understanding of key business drivers to inform your work. Gain insights into how your team's efforts integrate with other teams and contribute to broader objectives.
Engage with the wider Intern Community in an Internship Curriculum, networking events, along with charity and volunteering events. 
Operate within a team setting under the guidance of an Assignment Leader and Program Rep.


Required Qualifications And Desired Characteristics


Taking a placement year as part of a curriculum leading to a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree from an accredited university, college, or school.
Carries themselves with a positive attitude, a team player and able to deliver expected results on time.
Confident, self-motivated, able to demonstrate initiative and work with limited supervision when needed.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, highly numerate with a good attention to detail.
Confident in both oral and written communication.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and main Microsoft Office applications.
Fluent in English.
Must have unlimited authorization to work in hiring country. GE Healthcare does not sponsor visas for internships.


The Internship...


Contract Length: 12 months
Start Date: Likely to be 15th July 2024.
You will gain hands-on experience working on business-critical task and projects, while also participating in driving the wider intern community.
You will have guided development which can potentially gain you a place on the FMDP Scheme if successful in the internship: https://jobs.gecareers.com/healthcare/global/en/fmdp.


Please submit your CV (no cover letter required) if you'd like to apply. If you pass through the CV Round, you will be invited to complete an on-line application questionnaire via HireVue - you must complete this to be considered for the role.

Inclusion and Diversity

GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration, and support.

Title: AE Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

Job Overview

We‚Äôre looking for an Engineering graduate for a 1-year internship, based in our offices in either Bracknell, Cambridge or London office. The intern will start at Cadence in June/July 2024.

As an intern, you will have a major role in front line support for customers, plus you will be involved with multinational engineering teams dealing with design related issues covering thermal, analog, digital, & verification tasks for ICs and systems. You will greatly expand your knowledge on the technical aspect of design automation, use Cadence's cutting edge tools and attend excellent technical training courses.

Employees join Cadence because of our innovation and stay because of our culture. Working at Cadence means working alongside the industry‚Äôs brightest people and innovating for some of the biggest companies around the globe. Our employees feel empowered and supported to make their mark on the future of technology. We are recognised as a Great Place to Do Great Work.

Job Responsibilities

This is a great opportunity to gain in depth experience with Design Automation tools and to familiarize yourself with the semiconductor design and methodologies. In this internship there are few limits; it's up to you to decide how much you want to deepen your knowledge and push for personal excellence. Specifically, you will be responsible for helping Cadence with respect to:

Title: Cambridge SupTech Lab Analyst Intern: Data and Insights, Digital Tools
Description Snippet:
About the job

Role: Analyst Intern: Data and Insights, Digital Tools

Project: Cambridge SupTech Lab

Expertise: Financial Supervision, Data, Technology, Innovation Design

Start Date: Immediately

Duration: 6 months 

Level of effort: Full-time 

Location: Global (Remote working)




About the Cambridge SupTech Lab

The Cambridge SupTech Lab partners with financial authorities, technology firms and data scientists to craft solutions addressing the emergent gaps between the speed of digitalisation of financial services and the speed at which public agencies can innovate. 




As an initiative of the Cambridge Centre for Alternative Finance (CCAF) at the University of Cambridge Judge Business School, the Cambridge SupTech Lab accelerates the digital transformation of financial supervision through the creation of supervisory technology (SupTech) applications that enable greater financial stability, integrity, protection of consumers and more scalable, sustainable, and responsible delivery of financial services.




This is achieved through a combination of: 

- Empirical research and the development of a shared body of knowledge 

- Co-creation of a scalable digital toolkit 

- Provision of education, training, peer learning and technical assistance.




Your role

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Analyst Intern (Data and Insights) to oversee the coordination, implementation, and successful delivery of projects related to the SupTech Launchpad and Digital Tools initiatives. As the Analyst, you will work with the Cambridge SupTech Lab team supporting the digital analysis and data management of the growing suite of products within the Lab‚Äôs digital toolkit, which each serve a global user base of financial supervisors, private sector vendors, and researchers.




More specifically, this role will encompass the category of ‚ÄúIntelligence Tools‚Äù that serve to provide insights into the growing SupTech ecosystem, and the key stakeholders driving and benefiting from that growth.

Responsibilities 




Conduct administrative management of the existing set of digital tools falling under the ‚Äúintelligence‚Äù pillar, namely the SupTech Vendor Database, SupTech Solutions Tracker, Open Data Library, Open Code Repository
Hold responsibility for the accuracy and timeliness of data underlying these tools, including via active and continuous desk research, solicitation of inputs from the core team, engagement in relevant events, etc.
Deliver highly valuable product analytics and reporting to extend richer understanding of the tools‚Äô users and tools‚Äô performances.
Assist with development and maintenance of data schema and data sources for these tools, and study data and analyze trends to answer critical business and product questions.
Engage with the entities listed in the tools (e.g. vendors, financial authorities) as necessary, to ensure accuracy and utility of the tool.
Coordinate with the product management and software development team(s) to develop roadmaps, identify areas of improvement, drive improvement efforts of existing tools and introduction of new tools (e.g. Pulse)
Coordinate and support interns and other staff, and incorporate design/usability inputs, feedback, marketing, and outreach.




Requirements and qualifications




Essential:

Experience in administrative management of digital tools. 
Analytical skills, including product instrumentation and frameworks (e.g. pirate metrics); demonstrated ability to cut through noisy data to find strong signals.
Excellent written and oral communication, and organizational abilities. This includes a commitment to the Lab‚Äôs core principles of demonstrating empathy first, then transparency, to unlock creativity. 
Fluent or native English speaker 
Driven and committed, demonstrating initiative, self-motivation, and eagerness to familiarize with new concepts. 
Excellent time management and planning skills with a commitment to deliver and being held accountable. 
Ability to work independently as well as working as a team player within interdisciplinary groups on collaborative projects. 




Desirable:

Experience in fintech, financial services regulation or supervision, content analysis, data curation, or data science or consulting. 
Masters or PhD with a background preferably in business, design, entrepreneurship, data science, computer science or engineering, or social sciences. 
Direct experience of working with/for a tool for financial regulators/central banks/relevant authorities. 
Strong writing and communication skills (English) 
Able to organize ideas logically and effectively, while clearly communicating those that are interesting and important to specific underlying research-related topics. 
Comfort in exploring data and impact measurement goals and assessing product performance actuals against these projections.




Candidates need to succeed in technical skills, but also need to embody soft skills to achieve long-term success at Cambridge SupTech Lab:

Emotional intelligence, communication & empathy ‚Äì How is your ability to collaborate effectively with others and work in teams, build relationships, share ideas, and manage conflict?
Creativity & problem-solving skills ‚Äì Are you an analytical and critical thinker? Can you find creative solutions to problems?
Adaptability & flexibility ‚Äì Our working environment and culture requires you to be agile and adaptable to succeed in this role. Are these your qualities?




What we offer

An internship and a team with a purpose. This is a chance to work on actual challenges in the financial sector that greatly affect our economies and society as a whole, and to have a real impact using data and tech to transform the public sector.
True commitment to innovation and to break new ground in this field.
Exposure to leading thinkers, researchers, and solution creators in the financial and tech space, and in the academic world as well.
Opportunities to frame evidence-based discussions in a rapidly evolving niche industry.
Opportunities to develop and lead a growth area within the policy and tech field.
Significant professional growth potential.
Competitive compensation. 
Flexible work schedule.







How to apply

Send your CV and cover letter to suptech-lab-jobs@jbs.cam.ac.uk

Title: Finance Graduate Intern - WBSL (Leavesden, Watford)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.

Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery‚Ä¶ the stuff dreams are made of.

Who We Are‚Ä¶

When we say, ‚Äúthe stuff dreams are made of,‚Äù we‚Äôre not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD‚Äôs vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what‚Äôs next‚Ä¶

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

Our studios are considered one of the foremost motion picture and television production and post-production facilities in the world. They inform, engage, and transport audiences to new worlds. The key to that lies with our Studio Operations group, which includes areas like soundstage/backlot set rentals, events, design, culinary, construction, landscaping and much more. Whether it‚Äôs hosting an unforgettable studio tour, creating an optimal workspace, or equipping talent to tell the best stories, these teams lay the foundation for the memorable experiences we provide.

Your New Role‚Ä¶

This position works at Warner Bros. Studios Leavesden (WBSL) reporting to the Studio Operations Finance Manager but will be supporting all divisions including Tours & Retail. The primary purpose of this role is to support the Studio Ops and Tours & Retail team in project work and provide cover for key operations processes. The intern will be responsible in ensuring all Studio bookings, revenues and costs are appropriately reported and reconciled whilst maintaining all back up documents.

Your Role Accountabilities‚Ä¶


Regular review of Xytech work orders.
Liaise with Productions, Finance and COE teams for any invoice/PO query resolution.
Prepare ad hoc reconciliations (e.g., cash receipts, Adyen reports)
Provide cover for Client services team with issuing invoices and management of production contracts to ensure accurate invoicing.
Downloading and collating reports as required.
Raising POs as required
Reviewing system interfaces with technology team
Support cash office processes as required.
Preparation of data for royalty reporting
Running and refreshing month end bridge reports and other Lux reports
Ensure all Warner Bros policies and procedures are followed.


Qualifications & Experience‚Ä¶


You must be a recent university graduate, having graduated no earlier than July 2022. 
Advanced Excel experience.
Experience of providing reports and analyzing data.
Highly numerical with exceptional attention to detail.
Effective verbal and written communication skills.
Working knowledge of SAP desirable, but not essential.
Able to convey information in a clear and succinct manner.
Desire to produce accurate, reliable, and high-quality work in a timely manner.


The Internship...


Salary: ¬£27,000 
Contract Length: 12 months 
Start Date: Likely to be 9th September 2024 
You will gain hands-on experience working on business-critical projects. 
You will have access to personal and professional development courses, executive speakers‚Äô series, special screenings and more. 
You will be part of our Early Talent network of over 100 interns & apprentices, meaning you will have an important support network of other students, graduates and apprentices and plenty of opportunities to socialise! 


Next Steps‚Ä¶ 


Stage 1: Submit your CV by Sunday 17th March (you will not be able to apply after this date). 
Stage 2: For eligible candidates, you will be invited to complete a written questionnaire in HireVue. The deadline for this is Sunday 24th March. 
Stage 3: Pre-recorded video interviews via HireVue will be sent out, to be completed in April. 
Stage 4: Assessment Centres & Interviews will take place May-June. 


 

Due to the volume of applications we receive we are unable to provide individual feedback, but if you are unsuccessful we will aim to let you know within 6 weeks of the closing date. 

How We Get Things Done‚Ä¶

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

The Legal Bits‚Ä¶

Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.

If you‚Äôre a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

Title: PhD Research/Software Engineer Intern, Bot and Fraud Detection (Summer 2024)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Us

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world‚Äôs largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine‚Äôs Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

Available Locations: Austin, Remote US, London, Remote UK About the Team

At Cloudflare, our engineering and research team combines the expertise of some of the industry‚Äôs most talented professionals in both software engineering and advanced research. Our Bot and Fraud Detection Research and Development team focuses on innovating and developing leading-edge solutions to combat online fraud and bot activities, thereby ensuring the highest levels of security and integrity for online platforms. Collaborating closely with product development and engineering groups, our researchers play a crucial role in advancing our fraud detection products through identification of new signals and refining our bot detection algorithms.

What You'll Do

During the 12-16 weeks of internship, as a researcher intern in our bot and fraud detection team, you will do one or more of the following:


Engage in cutting-edge research to design, develop, and enhance our fraud detection products;
Apply your knowledge in data science and machine learning to analyze and interpret vast datasets, contributing to the fight against sophisticated online attackers;
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate research findings into practical, scalable solutions;
Utilize and improve upon our technology stack, which includes Python, Rust, Kafka, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, and Clickhouse;
Make significant contributions to the field of bot and fraud detection, impacting the security of online applications globally.



What Are We Looking For?


Current full-time Ph.D. candidate in the fields of Computer Science, Data Science, or Cybersecurity.
Proven track record of research in academia or industry, preferably in areas related to cybersecurity, bot detection, browser fingerprinting, fraud detection, or machine learning.
Expertise in web security, network protocols, and web application architectures.
Demonstrated ability to work with large-scale datasets and distributed computing.



Bonus points


Experience in developing and implementing bot detection and fraud prevention strategies.
Publication record in peer-reviewed venues or industry conferences in relevant fields.
Familiarity with cloud computing environments and big data technologies.
Experience with productionizing machine learning models.
Experience with technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, Salt.
Familiarity with writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries.
Experience with columnar databases such as Clickhouse.



What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We‚Äôre not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We‚Äôre a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare‚Äôs enterprise customers--at no cost.

 Athenian Project  : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.

1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here‚Äôs the deal - we don‚Äôt store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you‚Äôd like to be a part of? We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Title: Marketing & PR Graduate Intern (Leavesden, Watford)
Description Snippet:
About the job
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.

Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery‚Ä¶ the stuff dreams are made of.

Who We Are‚Ä¶

When we say, ‚Äúthe stuff dreams are made of,‚Äù we‚Äôre not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD‚Äôs vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what‚Äôs next‚Ä¶

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

Your New Role‚Ä¶

The intern will assist in the development and execution of Marketing and PR campaigns for all areas of Warner Bros. Studio Tour London. Reporting to the Head of Marketing, the Marketing and PR Intern will be responsible for supporting the marketing and communications teams with general administration, ensuring the smooth running of the department.

Your Role Accountabilities‚Ä¶


Update the asset library with new brand assets and campaign collateral.
Provide support to PR team including managing media requests, assistance during busy campaigns / periods, compile press packs / event materials and general administration.
Assist with the organisation of press trips / visits and help handle ticket requests for VIPs (ensuring tickets are issued via the call centre).
Assist with organisation of any marketing events (internal and external, consumer and trade) ensuring all promotional material is delivered on time.
Provide operational support during photo and video shoots.
Set up and implement third party and website competitions, seeking internal and third-party approvals and prize fulfilment.
Check social media channels daily and report any issues to relevant departments.
Assist in updating and sourcing content for the website through a CMS system.
Coordinate online submission requests to the online and PR inboxes.
Evaluate competitor websites and review feedback in the form of a report to the rest of the team and Directors.
Budget responsibilities to include raising Purchase Orders and setting up new suppliers.
Provide high levels of customer service and relationship management to other departments and our key partners, delivering beyond service expectations.


Qualifications & Experience‚Ä¶


You must be a recent university graduate, having graduated no earlier than July 2022. 
Passionate about pursuing a career in Marketing & PR.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Good with numbers and Excel.
Social media usage experience.
Excellent organisation and prioritisation skills.
Ability to cope in a busy and challenging environment and work to fast deadlines.
Outgoing and friendly demeanor to all members of the Studio Tour staff.
Experience in the leisure / tourism / attractions industry is a bonus.


The Internship...


Salary: ¬£27,000 
Contract Length: 12 months 
Start Date: Likely to be 9th September 2024 
You will gain hands-on experience working on business-critical projects. 
You will have access to personal and professional development courses, executive speakers‚Äô series, special screenings and more. 
You will be part of our Early Talent network of over 100 interns & apprentices, meaning you will have an important support network of other students, graduates and apprentices and plenty of opportunities to socialise! 


Next Steps‚Ä¶ 


Stage 1: Submit your CV by Sunday 17th March (you will not be able to apply after this date). 
Stage 2: For eligible candidates, you will be invited to complete a written questionnaire in HireVue. The deadline for this is Sunday 24th March. 
Stage 3: Pre-recorded video interviews via HireVue will be sent out, to be completed in April. 
Stage 4: Assessment Centres & Interviews will take place May-June. 


 

Due to the volume of applications we receive we are unable to provide individual feedback, but if you are unsuccessful we will aim to let you know within 6 weeks of the closing date. 

How We Get Things Done‚Ä¶

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

The Legal Bits‚Ä¶

Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.

If you‚Äôre a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

Why us?

Clean and accessible energy is the key to a sustainable future on our planet!

Opportunities for career advancement as we are growing very fast in the EMEA region

Commitment to diversity and inclusion at Sungrow

3) We do not discriminate based on gender, age, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation or disability.

4) We do not use stock imagery in our career page, all photos and videos represent our internal culture.

About us

We are a green tech company with young creative minds.

We are fighting every day to make our mission happen ‚Äì Clean Power for All!

With ~400GW of clean power presently installed worldwide, we are on the road to success!

Welcome at Sungrow




Founded in 1997 by University Professor Cao Renxian, Sungrow is a leader in the research and development of solar inverters with the largest dedicated R&D team in the industry and a broad product portfolio offering PV inverter solutions and energy storage systems for utility-scale, commercial & industrial, and residential applications, as well as internationally recognized floating PV plant solutions, NEV driving solutions, EV charging solutions and renewable hydrogen production systems.

Title: Expression of Interest: Software Engineer Intern

About the job

We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.

Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.

Title: Bills Customer Support Intern (Summer Internship)
Description Snippet:
About the job
I WANT TO JOIN A STARTUP!

Well, you‚Äôre in the right place‚Ä¶We (Resooma) are on the hunt for what we describe as an ‚Äòall-rounder‚Äô** to join our team as our Summer Intern

What is a ‚ÄúResooma‚Äù? Good question

The short answer: Resooma is an early-stage London-based tech startup on a mission to simplify renting homes for you, the renter!

The slightly longer answer: Resooma is a very small team with some very big goals. We‚Äôre great at creating simple tech to solve complex rental issues, no experience needed. We currently enable renters to setup & manage utility bills through the platform and have some very cool property-finding tech coming in 2024

Sounds interesting, how do I join?

Easy partner, before we move on let‚Äôs start with you asking yourself some questions. Do you have zero issues speaking with perfect strangers? Are you an experienced social media user with a gift for crafting your own personal brand? Do you want to avoid coffee-making duty this year and actually do something interesting for your summer placement? ‚ÄúYes!‚Äù you say, read on‚Ä¶

You‚Äôre clearly on the right job advert so let‚Äôs look at the finer details to see if it‚Äôs a good fit:

Position - Summer Intern

Basic salary - ¬£18,000 ****(¬£1,500 per month)

Commission - Yes (on top of basic)

Type - Full-time (part-time available)

Dates - May > September (summer placement, some flexibility for earlier start/finish)

Location - Flexible hybrid (fully remote role + option to work from central London office)

The role in a nutshell: 


 Inbound customer support. Every year, thousands of renters come to Resooma to help them setup and manage their utilities. A major part of your role will be helping these people to find the right services for them and to show them how the Resooma platform works (product demos). You will offer support via Whatsapp, email and Zoom
 Representing on socials. If you want to see what we‚Äôre about, check out our TikTok & YT. Your role will be to amplify some of our most helpful content by sharing with your personal network and putting your own spin on it
 Connecting the dots. Outside of handling customer enquiries we want you to go hunting for opportunities. This could be in the form of deals with university sports teams, a brand collaboration that you think would hit right or introducing Resooma to your own letting agent/landlord. It‚Äôs up to you to find the opportunities and for the rest of the team to make them viable
 Flexibility. Working in an early-stage startup is exciting but comes with a level of uncertainty. This could be a new part of the product is released which then means you will need to adapt to the new offering + how you‚Äôre communicating it to customers. Every day is different and we‚Äôre looking for someone that can thrive in that problem-solving environment


FAQS

Will I be all alone? Oh hell no. We maybe a small remote team but you will be actively supported by your own line manager, team members from different departments, as well as having a direct relationship with our CEO

Everyone in the team regularly shares knowledge on their own work so each of us can continuously learn and develop

Expect daily team catch-ups, weekly 1:1s and plenty of workshop sessions so you can master your skills and deliver the best value for renters

Do I need to be based in London? Nope. We support a fully remote way of working so your location is not important, just your ability to deliver. We have a few team meetups per year so you can put a face to the Zoom call persona and to work on some of the more complex tasks that we face as a company

But, if you are a Londoner then your are welcome to work out of our dog-friendly Liverpool Street office which comes with a barista and beer/cider taps in the late afternoon (all free)

Will you let me apply if I don‚Äôt have fancy degree-level qualifications? Of course, we appreciate that a summer internship is more viable for students but if this role speaks to you and you think you would blow the roof off then send us your application

Whilst we‚Äôre on the subject of inclusivity, we are committed to creating a welcoming workplace; diversity and representation is key to the success of our business. Whoever you are, if you want to work at Resooma then you are our type of candidate

What have the biggest challenges been so far and what‚Äôs next?

Resooma‚Äôs biggest challenge is finding the right partners to plugin for our customers. We‚Äôve had a tough two years as we hadn‚Äôt got the utility providers right which created major issues with customer support but where there are issues there are learnings. We now have new utility providers supporting us and have already seen big improvements but we‚Äôre still searching for the right partners across property, insurance and other areas of renting to get them streamlined too

How to apply?

To apply, this is the MOST important thing to do when applying. Ensure that you quote the phrase ‚ÄúNOT SO NORMIE‚Äù at the top of your application email otherwise your email with be deleted along with all our joint hopes and dreams of making this relationship work. A good listener - or reader in this case - goes a lot further in Resooma than a good blagger so show that you‚Äôve read to the end

Title: Commercial Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
COMMERCIAL INTERN

Location - Hatfield / Hybrid

Internship date: 1st July to 23rd August 2024

Salary: ¬£11.50 per hour

About The Role

We are seeking an intern to join our Commercial team on an 8-week summer internship programme from 1st July to 23rd August 2024.

McCarthy Stone‚Äôs internship programme will provide you with an excellent experience where you will gain industry and field-related skills, and experience, while earning a competitive salary. Taking part in our programme will boost your CV and will ensure you have a deep understanding of our business, the industry that we operate in and an insight into our customers.

Supported by our friendly commercial team of estimators, buyers and quantity surveyors you will be actively involved in a wide range of cost management tasks that occur throughout the development and construction phase. In particular, you will become more familiar with construction cost planning and estimating, material and labour tendering and procurement as well as valuing and measuring completed works on site plus you will gain greater insight into our construction methods and the way we approach value engineering and standardisation.

Alongside your role, you will be part of a cohort of interns which will instantly enable you to start building your internal network at McCarthy Stone. There will also be a series of Learning & Development opportunities to get involved in throughout your journey with us including insight and skills sessions and lunch and learns on key business topics.

This internship is based in our divisional office in Hatfield. It is a hybrid role with a minimum of 3 days a week in the office.

About You

Education and Qualifications


Studying towards a degree in Quantity Surveying, Construction Management or Commercial Management on target for a minimum of a 2:2
3 x A Levels
GCSE‚Äôs in English and Maths


Personal Attributes 


Interested in a career within Commercial or Construction Management
Organised and works well to deadlines.
Able to multitask and prioritise.
Communicates clearly, both written and verbally.
Shows a good level of attention to detail.
Works well within a team, but equally on their own.
Good at building working relationships
Has a flexible, positive and can-do attitude
Computer literate and has experience in Microsoft Office software.


What Next?

Please make sure to upload your CV and answer all application questions. Our dedicated recruitment team will then be in touch to continue the process.

As part of the selection process, you will have an initial phone or video interview. If successful, you‚Äôll be invited to face-to-face interview.

The application deadline is 25th March 2024 

Please note that we are not able to offer company sponsorship for student visas.

If you have any queries or questions relating to this opportunity or the internship programme, please email

About Us

At McCarthy Stone, we believe that later life is filled with possibilities. We create warm and supportive retirement communities that bring people together to make lives more fulfilling. Everyone at McCarthy Stone is passionate about championing the role, wellbeing, and happiness of older people in society.

We aim to create a better understanding and appreciation of older people by playing our part in helping them to live happy and healthy lives. From senior executive positions to front-line colleagues, we have a shared vision of creating a thriving retirement community, built with innovation and heart, that celebrates later life.

We are delighted to be accredited as a Great Place to Work, and this reflects the evolving culture of excellence and inclusivity in our organisation, and the passion from our teams for what they do.

We recognise the successes, promotions, and achievements of everyone in our business and provide extensive Learning & Development opportunities to support and further you in your career.

McCarthy Stone celebrate diversity and promote equality and inclusion amongst our colleagues. We welcome applications from all, regardless of personal characteristics or background.

Title: Data Science Research Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description

The team you'll be part of

Bell Labs is a worldwide research and development community that focuses its efforts on key technologies for telecommunications. It is internationally renowned as the birthplace of modern information theory, the transistor, the laser and the UNIX operating system. Nowadays we are working on the network of 2020. In this new scenario of interconnected things, people will, almost more than ever before, matter. The Social Dynamics team in Cambridge UK works on the idea of a society empowered by digital data. As part of the emerging research area of ‚ÄúComputational Social Science‚Äù, the team answers questions typical of the social sciences using computational methods. The team provides a vibrant multidisciplinary research environment with close links to top academics.

Responsibilities

What you will learn and contribute to

Bell Labs Cambridge UK is currently seeking interns for the area of Data Science to fill 3-month research internship positions. The Data Science research, in Bell Labs - Cambridge, spans from advanced data mining to intelligent computational models.

A successful candidate is expected to have experience in the areas of Technology and Society, Visualization and Interaction Design, or Data Science.

Responsibilities:


Carry out an active and ambitious research project.
Publish the outcomes of the research in major scientific venues worldwide, including top conferences and journals.
Generate intellectual property through the patenting of ideas.


Required Skills

Your skills and experience


Candidates should ideally be enrolled in a PhD program in computer science, information science, interaction design, engineering or any related field.
Must have the ability to conduct independent research while also contributing to team-oriented projects that often span across multiple Bell Labs sites.
A proven record of publication(s) is highly valued, particularly in conference venues such as WWW, CHI, KDD, and CSCW, and journals such as PNAS and Science. 
A successful candidate will be versatile, flexible, hands-on, and a self-starter. Experience in development activities is also highly valued.
Strong written and spoken communications skills, able to participate in robust discussions in English.
Good research skills. 


About Us

 Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Title: One Year Management Placement / Internship ‚Äì Milton Keynes
Description Snippet:
About the job
Overview

We‚Äôre Enterprise Mobility. A family-owned, world-class portfolio of brands that in the UK includes household names such as Enterprise Rent-A-Car. A Times Top 100 Graduate Employer, we‚Äôve grown from a pioneering idea over 65-years ago, to the global mobility leader we are today. With a $35 billion turnover, nearly 90,000 team members and over 2.3 million vehicles across 95 countries, we‚Äôre here to advance the world, one journey at a time. Imagine what we could do for your career?

Once they join, our students play an integral role in the success of Enterprise and will have a comprehensive introduction to our Graduate Management Training Programme. For a university student, real world professional business experience can put you above the rest when you enter the job market.

Our interns go at a highly energised pace. From day one of your placement at Enterprise, you‚Äôll learn what it takes to run a successful business and acquire the highly marketable skills and experience that you get when you‚Äôre helping to run and operate a successful business. But don‚Äôt just take our word for it ‚Äì our interns have twice been voted Best Intern of the Year at the NUE awards.

Our university interns and placement students take on the same challenges on their internship as those that join us on our award-winning Graduate Management Programme. After an initial virtual classroom-based orientation session, you‚Äôll be assigned to a branch office for hands-on business training. It‚Äôs learning by doing, not by getting coffee or filing all day. Our promote-from-within culture will do the rest - ensuring that you‚Äôll have a well-rounded training experience and learn skills in management, finance, operations, sales and customer service.

Responsibilities

When you join our Management Placement and Internship Programme, you‚Äôll soon discover that every day is different because it is filled with so many new, exciting, rewarding, and often unexpected challenges. As well as getting the chance to put into practice all that you‚Äôve learned so far while at university, you‚Äôll also learn more hard and soft skills than you ever thought possible.

Not only is it a paid placement programme, but you may also be eligible for performance incentives and employee referral rewards, in the same way that those that join our Graduate Management Programme do too. The business training you‚Äôll receive will be an amazing launchpad to your career.

Qualifications


We accept applications for our Management Placement and Internship Programme from all university students regardless of university attended and subjects being studied. Our assessment is based on how you perform against our competencies and will judge you on that alone.
You must have a full manual UK or EU driving licence, but we do make accommodations for applicants who don‚Äôt drive due to a disability. 
No drug or alcohol related offence on driving record within the last five years is permitted.


Additional Information


Please let us know about any accommodations you may need to participate in our recruitment process.
Please limit your application to only one job posting based on where you live and/or plan to work. Applying to multiple locations will delay your application being processed.
This job posting is for applications within the following locations:Milton Keynes

Title: MBA Summer Internship 2024 (Singapore)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Restaurant Brands International

Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with more than $35 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 28,000 restaurants in more than 100 countries. RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands ‚Äì TIM HORTONS¬Æ, BURGER KING¬Æ, POPEYES¬Æ and FIREHOUSE SUBS¬Æ. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.

MBA SUMMER INTERNSHIP

Who We Are

Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with‚ÄØmore than $35 billion‚ÄØin annual system-wide sales and ~30,000‚ÄØrestaurants in more than 100 countries. RBI owns‚ÄØfour‚ÄØof the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands ‚Äì‚ÄØBURGER KING¬Æ, TIM HORTONS¬Æ, POPEYES¬Æ and FIREHOUSE SUBS¬Æ.‚ÄØThese independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees, and communities‚ÄØfor decades. Through its‚ÄØRestaurant Brands for Good‚ÄØframework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.

Be bold. Think big.

Our 10-week internships for MBAs give top-performing individuals an early taste of real business challenges. During your summer with us, you‚Äôll get to own at least one key project that‚Äôs been selected by our senior leaders. Past projects have included boosting our brand‚Äôs social media presence or improving the onboarding experience for new employees ‚Äì projects which offer the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the business. This is not a coffee-getting, copy-making kind of internship ‚Äì you‚Äôll be using your talents to the fullest. Do well, and we‚Äôll invite you to join our MBA Full Time Program after you graduate.

The Program

Global Onboarding

It all begins with orientation at one of our corporate offices. We‚Äôll give you an in-depth overview of our business and culture, and you‚Äôll spend a day getting hands-on experience in one of our restaurants.

Project work

After onboarding and training, you‚Äôll jump right into your project. Whatever that is, it will enable you to make an impact on our organization ‚Äì every project we assign to our interns receives sign off by our Regional President and Leadership team.

Ongoing support

You‚Äôll receive plenty of guidance, support, and exposure. Your summer schedule will include training, leadership team lunch-and-learns, formal and informal performance reviews, and social opportunities.

Final presentation

At the end of your internship, you‚Äôll deliver a presentation, reviewing your results and recommendations with our Regional President and senior leadership team.

What You Need


An excellent academic track record ‚Äì you should be a 1st year student enrolled in a Master of Business Administration (MBA) program at an accredited university graduating in 2025 and available to complete a Summer Co-op/Internship in Singapore (June ‚Äì August 2024)
5-7 years of work experience - ideally from consulting, banking, FMCG, retail, or hospitality
Legal authorization to work in Singapore for the duration of the internship
Excellent analytical capabilities and structured thinking
A performance-focused, results-oriented approach ‚Äì you‚Äôll have a strong work ethic and a determination to achieve success
Ownership mentality, self-motivation, ambition, and entrepreneurial spirit.
Comfortable working in an ambiguous environment with competing deadlines and rapidly evolving client needs and conditions
Able to communicate effectively (both written and verbal) with creative ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions
Advanced professional interpersonal, communication, leadership and motivational skills

Title: 2024 Deutsche Bank Summer Internship Programme - Human Resources - Singapore
Description Snippet:
About the job
The Deutsche Bank Internship Programme is designed to help you develop your skills through formal training and continuous support. You‚Äôll quickly gain the confidence to take on real projects by learning first-hand how and what we deliver for clients worldwide. You‚Äôll feel supported by colleagues from across our business and start to develop your professional network.


Country:
Singapore
City:
Singapore
Job Description:
The Deutsche Bank Internship Programme

About The Business Division

Working in markets around the world, our people make us strong. They are Deutsche Bank. Without Human Resources, we could never source, develop and retain the best talent, or apply the strategies that motivate their performance.

We have a key role in the delivery of a culture that aligns risks and rewards, attracts and develops talented individuals, fosters teamwork and partnership, and makes a positive contribution to the countries in which we operate.

Our people in Human Resources find and recruit the brightest talent. They develop their skills by providing them with structured, on-going training. They give every single member of our staff the chance to achieve their career goals and make their work exceptionally rewarding.

About The Role

Our interns are given the opportunity to learn about our business from different viewpoints, giving you a career advantage. You will work on current projects and develop an understanding of our culture, methods and systems by collaborating with a broad range of colleagues in order to provide accurate financial results and insights. The internship is an ideal way of finding out whether a career in Human Resources meets your needs and aspirations.

This program is constructed of rotations across various teams within the Human Resources division. Working on our day-to-day business or on challenging, business-critical projects, you will acquire a broad knowledge of different areas. Your tasks will vary according to your precise role.

Areas where you might work could include:


Talent & Development
Business Advisory
Performance & Reward


What We Look For

We recruit students and graduates who are intelligent and adaptable with excellent communication skills. They have degrees in many different disciplines. Even though good levels of numeracy are important for some roles, you won‚Äôt necessarily need a formal mathematical or financial background. Our comprehensive training programmes will give you all the technical knowledge you‚Äôll need to build a career with us.

Please note that to apply for our 2024 Internship Programme you must be graduating between December 2024 - July 2025.

How To Apply

Please visit www.careers.db.com/students-graduates to apply.

Title: Social & Community Intern - New York
Description Snippet:
About Us

Love, Bonito is a digital-first company on a mission to empower the everyday woman and inspire self-confidence. We are the leading direct-to-consumer womenswear brand, headquartered in Asia, with a presence across [19] countries, including our big bet market, the United States.

Founded in 2010, we are proudly female-founded with more than 70% female representation across our organization, leadership, and STEM roles (#girlpower!). We raised a US$50M Series C round in 2021 and know that we're on the cusp of something great, where we're working towards becoming the most thoughtful brand globally, for the AAPI female consumer, especially when it comes to our products, community, and experiences.

There's a lot more work to be done with all of our exciting plans. So we're looking to team up with people who are wildly passionate about making an impact and be part of a dynamic team, in a workplace with no corporate BS (yes, you read that right!)

The Team

The Love, Bonito team is a passionate, dynamic, innovative, and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers, and savvy marketers to tech whizzes, we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer, the Love, Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative, data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences, products, and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission, we're looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate, fearless, and entrepreneurial.

If you're looking for a dynamic, no corporate-BS environment to learn, grow, and really make an impact, we could be the perfect fit for you!

The Role

You will be responsible for supporting and contributing to the overall brand social strategy that acts as a vehicle to grow, support, engage, and strengthen the relationship between Love, Bonito, and our customers and the greater community of women, all over the world. You will deep-dive into our Social Media pillar and function as a full member of the team to achieve business objectives through your daily responsibilities and your team-specific projects.

Main Responsibilities


Brainstorm, manage, and develop the content schedule, briefs, and assets for social channels
Support in timely content delivery, scheduling, and postings
Write creative copy with compelling calls to action to generate traffic and conversions
Support with social reports, insights, and payment to partners/vendors/creators
Participate in brainstorming sessions/discussion within the team on how to improve in the delivery of content on all social platforms
Assist in market research and competitor analysis
Administrative support and daily upkeep of internal trackers, calendars, and influencer lists
Manage timelines and prompt follow-ups with influencers for various campaigns
Work closely with the team to plan, support and execute events
Conduct media monitoring for brand coverage across various channels including digital, social media, and online forums



Content Production


Develop a solid understanding of the Love, Bonito's brand, our vision and our target audience
Support in developing content for social channels (Facebook, Instagram and TikTok)
Stay on top of trending videos and sounds on TikTok and adapt them quickly for Love, Bonito's channel
Create a sound library that might be applicable for future Instagram Reels and TikTok videos
Participate in content creation discussion for social channels (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok)
Support in the daily maintenance and administrative upkeep of team assets



Community


Source and manage UGC database
Close tracking of campaign and BAU seeding performance to KOLs
Monitor for competitor and industry news, including potential issues that could impact the business
Work closely with other functional teams to troubleshoot or expedite KOLs orders
Provide community support to the Social Media Team - monitoring and responding to comments, questions, and DMs on the respective social media channel



Requirements


Ability to adapt quickly and respond to social media trends in a timely manner
Well-versed in content creation for Social Media channels like Instagram, TikTok, Facebook and Pinterest
Quick thinking and problem-solving attitude in tackling obstacles that may compromise workflow, capacity, and/or quality
Strong video content production skills
A good eye for balance and composition
Able to adapt to an ever-changing and dynamic environment with professionalism, positivity, and flexibility under pressure
Prior experience in social media content creation (especially TikTok) for lifestyle and fashion brands a plus
Must be based in New York. This is a remote position but requires meeting up at least once a week for content creation etc
Kindly include a link to your portfolio for TikTok and Instagram



Benefits


A dynamic, no corporate-BS environment to learn, grow, and really make an impact
Competitive salary
Supportive and awesome international teammates
Development courses
Exclusive employee discounts
Work From Home

Title: INTERNSHIP ‚Äì Innovation Centre Strategic Innovation
Description Snippet:
INTERPOL - Vacancy Notice

Title: INTERNSHIP ‚Äì Innovation Centre Strategic Innovation

Reference of the post: INT04316

Directorate: Innovation Centre

Sub-Directorate: Strategic Innovation

Duty station: Singapore, Singapore

Duration: 6 months

Estimated starting date: 1 July 2024

Level of security clearance: Basic

Deadline for applications: 19 March 2024

INTERPOL‚Äôs Internship Programme welcomes candidates from any of our 196 member states.

The Programme attracts talented students or recent graduates to the Organization and provides them with:


A better understanding of the Organization‚Äôs goals and objectives and how international police cooperation is organized
An insight into how an international organization operates
A framework to enhance their educational experience through practical work assignments, thereby developing skills which are useful for their career and future employment
Experience of working in a multicultural, multidisciplinary and multi-ethnic environment, contributing to the development of mutual understanding, trust and tolerance


All the relevant information about our Internship Programme may be found on our official web site.

Candidates should familiarize themselves with the conditions of internship and the requirements prior to applying for this internship.

Please find all necessary information on this internship at the bottom of the page (link to PDF document next to the bullet point).

Please save the PDF document for your ease of reference as INTERPOL will not provide you this document after the applications' deadline.

INTERNSHIP ALLOWANCE

Interns are entitled to the payment of a monthly allowance determined by the Secretary General. The allowance is established and paid in the currency of the country of the INTERPOL duty station to which the participant is assigned. The internship allowance is EUR 550 for all duty stations.

GENERAL INFORMATION ON INTERPOL

In compliance with INTERPOL‚Äôs Confidentiality regime the successful candidate will have to undergo a security screening according to the clearance level attached to the function.

INTERPOL is committed to achieving diversity and inclusion within its workforce. INTERPOL is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes the applications of all qualified candidates who are nationals of INTERPOL member states, irrespective of their racial or ethnic origin, opinions or beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, health or disabilities.

INTERPOL places no restrictions on the eligibility of candidates, without distinction as to race or ethnic origin, religion, opinions, gender, sexual orientation or disabilities. However, the national policy and laws in force in INTERPOL host countries may mean that staff members‚Äô spouses or partners, while legally recognized by the Organization, are not given the same recognition when they reside in certain duty stations. When this is the case, the Organization will inform the candidates accordingly to ensure that they are aware of the situation and allow them to make an informed decision.

INTERPOL has four official languages: English, French, Spanish and Arabic.

INTERPOL retains the right not to make any appointment to this vacancy, to make an appointment at a lower or upper grade or to make an appointment with a modified job description or for a shorter or longer duration than indicated above.

INTERPOL would like to inform candidates that their application may be considered for other similar positions.

INTERPOL operates a non-smoking policy.

INTERPOL is the world‚Äôs largest international police organization, with 196 member states. Created in 1923, it facilitates cross-border police co-operation, and supports and assists all organizations, authorities, and services whose mission is to prevent or combat international crime.

Title: Intern Retail Merchandising & Marketing
Description Snippet:
The future has many facets: for the courageous, it is opportunity.

The world is becoming increasingly digital, connected, but also more uncertain and volatile. Yet, the iconic German sports car brand Porsche sees this complex future as opportunity. ‚ÄúIn the beginning I looked around and could not find quite the car I dreamed of. So I decided to build it myself.‚Äù With this aspiration, trailblazer Ferry Porsche set the guiding principles for Porsche now, and beyond ‚Äì to be the brand for those who follow their dreams.

Title: Social Media & Ambassador Intern
Description Snippet:
About Us

Love, Bonito is a digital-first company on a mission to empower the everyday Asian woman and inspire self-confidence. We are the leading direct-to-consumer womenswear brand, headquartered in Singapore, with an omni-channel presence across Indonesia and Malaysia, a retail franchise in Cambodia, and are fast expanding into international markets namely Hong Kong SAR China and United States of America.

Founded in 2010, we are proudly female-founded with more than 70% female representation across our organisation, leadership and STEM roles (#girlpower!). We raised a US$50M Series C round in 2021 and know that we're on the cusp of something great, where we're working towards becoming the most thoughtful brand globally, for the Asian female consumer, especially when it comes to our products, community and experiences.

There's a lot more work to be done with all of our exciting plans. So we're looking to team up with people who are wildly passionate about making an impact and be part of a dynamic team, in a workplace with no corporate BS (yes, you read that right!).

The Love, Bonito team is made up of a passionate, dynamic, innovative and fun-loving pool of individuals! From fashion-lovers, savvy marketers to tech whizzes, we have a diverse team of talent with one unified focus - our customer, the everyday Asian woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative, data-centric yet thoughtful approach in creating the right experiences, products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission, we're looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate, fearless and entrepreneurial.

We are currently looking to hire an intern for our team. Grab is currently expanding and at its optimal business cycle and this would be the best and most exciting time to join us!

Get To Know The Team

The Singapore Country team oversees, shapes, and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab‚Äôs vision of being Southeast Asia‚Äôs superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision of serving our community.

The Singapore Marketplace team is housed within the Singapore Country team. We focus on delivering insights to inform business strategy, as well as optimizing the 3-sided marketplace made up of driver/delivery partners, passengers/ eaters, and merchants across the various business verticals in Singapore - including Transport, Food, Finance, Mart, and Express. Our work contributes to timely and affordable rides for customers, and enhances the incomes of our driver partners and merchants, while supporting business growth and profitability.

The Day-to-Day Activities


Utilize both strategic and analytics toolkits to deliver data-driven business insights and strategic recommendations for businesses to act upon (e.g. customer segmentation and strategy, demand/supply strategy)
Support on high-impact analytics projects including problem structuring and analysis
Plan and structure analysis and experiments (e.g. A/B testing) of marketplace issues (e.g. demand, supply, pricing) to optimize for business objectives
Provide strategic advice on business-critical issues through rigorous analysis paired with structured, big picture thinking
Work with cross-functional teams across multiple business lines, including GrabFood, GrabCar, GrabFin, Grab Express, GrabMart etc, to deliver high-impact initiatives arising from insights generated


Learning Objectives


Manage end-to-end analysis using SQL/Python/Excel and translate them to actionable, business-relevant insights
Effectively communicate business insights to stakeholders
Stakeholder management
Manage project/initiatives to completion


Qualifications

The Must-Haves:


Undergraduate in Business Analytics, Economics, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science
Proficient in SQL and Python/R
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Powerpoint)
Strong business acumen - ability to articulate complex analyses and translate these into actionable business insights
Effective communication skills
Strong quantitative skills
Preferably able to commit full-time from May to December 2024


Additional Information

Our Commitment:

We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) is the lead agency driving Singapore‚Äôs Smart Nation initiatives and public sector digital transformation.
