Title: People Operations Intern (Part-time/Full-time)
Description Snippet:
At Glints, we are building the #1 tech-enabled recruitment and career discovery platform in Southeast Asia that helps people and organisations realise their human potential by joining great organisations, learning the right skills and building great teams.

We‚Äôre looking for a People Operations Intern to join our People team, to support the People Operations in executing end to end people operations management and continuous improvement initiatives to excite and retain A-players that perform at their fullest potential.

What You'll Be Doing


Office management, keeping up with office supply inventory, ensuring office environment is well-kept and pleasantly maintained
Supporting the People Operations team in on and offboarding of employees, answering stakeholders' and employees‚Äô questions and queries in a timely manner
Assist with people operations projects including; updating of People Portal, HRIS data management, and engagement activities



Why You Should Join Us


You will be part of a Regional People team in a hyper-growth Series-D startup, where you will make a direct, tangible impact by bringing on board the right talent to help us achieve our mission of realizing human potential
You will join a young and dynamic team where you will be given the autonomy and trust to deliver on outcomes and contribute to continuous improvements in the way we work (and play!)
Plenty of room for learning, exposure, and both personal and professional growth



Who We Are Looking For


Passionate - Exhibit a keen interest in people operations and other people processes;
Raw intelligence - Quick to catch on and make connections, exhibiting intellectual curiosity and unafraid to admit when they don't know something
Initiative - Ability to initiate tasks while suggesting proactive actions or solutions with minimal guidance
Critical thinking - Ability to think on a deeper level and to ask the right questions in order to obtain answers which might not be readily available
Excellent communicator - Strong written and verbal communication skills to manage internal and external stakeholders
Organised - Ability to handle multiple streams of work with a keen eye for detail



Let‚Äôs Realise Human Potential.

At Glints, we are building the #1 tech-enabled recruitment and career discovery platform in Southeast Asia that helps people and organizations realize their human potential.

We have impacted many lives but there‚Äôs still plenty to be done. If you‚Äôre ready to grow and make an impact, you‚Äôve come to the right place.

What is Glints?

Glints is the leading talent ecosystem in Southeast Asia, with an enduring purpose of contributing to a world where people and organizations can realize their human potential.

Today, Glints is the most well-funded and well-capitalized startup in the talent recruitment space in Southeast Asia, with over US$80M in total investments raised till date.

Our tech-enabled approach to recruitment and career discovery connects more than 4 million candidates to their next dream opportunities. We have also supported more than 50,000 companies in finding top talent and doubling recruitment efficiency.

Our agility and firm hold on our core purpose and values have allowed us to remain resilient and thrive through tumultuous times.

In 2020, we were recognized by LinkedIn as one of the Top 10 Startups in Singapore. In 2022, we were featured in the top 20 of Nikkei-FT-Statista High-Growth Companies Asia-Pacific 2021 list. Moreover, we were also featured in the top 10 fastest-growing companies in Singapore by The Straits Times.

Who We Are

At Glints, personal and professional growth are just as important as business growth. That's why we created the Glints Culture Code: #RIIBCOH. It defines our values, guides our decisions and actions, and is what makes us special.

Relentlessly Resourceful: Whatever it takes, just make it happen (ethically)

Integrity: Have courage, be guided by the truth, don‚Äôt be afraid

Impact: Missionaries, not mercenaries

Beginners‚Äô Mindset: Stay humble, don‚Äôt be attached to ego

Customer Obsessed: Customers First

Ownership: Care intensely about the mission and take responsibility

High Standards: Dream big and deliver epic outcomes fast

Where We Work

Since Glints was officially launched in Singapore in 2015, we've rapidly grown our footprint across Greater Southeast Asia to operate in Indonesia, Singapore, Vietnam, Taiwan, Malaysia and Philippines.

Learn more about Glints and our culture at bit.ly/glintsculture,

Or check out our Careers Page at https://glints.com/careers!

Title: Marketing Intern (Singapore)
Description Snippet:
About Us

Love, Bonito is a digital-first company on a mission to empower the everyday Asian woman and inspire self-confidence. We are the leading direct-to-consumer womenswear brand, headquartered in Singapore, with an omni-channel presence across Indonesia and Malaysia, a retail franchise in Cambodia, and are fast expanding into international markets namely Japan, Hong Kong SAR China and United States of America.

Founded in 2010, we are proudly female-founded with more than 70% female representation across our organisation, leadership and STEM roles (#girlpower!). We raised a US$50M Series C round in 2021 and know that we're on the cusp of something great, where we're working towards becoming the most thoughtful brand globally, for the Asian female consumer, especially when it comes to our products, community and experiences.

There's a lot more work to be done with all of our exciting plans. So we're looking to team up with people who are wildly passionate about making an impact and be part of a dynamic team, in a workplace with no corporate BS (yes, you read that right!).

The role

You will be responsible for supporting and contributing to the overall marketing strategy across omnichannel touchpoints for the Singapore market, across major platforms and channels: e-commerce site, flagship store, customer relationship management, influencer, PR, events & activations. Reporting into the Assistant Marketing Manager of Singapore, you will play a key role in shaping Love, Bonito throughout this exhilarating growth in Singapore.

Main Responsibilities:


Influencer collaborations - shortlisting of influencers, content ideas and coordination of outfit selections
Weekly coordination with try-on influencers - creation of lookbooks & tracking links, booking out of fitting rooms, other delivery matters
Weekly reporting - updating weekly performance deck with influencer clippings, reach, insights

Contribute to conceptualizing and executing engaging and performance-driven campaigns

Research, outreach, liaise and coordinate plans with external partners to drive brand awareness and acquire new customers
Coordinate and execute marketing collaterals and assets across in-store touchpoints
Coordinate with event vendors or partners and execute programmes and operations plan during event days



Requirements


6 months commitment
Undergraduates and graduate students are both welcome to apply
Based in Singapore



Benefits


Market level internship salary and benefits provided
A dynamic, no corporate-BS environment to learn and grow

Title: Intern - Global Supply Chain
Description Snippet:
About the job
Intern ‚Äì Global Supply Chain 

About GlobalFoundries

GlobalFoundries (GF) is one of the world‚Äôs leading semiconductor foundries and the only one with a truly global footprint. We manufacture complex, feature-rich integrated circuits that enable billions of electronic devices that are pervasive throughout nearly every sector of the global economy.

Our advanced operational and technology capabilities are made available through a global manufacturing network, anchored by facilities in Singapore, Dresden (Germany), Burlington (Vermont) as well as East Fishkill and Malta (New York).

Environmental sustainability is imperative to GF. We are committed to green thinking in our manufacturing and operations, and this is reinforced through our Journey to Zero Carbon goal to reduce total greenhouse gas emissions by 25% by 2030. With over 15,000 employees worldwide, we believe in creating a culture of inclusion that taps on our rich, multi-cultural diversity to drive better business outcomes.

At GF, we make things that matter ‚Äî from the solutions that enable the way we live today, to the technologies that drive what‚Äôs possible for tomorrow. GF is delivering a new era of more.

For more information, visit www.gf.com.

Project Title 

Procurement Projects related to Analytics/Supply Management/Procurement Process

Project Objective / Purpose 

The Silicon Sourcing Team drives the Organization‚Äôs Direct Materials Strategy and we are looking for an aspiring intern who has a keen interest in Procurement. The intern will have an opportunity to learn the fundamentals of the procurement process with exposure to procurement practice in a semiconductor industry.

Project Description

The intern will assist the Silicon Sourcing Team in various projects related to Data Analytics, Supply Management and Procurement Process. The intern will support the various procurement practices and ad hoc projects related to Silicon. There will be an opportunity to gain global exposure in this project.

Project Outcome 

In this project, the intern would gain an understanding of the role Procurement plays in the Supply Chain and how this impacts the business. The intern will also have hands on experience in managing complex databases and learn how to analyze and interpret relevant data, trends and patterns.

Required Qualifications


Education (Degree Supply Chain, Science)
Microsoft Power Platform (BI, Automate)
Microsoft Excel Skills (Intermediate preferred)


#InternshipProgramSGP

GlobalFoundries is an equal opportunity employer, cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We believe having a multicultural workplace enhances productivity, efficiency, and innovation whilst our employees feel truly respected, valued and heard.

As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or physical abilities.

All offers of employment with GlobalFoundries are conditioned upon the successful completion of background checks, medical screenings as applicable and subject to the respective local laws and regulations.

For new hires, the appointment is contingent upon the provision of a copy of their COVID-19 vaccination document, subject to any written request for medical or religious accommodation.

Title: Quality Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative? 

 

At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability. 

 

We are now hiring Interns for our H2 2024 cohort! Internships will start in 3 batches: 1 July 2024, 8 July 2024 or 15 July 2024. Please indicate your availability in your application. Students who can commit full-time will be preferred.

 

Join us as a Quality Intern to make an impact! 

Mission (About The Role)

The Quality Intern will learn to support & deliver Quality Excellence to customers by ensuring fast & effective resolution of Schneider Electric‚Äôs product quality issues, determining recurrence and severity, and supporting containment, root cause analysis, corrective, & preventive actions in-country.

What will you do?


Support the Front Office Quality team in handling customers‚Äô post-sales quality complaints and issues to eliminate dissatisfaction. 
Apply & enhance the process to resolve quality complaints quickly & effectively using Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software e.g., Salesforce. 
Understand the escalation routes for major customer issues to the appropriate organizations and support collaborative resolution in the customers‚Äô best interest. 
Use Data Analytics & Visualization tools such as ThoughtSpot & Tableau to identify top quality issues and launch projects & initiatives to address them. 
Collaborate with other organizations and various internal & external stakeholders to contain, correct, and prevent problems affecting customers. 
Contribute towards the execution of containment actions for known problems. 
Implement Issue to Prevention (I2P) processes & frameworks to drive resolution. 
Participate in customer site visits to address complaints and present resolutions. 
Review Technical Analysis reports before presenting to customers. 
Coordinate Technical Expert interventions when required. 
Develop logistics management skills, including management & monitoring of warranty returns e.g., RMAs. 
Support project handover and DLP/warranty

What qualifications will make you successful? 


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering 
Customer-oriented mindset. 
Experience in handling customer inquiries will be an advantage. 
Good coordination, problem-solving, and analytical skills. 


What's in it for me?


Competitive internship allowance
Flexible work arrangement
Medical coverage
Blue Sky Friday
Onsite gym 
and more!


Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

‚Ç¨25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

Title: Intern, Loyalty Strategy
Description Snippet:
About the job
Company Description

About Grab

Grab is Southeast Asia's Leading Online to Offline (O2O) mobile platform. Grab is the region's everyday super app that provides services that matter the most to consumers. Through its open platform strategy, Grab works with partners to provide safe, accessible and affordable transport, food, package, grocery delivery, mobile payment and financial services to millions of Southeast Asians. Grab aims to create 100 million micro-entrepreneurs through its ecosystems.

We are currently looking to hire an intern for our team. Grab is currently expanding and at its optimal business cycle and this would be the best and exciting time to join us!

Job Description

About the Team

Loyalty Strategy team takes on a set of diverse and challenging questions on Grab‚Äôs platform that are generally cross-functional and cross-vertical in nature.

We are a small but mighty and collaborative team of strategists, business owners, and economists who strive to build compelling OneGrab Propositions that bring the best of Grab together while creating value for our users, merchants, and driver partners.

Currently, we are working hard to build the most loved membership in Southeast-Asia, GrabUnlimited, Grab‚Äôs Flagship Subscription program.

Ever growing and expanding Grab‚Äôs SuperApp has multiple services in different stages of maturity with varying business models and operates in diverse markets with different competitive environments and user preferences. As we grow, finding synergies between Grab services and creating propositions that harness the power of SuperApp and are compelling to end users is crucial.

As a Loyal Strategy intern, you will be working on key strategic projects for Grab that involves charting out the next phase of GrabUnlimited, GrabRewards and crafting Grab‚Äôs Ecosystem play.

You will be actively involved in fleshing out different aspects of these programs that will involve extensive collaboration with multiple functions (eg. product, ops) and multiple business units (mobilities, deliveries, merchant etc) across Grab. This is a highly visible role working on Grab‚Äôs key strategic projects.

You will bring learnings from industry best practices, insights from internal and external data to make strategic recommendations that will inform Grab‚Äôs product roadmaps and operational next-steps on these programs.

Duties And Responsibilities


Scoping various aspects of Grab‚Äôs Flagship Subscription and GrabRewards strategy
Go-to-market planning for initiatives within these programs while working with a diverse set of stakeholders 
Advise consumer strategy and product teams on next steps for GrabUnlimited & OmniChannel programs using insights built from internal and external data 
Develop detailed analysis on the areas of improvement to make these programs more spend-efficient and user-friendly
Market research on how peer organizations run these programs and make recommendations that are tailored and practicable for Grab


Learning Objectives 


Crafting consumer strategy as well as laying out execution next-steps and GTM 
Stakeholder management & driving alignment across a diverse set of stakeholders
Problem Solving that requires balancing competing business objectives 


Qualifications

Requirements


Postgraduate/Undergraduate in Business, Economics, Marketing & other relevant majors
Strong presentation skills - Ability to distill insights & articulate an actionable point of view to non-expert audiences, Good command of storytelling and presentation techniques (e.g. slide making, data visualization).
Problem solving & can do attitude - Willing to learn quickly and understand the root cause of problems; able to work with a multidisciplinary team to propose creative solutions.
Good to have : Data-analysis skills (SQL, PowerBI, Excel, Tableau and equivalents)

Project Title: Data Transformation to support migrant worker dormitory and employment agency management

MOM licenses migrant worker dormitories and works with various agencies to ensure there is sufficient supply of beds and dormitories are well-managed. We also license employment agencies to ensure that they comply with our regulations.

Title: Next-Gen Accounting Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
Our Mission

At Reapra, we're not your typical venture builder. We are in the business of building the next generation of entrepreneurs that influences long term social change in our society. Our 20-year vision is to create businesses that integrate business success, social contribution and long term well-being from Day 1. We're a group of awkward and introspective individuals experimenting a new way of business building by pushing the boundaries of the traditional approach towards managing a company's P&L.

The problem our team is trying to solve

Are you tired of the conventional path in accounting? Have you noticed that there is a gap of empathy between accounting members and the rest of the Company? Or wonder for hours why some of these accounting rules don't seem to make sense? Despite all this tension you feel, you are driven by your curiosity towards creating a way to make it easily relatable to others. If yes, we're looking to work with you to redefine the future of bookkeeping and fair valuation audit for our portfolio of entrepreneurs.

Requirements


We would love to meet you if:


There is something critical you would like to change in the realm of accounting. This means you would have some basic knowledge of accounting or have engaged with the bookkeeping process before
In order to challenge the norm, you strongly believe you have to first train yourself to do the basic and boring stuff well. 
Value risk-taking and taking initiative to embrace new ways of thinking and doing
Are excited about the prospect of becoming a future entrepreneur
Are looking for something more than just acquiring skills sets. 
Thrive in a remote work environment and can spend 3 months with us
Are fluent in English and preferably know one more language: Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese or Thai


Your time with us could be part-time (min 4 hours a day) or full-time, matching Japan and Singapore time zones.

What might a typical day look like in terms of activities?

Scope: Bookkeeping & Fair Valuation Audit


Daily communication of our weekly goals and progress for the day on slack
Pre-plan your calendar for the tasks and activities by reviewing the timeline
30-60 mins calls to discuss issues or on-board new processes
Check our team dashboard daily to understand your next process
Reviewing legal documents, financial data and meeting notes to organise and request for information to understand the full story of our investments
Read about accounting rules and definitions that can help you do your job better
Youtube learning on how to do analysis based on accounting logic
Talking to Auditors to answer their questions
Drafting our guidebook so that other team members can follow the process seamlessly



Benefits


What would working with us look like?


Unconventional learning: Say goodbye to structured learning. You'll experience how we learn under high uncertainty. Our work is tightly integrated with the pace and complexities of the entrepreneur we serve. 
Beginner mindset: Your role will not be bound by your expertise or know-how. We are open to exploring with you even if you have no prior expertise in this field. 
Multicultural experience: We work across different cultures so you'll experience the nuance in each of the cultures we work with. 
Collaborative learning in a team: We openly share our challenges and mistakes to help each other learn. Mistakes help us become better. We enjoy the process as much as the outcome
Entrepreneurial thinking and doing: We run out team like a business and we have our own P&L so we think about solving problems quite differently. Highly motivated to improve our time management, problem solving and learning about the industry and its stakeholders

Title: Summer Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job

CRU leads in the field of global commodity market analysis and business intelligence. Our Analysis Division has an exciting new scheme ‚Äì We are offering the opportunity for a talented group of individuals to kick-start their professional career in the world of commodities, and to join us in a paid internship 3-month placement programme in our Singapore office. Applicants must have the right to work in Singapore to be considered.




The industries we work in are vibrant and truly global: a hurricane in Australia, a strike in Peru, or a construction boom in China can influence markets across the world. Our work relies on the best market research, data, and insights because our multi-national customers - leading companies in the commodity space - rely on us to inform and support crucial decisions they need to make in fast-moving and volatile markets.

About the role




We need the best teams, data, and research insights to support this. This provides the opportunity for you to work across commodities, to be part of our research programme and support creation and management of the best data and insights for our customers. For the most successful in role, there is the potential to contribute to analysis output and join as a permanent Research Analyst where opportunity arises.

For the successful individuals, this is a great entry point into a career in the private sector, where you can thrive at the heart of a dynamic, global business intelligence company and will learn about commodity markets. The role gives variety, and allows to develop a wide array of transferable skills, ideal to build a strong CV.




Some examples of how you will be contributing are:

‚Ä¢ Finding, evaluating, and organising data and information that supports the formation of published analysis for major industrial and financial customers

‚Ä¢ Improving systems and processes to allow for more effective and efficient data-led insight generation

‚Ä¢ Applying your academic knowledge and experience and working with others to help find meaning from diverse information sources and types

‚Ä¢ Verifying or improving data that forms the evidence base for key conclusions, forecasts, or expert opinions.




What kind of person might you be?

‚Ä¢ Someone who thrives working in a team and is curious about your colleagues‚Äô work, successes, and challenges

‚Ä¢ Someone who is intellectually curious, eager to learn and push forward their own boundaries

‚Ä¢ Someone who is organised, motivated, dedicated and likes to deliver on tasks




What qualifications should you have?

‚Ä¢ Candidates should be degree educated in Economics, Mathematics or similar, and ideally having completed or working towards a Masters. Degrees should be from a top university, or equivalent level qualification from a leading university. 




What will you gain from working with us?

‚Ä¢ The ability to work with and learn from analysts in a highly respected market analysis and business intelligence business

‚Ä¢ Engaging in real work that makes a meaningful difference to the outcomes for external customers

‚Ä¢ The guidance and support of both a dedicated line manager and project leads in the business who will ensure you are properly briefed and supported

‚Ä¢ The opportunity to work with supportive and like-minded colleagues in a truly global organisation

‚Ä¢ The potential to contribute to analysis output and join as a permanent Research Analyst where opportunity arises

‚Ä¢ Please note you must hold the right to work in Singapore to be considered for this internship.

‚Ä¢ This internship is expected to be for 3 months from June/July and you will receive $1,500 SGD per month pay.

 JobRequirementMatcher: Based on submitted CVs of an employee, identify if attributes under his/her CV matches the job requirements of a job advertisement. This is to facilitate the investigation into cases where employers do not give interview opportunities to potential candidates who has indicated attributes that meet the job requirement.
 IOcalculator: Based on various computation logic and requirements under the Progressive Wage Model (PWM), create an eligibility checker and salary calculator for PWM workers and employers.
 InvestHelper: Based on existing Standards Operating Procedures (SOPs), past cases data and interactions details, recommend the next best course of action to take for our Investigation Officers.
 AutoMetaTag: Based on case details and information within a case, assign metadata tags (by domain, key subject areas, offences) to all existing and new cases to facilitate Knowledge Management and enable searching of information via the metadata tags.
 DataExtractorGPT: Based on several CSV data files uploaded, allow user to provide prompts via natural language on how the CSV tables should be joint (i.e., primary key and joint types between each table), and allow user to input prompt to generate aggregated data in a table format.
 During the conceptualisation phase, the intern will have opportunities to apply design thinking, UX/UI, prototyping and user journey concepts in identifying real world pain points in law and enforcement operations.
 The intern can look forward to testing out his/her solution/concept via a working prototype or work towards a proof of concept (POC) with potential vendors.
 We are on a transformation journey to leverage on AI/ML to reinvent our enforcement and investigation processes. This offers an extremely exciting opportunity to gain first-hand experience on how enforcement is done by a government agency and provides a rare opportunity to be a member of the pioneer team to reimagine how enforcement should be done in the age of AI/ML.



What We Are Looking For

Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning, Data analytics

Title: Intern - Low Carbon Solutions (July - Dec 2024)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Us
At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.

We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society‚Äôs evolving needs. Learn more about our What and our Why and how we can work together.

ExxonMobil in Singapore

ExxonMobil is one of Singapore‚Äôs largest foreign manufacturing investors with over S$25 billion in fixed asset investments.

We have manufacturing facilities that include an integrated world-scale refining and petrochemical complex in Jurong and Jurong Island, a network of service stations under the Esso brand, operate a lubricant plant and are a supplier of cylinder cooking gas. ExxonMobil provides customers and commercial markets in the region with ground transportation, industrial, aviation and marine fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and liquefied natural gas (LNG).

As Singapore serves as the AP hub for some of our businesses, we employ about 3,500 people across positions in operations, projects, commercial, corporate support functions and others.

ExxonMobil also contributes to community programs in Singapore that support the arts, education, health and the environment.

For more information, visit www.exxonmobil.com.sg or follow ExxonMobil Singapore on LinkedIn and Instagram.

What You Will Do
Through our internship program, you will gain first-hand experience with an industry leader in low carbon solutions (LCS). Your work, and that of the teams, contributes to the growth and future of our business, as we create the low-carbon energy the world needs to protect tomorrow, today. In addition, it will be an excellent platform for you to explore your career aspirations while delivering tangible benefits throughout our business from invaluable on-the-job-experience.

Beyond that, you will not be alone as you will have a supervisor and advisor assigned to you who can help you navigate the organization, give advice on your development and help you learn what it takes to achieve your goals. As part of the assessed internship, you will have a formal final review on project delivery and performance by your supervisor. You will also be asked to prepare a final presentation or report out about your project.

Possible internship scopes include:


Support progression of Low Carbon Solutions (LCS) opportunities into subsequent stages of development including clearing internal gates / milestones and helping mature technical and commercial definition includes opportunities in carbon capture and storage, hydrogen, ammonia, and / or biofuels
Helping design and implement an Asia Pacific LCS portfolio prioritization and management system aligned with Global Prioritization criteria
Conduct LCS market analysis across Asia Pacific regions and industry sectors to help further support establishment and growth of profitable LCS business generate insights to help inform understanding of supply / demand dynamics and opportunity identification
Working with commercial advisors to develop standardized, region specific term sheets as it relates to helping guide approach to new agreements and commercial structures
Support ongoing policy development in Asia Pacific region including need to address cross border movement of CO2 and low carbon products assist with strategy and planning development exercises
Support LCS policy mapping work across region to help identify key levers for value creation and gaps that need to be addressed from both fiscal and regulatory standpoint
Helping map EM technology offer to customer needs across value chains and identify key gaps that need closure


Our internship programs are assessed, and outstanding candidates may be offered a full-time job offer to kickstart your career. We do prioritize our employment offers to outstanding candidates from our internship program over those without internship.

About You
Skills and Qualifications

To be eligible for our Internship Program, you should be:


In your 3rd year of study
A degree in Engineering Preferably second upper honors and above and / or with leadership experience in non-academic areas such as co-curriculum activities or national service
Previous internship experience in either private or public sector service preferred


Stay connected with us:


Learn more at our website
Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram
Like us on Facebook 
Subscribe our channel at YouTube


Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunity in conformance with all applicable laws and regulations to individuals who are qualified to perform job requirements. The Company administers its personnel policies, programs, and practices in a non-discriminatory manner in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, work assignment, promotion, transfer, termination, wage and salary administration, and selection for training.

About the job
Project Title

What the role is

Automation of Finance Processes through Robotic Process Automation (RPA)

Project Overview

The intern will work closely with the Finance team to analyze, design, and implement RPA solutions aimed at automating repetitive and time-consuming tasks within Finance operations. By harnessing the power of RPA tools and techniques, the intern will contribute to the transformation of manual processes into efficient, automated workflows, ultimately enhancing the overall productivity and effectiveness of Finance functions.

Learning Outcome

At the end of the internship stint, the intern will have achieved the following:


 Ability to successfully implement RPA processes, troubleshoot and resolve errors in existing RPA processes.
 Gain hands-on experience and proficiency in utilizing the UiPath RPA tool, including the ability to design, develop, and implement RPA solutions to automate Finance processes.
 Acquire practical knowledge and skills in process optimization and automation

 Testing and Validation: Conduct thorough testing of RPA solutions to ensure accuracy, reliability, and compliance with regulatory requirements. Validate the performance of automated processes and troubleshoot any issues that arise.
 Documentation: Create documentation for RPA solutions, including process workflows, technical specifications, and user guides to facilitate knowledge transfer and future maintenance.
 Collaboration and Training: Engage with stakeholders to seamlessly integrate RPA solutions into existing processes, ensuring smooth adoption. Provide training and support to users, maximising the effectiveness and adoption of automated processes.



What We Are Looking For


 Proficient in utilizing the UiPath RPA tool is mandatory

 Capable of working independently as well as collaboratively in a team, contributing effectively to project goals
 Exhibits strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen interest in process optimization and automation
 Possesses strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively engage and communicate with key stakeholders at all levels

Title: Research Analyst Intern
Description Snippet:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
The Internship

Hello Tomorrow Asia Pacific Seeks Dynamic Teammates Who Would Like To Contribute To And Build Familiarity Within The Deep-tech Innovation And Venture Space. It Will Be a Deeply Rewarding Experience That Offers Candidates An Alternative Exposure To And Perspective Of The Dynamic Innovation Ecosystem We Painstakingly Curate. You Will


gain multifaceted exposure to our regional and global deep-tech innovation ecosystems,
work closely with senior team members across various start-up- and innovation-centric projects, and
form insights into emerging innovation themes.


While extremely gratifying, our nature of work can be challenging to immediately grasp well. In order to be truly meaningful and for you to benefit from real team and project integration, our internships are designed to be ~6 months in duration (and no less than 4 months, at the minimum), whether on-site or fully remote. During this tenure, we commit thoughtfully to your learning and growth.

In Support Of Your Learning, You Will Be Involved In Research, Analytics, And Ideation, Advancing To Being Entrusted With The Execution Of Live Projects And Other Initiatives. Some Examples Of Such Activities Include


sourcing emerging innovations, mapping ecosystem stakeholders, and comprehending the dynamics therein; and
planning and conducting research, and publishing insights around various innovation themes (eg. decarbonisation, energy, and investment landscapes).


Competencies

The ideal candidate is deeply curious about technical innovations, and quick to identify how a sophisticated tapestry of stakeholders might be engaged to support the development of meaningful innovations at scale.

You are analytical and empathetic, able to respectfully challenge the status quo, and function as a champion in driving new initiatives. You thrive in fast-paced and ambiguous environments, where the opportunity to do something for the first time is relished rather than shunned. You are polished and professional at all times, while also always the first to roll your sleeves up and get your hands dirty.

In addition, you should


be a strong team player that‚Äôs responsible, dependable, and comfortable managing complex timelines and projects;
possess strong communication and facilitation skills;
always be thinking critically, asking good questions, and seeking to scale up the learning curve quickly;
maintain excellence in your work and be highly organised; and
be tenacious toward problem-solving.


Candidates with a background in STEM, journalism, or economics, and equipped with strong research and writing skills will be favoured.

The Organisation

Hard challenges call for hard solutions. Hello Tomorrow is a mission-driven organisation supporting the accelerated translation of deep technologies so that groundbreaking solutions premised upon these novel scientific and/ or engineering advancements may scale most time- and resource-efficiently.

Founded In 2011 By Scientist-entrepreneurs, We Are Headquartered In Paris, With Offices And Innovation Curators In Multiple Cities. Title: Intern - Fab Operations, Process / Equipment Engineering (Talent Pool for 2H2024 University/Polytechnic Internship)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About GlobalFoundries

GlobalFoundries (GF) is one of the world‚Äôs leading semiconductor foundries and the only one with a truly global footprint. We manufacture complex, feature-rich integrated circuits that enable billions of electronic devices that are pervasive throughout nearly every sector of the global economy.

Our advanced operational and technology capabilities are made available through a global manufacturing network, anchored by facilities in Singapore, Dresden (Germany), Burlington (Vermont) as well as East Fishkill and Malta (New York).

Environmental sustainability is imperative to GF. We are committed to green thinking in our manufacturing and operations, and this is reinforced through our Journey to Zero Carbon goal to reduce total greenhouse gas emissions by 25% by 2030. With over 15,000 employees worldwide, we believe in creating a culture of inclusion that taps on our rich, multi-cultural diversity to drive better business outcomes.

At GF, we make things that matter ‚Äî from the solutions that enable the way we live today, to the technologies that drive what‚Äôs possible for tomorrow. GF is delivering a new era of more.

For more information, visit www.gf.com.

Project Title 

Internship in Wafer Fabrication Process/Equipment Engineering

Project Objective

Wafer fabrication is the fundamental of all electronics and its applications in the semiconductor supply chain. Everything starts off with a bare silicon substrate, which undergoes many processing steps to form the ultimate IC chips that power up the electronics appliances. Controls are put in place to monitor the critical processing steps to detect any abnormalities early to guarantee wafer quality upon completion.

Project Description

Interns will get exclusive insights and hands-on experience in Global Foundries‚Äô state-of-the-art semiconductor manufacturing environment. Through shadowing experts in the field and assisting in works inside the Fab, you will gain a deeper understanding on the wafer fabrication process. You will also be presented with various opportunities such as roundtable with management and inter-department networking and interactions. Interns will also be given chances to consolidate their learning and provide recommendations for improvement.

Interested applicants should be inquisitive and have a positive learning attitude.

Project Outcome

Interns will gain experience in the semiconductor industry, demonstrate a good understanding of the process module.

At the end of the internship, a presentation of learning experience with recommendations for improvement is required.

Required Qualifications

Degree in in Chemical Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science Engineering, Chemistry & Physics


This application is for students undertaking a 20-24 weeks credit-bearing internship from July 2024 onwards.


*Please indicate your internship period clearly in your CV/Resume/Cover Letter*

#InternshipProgramSGP

GlobalFoundries is an equal opportunity employer, cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We believe having a multicultural workplace enhances productivity, efficiency and innovation whilst our employees feel truly respected, valued and heard.

As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or physical abilities.

All offers of employment with GlobalFoundries are conditioned upon the successful completion of background checks, medical screenings as applicable and subject to the respective local laws and regulations.

To ensure that we maintain a safe and healthy workplace for our GlobalFoundries employees, please note that offered candidates who have applied for jobs in Singapore will have to be fully vaccinated prior to their targeted start date. For new hires, the appointment is contingent upon the provision of a copy of their COVID-19 vaccination document, subject to any written request for medical or religious accommodation.

Title: 2024 Deutsche Bank Corporate Bank STEM Internship - Singapore
Description Snippet:
About the job
The Deutsche Bank Internship Programme: 


Country:
Singapore
City:
Singapore
Job Description:
This internship programme is a full-time programme to be held between August-December 2024. Please note that you must be graduating by July 2026 to apply for this programme. 

The Deutsche Bank Internship Programme is designed to help you develop your skills through formal training and continuous support. You‚Äôll quickly gain the confidence to take on real projects by learning first-hand how and what we deliver for clients worldwide. You‚Äôll feel supported by colleagues from across our business and start to develop your professional network.

About the business division:

The Corporate Bank is a market leader in cash management, lending, trade finance, trust and agency services, securities services and risk management for FX and Rates. We have deep client relationships and our client solutions relate directly to the real economy.

The Internship Team & About the Intern Role:

Internship Team: Cash Management - Merchant Solutions

Merchant Solutions is a business line supporting e-commerce businesses with various payment methods (i.e. credit/debit cards, wallets, instant payments, BNPL and other alternative payment modes) and marketplace solutions. As a fresh initiative we want to cater to demand for cross-border payments from merchants operating in the APAC region. To expand our remit across major currencies, we are designing a payment product integrated with a foreign exchange (FX) engine. Our goal is to provide MCP (Multi Currency Processing) and DCC (Dynamic Currency Conversion) followed by cross-border settlement of funds. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the design of a product which will have high industry visibility over the coming 5-7 years.

We are seeking a proactive and technically savvy intern to join our team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in conducting analysis and assessments of existing and emerging payment technologies and design interfaces to support cross-border payments in Merchant Solutions.

Title: Intern, Technology & Automation

About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Intern, Technology & Innovation - Hummingbird Bioscience

(Full-time internship ‚Äì SG based location)

About Hummingbird Bioscience

Hummingbird Bioscience is a data-driven precision biotherapeutics team discovering and developing transformative biologic medicines for hard-to-treat diseases. The Hummingbird Bioscience model combines computational and systems biology and wet lab drug discovery in a multi-disciplinary, collaborative environment spanning initial discovery through clinical development. We harness this integrated approach across target identification and patient selection, enabling our team to increase the efficiency of translating novel scientific insights while reducing the inherent risk in drug discovery and development. At Hummingbird Bioscience, our commitment to rigorous science, teamwork, and intellectual integrity underpins our passion to accelerate the journey of new drugs from concept to clinic.

Our highly experienced teams in the US and Singapore span antibody discovery, pharmacology, production and clinical development. For more information, please visit www.hummingbirdbioscience.com, and follow Hummingbird Bioscience on LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube.

About The Role

We are looking for a detail-oriented Intern, Technology & Automation to join the dynamic Human Resources team to assist in developing automated processes. The successful candidate will possess strong hands-on experience to support automation projects, developing formulas, and creation of templates.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with HR team members to identify areas for process automation
Design and develop automated templates to streamline HR processes for enhanced employee onboarding, employee experience, and data analysis
Utilize advanced Excel functions and formulas to manipulate data and generate reports
Test and troubleshoot automated templates to ensure accuracy and efficiency
Develop tools to validate weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly HR analytics reports

Work cross functionally with other teams to develop a FAQ bot & company resource portal for employees
Continuously evaluate and enhance automation processes to optimize efficiency and productivity


Essential Qualifications


Currently pursuing a Diploma or Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or relevant field
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including functions such as VBA, VLOOKUP, IF, Macros, statements and Power tools such as Power Pivot, Automate etc
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy
Independent, goal-oriented, inquisitive and self-motivated with the ability to work in a fast paced, highly dynamic environment


Desirable Qualifications


Experience with programming languages e.g. Python


OUR MISSION & VALUES

Our fast-growing biotechnology company is committed to discovering and developing important new drugs for cancer and autoimmune diseases, and living by our values: Excellence, Determination, Teamwork, Intellectual Integrity and Audacity.

JOIN US AT THE FRONTIER OF DRUG DISCOVERY AND DEVELOPMENT

We are looking for passionate and motivated individuals committed to solving important, complex problems. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to learn from a multi-disciplinary team and work towards transforming the therapeutic landscape for hard-to-treat diseases. We are committed to the personal and professional development of our team and offer robust learning and development programs. Hummingbird Bioscience understands the need for flexibility for our team and offers a generous paid time off program with flexibility to support employees through different life stages. We invest in our team‚Äôs health and offer a comprehensive and holistic employee assistance program. We foster a more collaborative, productive, and sociable culture with on-site lunches and snacks. Finally, we believe in creating social impact beyond our business through corporate social responsibility initiatives.

For further enquiries, please email us at careers@hummingbirdbio.com.

Hummingbird Bioscience is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all Singapore and US federal, state and local laws and/or guidelines that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications.

Title: Associate (Intern - Summer 2024), Management Consulting
Description Snippet:
About the job
Associate (Intern), Summer 2024

Company Introduction

Alton Aviation Consultancy is a specialized management consulting firm focused on the aviation sector. As an independent advisory firm with no joint ventures, affiliations, or other business affiliations, we pride ourselves on offering our clients independent, objective counsel. Our global client base includes, among others, major private equity/institutional investors in aviation, airlines, airports, and aerospace manufacturers. At Alton, our purpose is to deliver to our clients the objective, data-driven guidance and insight required to inform business strategies, allocate capital, prioritize resources, and manage risk. We are looking for bright and talented minds to join our teams in Singapore.

Job Description Summary

Who we are:

Alton delivers cutting-edge advisory services that help our aviation and aerospace sector clients conquer challenges and grow. We are a global team of seasoned management consultants and executives focused on the aviation industry who are renowned for thought leadership, quantitative analytics, and innovative solution development. Equipped with an unrivalled understanding of the global aviation market -- and across the value chain including airlines, aviation finance, aerospace, MRO and aftermarket, airports, mobility, and technology -- Alton is at the forefront of helping industry players navigate the everchanging global aviation market and make strategic decisions that yield long-term value.

Job Overview:

The working experience of an Intern is essentially identical to that of a full-time Associate. You will gain deeper insight into the aviation industry and the type of work that Alton's professionals engage in every day. Throughout your work with Alton, you will be working closely with Alton's experts to apply commercial expertise and rigorous analysis to solving real-world problems that aviation industry players are faced with. From day one, you will participate in tasks such as market research, data analysis, and building strategic recommendation reports. The internship will sharpen your understanding of business analytics and presentation tools, as well as equip you with in-depth knowledge on aviation market trends.

Job Responsibilities: 


Work as a member of a consulting team on client engagements to gather, analyze, and interpret data in support of hypothesis testing and solution development
Conduct market research, perform both quantitative and qualitative analyses (including financial model development), and author presentations and reports
Contribute to the growth of the company in an entrepreneurial environment and support the development of company intellectual property



Qualifications

Educational Background:

Pursuit of a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative, problem solving, or critical reasoning discipline (e.g., finance, mathematics, engineering, statistics, philosophy, etc.) from a top educational institution. Preference will be given to upperclassmen and graduating students.

Qualities: 


Strong interest in and passion for the aviation industry
Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills 
High level of motivation and drive for excellence
High level of focus on work quality and attention to detail
Comprehension of finance fundamentals and strong analytical skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, particularly Microsoft Excel
Ability to perform under pressure and within tight deadlines
Desire to work in a multicultural, diverse, and team-oriented environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English:
For all offices, foreign language capabilities are a strong positive

How To Apply

Job Location:

Singapore

Application Process: 

You must submit your resume and cover letter (in English) through our application portal on our website to be considered. Applications submitted through the university job board will not be considered.

Applying through our website:


Please visit our careers portal here: https://altonaviation.com/careers/
Select the office you are interested in applying to and the position you are applying to (please only apply to one Alton job posting)
Attach resume and cover letter, as well as your contact information
Once you have completed the above, click ‚ÄúSubmit‚Äù to complete your application



Please note: applicants should have the appropriate work authorization for the office location chosen; Alton does not provide visa/work sponsorship for this internship position.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow toge
ther. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

About the team
The TikTok Monetization Product Data Science team plays a critical role in driving initiatives to ensure efficient and healthy monetization through Ads and Commerce ecosystems.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in 2024. Internships at TikTok aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

Successful candidates must be able to commit to one of the following internship cycles below:
1. Summer Internship - 06 May 2024 to 26 July 2024 (12 weeks)
2. Off cycle / Credit bearing - Starting 08 January 2024 or 12 August 2024

We will prioritize candidates who are able to commit in either internship period. Please state your availability clearly in your resume (Start date, End date).

Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

Responsibilities:
- Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed. Conduct analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
- Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale.
- Develop comprehensive knowledge of Tiktok data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for product development.
- Interact cross-functionally, making business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
- Research and develop analysis, forecasting, and optimization methods to improve the quality of Tiktok ads products. 

Qualifications

 Qualifications
- Currently pursuing a Master's in the fields of Business/Data Analytics
- Strong SQL capability (CTE, window function etc.)
- Operation Research, Workforce management, and ML/Statistical modeling experience is a big plus

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Role Summary

Atomionics is looking for a motivated physics intern with a keen interest in cold atom physics. In this role, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with an interdisciplinary team of professionals dedicated to pioneering advancements in gravity measurement solutions within the rapidly growing field of quantum sensing. Join us on our journey to develop disruptive technologies with the potential to revolutionize industries that are the backbones of society. This position offers a unique learning experience and the chance to work at the intersection of research and commercialization at the forefront of innovation.

An absolutely driven individual with creative problem solving skills, analytical mind, and persistence, ideally demonstrated
Curious and interested to learn about cold atom physics and push the limits of applying physics outside the laboratory environment
Excited about interdisciplinary understanding of systems


Even better if you have


Experience in cold atom physics theory or experiments
Experience working with lasers and optics
Working knowledge of Python


What We Can Offer You


A comprehensive immersion into the intricacies of deep tech research, encompassing product development and strategic aspects within a high-growth startup environment
Industry experience for physicists - acquire insights and learn best practices in the fields of engineering and physics, ensuring a holistic overview
A book/hobby project allowance to help you grow and collectively build the Atomionics library
Board games and curry night

Python, Signal Processing, Physics

Title: Intern - Lab Technical (July - December 2024)
Description Snippet:
About the job
About Us

At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.

We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society‚Äôs evolving needs. Learn more about our What and our Why and how we can work together .

ExxonMobil in Singapore

ExxonMobil is one of Singapore‚Äôs largest foreign manufacturing investors with over S$25 billion in fixed asset investments.

We have manufacturing facilities that include an integrated world-scale refining and petrochemical complex in Jurong and Jurong Island, a network of service stations under the Esso brand, operate a lubricant plant and are a supplier of cylinder cooking gas. ExxonMobil provides customers and commercial markets in the region with ground transportation, industrial, aviation and marine fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and liquefied natural gas (LNG).

As Singapore serves as the AP hub for some of our businesses, we employ about 3,500 people across positions in operations, projects, commercial, corporate support functions and others.

ExxonMobil also contributes to community programs in Singapore that support the arts, education, health and the environment.

For more information, visit www.exxonmobil.com.sg or follow ExxonMobil Singapore on LinkedIn and Instagram.

What You Will Do

Through our internship program, you will gain first-hand experience with an industry leader in the refining and petrochemical industry, where your work, and that of the teams, contributes to the growth and future of our business, as we provide energy, sustainable products and solutions for society. You will have the opportunity to explore your career aspirations while delivering tangible benefits throughout our business from invaluable on-the-job-experience. Beyond that, you won‚Äôt be going it alone as you will have a supervisor & buddy assigned to you who can help you navigate the organization, give advice on your development & help you learn what it takes to achieve your goals.

As part of the assessed internship, you‚Äôll have a formal final review on project delivery and performance by your supervisor. You‚Äôll also be asked to prepare a final presentation or report out about your project. Your internship scope would include:


 Investigation of blend failures, including understanding the root cause and developing corrective and preventive actions to achieve good blend performance. 
 Reformulation work, taking the lead to steward component availability, completion of hand blends, testing, analysis, documenting and reporting of results; to work with Technology Solution Professionals to troubleshoot and resolve reformulation issues. 
 Sample requests, to respond to sample requests from internal and external stakeholders, taking the lead to evaluate requests based on availability. 
 Conduct data verification on worksheets and calibration records based on Quality Assurance Manual requirements 
 Work on initiatives to improve the safety, quality, and/or efficiency of the plant (e.g. flush studies, homogeneity studies etc.) 



Our internship programs are assessed, and outstanding candidates may be given a full-time job offer. We prioritize our employment offers to outstanding candidates on our internship program over those without internship.

Join the ExxonMobil Internship Program and be a part of the energy transition!

About You

Skills and Qualifications

To be eligible for our Internship Program, you should be:


 Preferably in your 3rd year of study 
 A degree in Chemical Engineering or Chemistry, preferably potential Second Upper Honors and above, and / or with leadership experience in non-academic areas such as Co-curriculum activities or National Service. 



Stay connected with us:


 Learn more at our website 
 Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram 
 Like us on Facebook 
 Subscribe our channel at YouTube

Quartz ranked us the #1 best company for remote workers 


Responsibilities

The ML/AI industry has conducted a major leap forward in recent times and opened a whole new wealth of possibilities for the software vendors to rethink the user experience. We are seeking a highly motivated and curious Product Management Intern to join our dynamic team - to help with our Workbot product, both in terms of LLM-driven and scripted chat experience. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to learn and contribute to our product development process while gaining valuable hands-on experience in the tech industry. While technical experience is not mandatory, we are looking for candidates with a strong interest in technology and a willingness to learn. In this role, you will work closely with our product management team and other cross-functional teams to support the development and enhancement of our products.

Requirements

Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills


Have a strong passion for technology and a genuine excitement to explore new tools, platforms, and methodologies. 
Are naturally curious, consistently seeking opportunities to learn and grow, and embracing challenges. 
Pay meticulous attention to detail and excel in documenting discussions and important information. 
Possess a tech background, pursuing a degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related discipline.

About the job
Associate (Intern), Spring 2024

Company Introduction

Alton Aviation Consultancy is a specialized management consulting firm focused on the aviation sector. As an independent advisory firm with no joint ventures, affiliations, or other business affiliations, we pride ourselves on offering our clients independent, objective counsel. Our global client base includes, among others, major private equity/institutional investors in aviation, airlines, airports, and aerospace manufacturers. Alton delivers cutting-edge advisory services that help our aviation and aerospace sector clients conquer challenges and grow. Title: Global Broking Summer Intern, 2024
Description Snippet:
About the job
Job Description

Job Description

Looking for a Summer Internship for 2024 in Financial Services? We are offering talented students the opportunity to gain valuable insight and hands-on experience in to our business and the role of a broker. The internship will offer a 6 weeks immersive experience during the summer in our Singapore office.

We are recruiting for a number of Summer Interns to join our Broking division where you will gain unique insight in to broking, the people who perform that role and our industry. While day-to-day responsibilities will vary based on your placement, this represents an incredible opportunity to build your foundational knowledge, professional skills and experiences to take your career in many different directions.

Ideal candidates will be excited to work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment. If you consider yourself to be client facing, hungry for knowledge, excited by change and keen to pursue a career in broking then this opportunity could be just what you‚Äôre looking for.

Who we are:

TP ICAP is a global firm of professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world‚Äôs financial markets, energy and commodities markets.

We provide market participants with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes, including FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy and Commodities. Matching buyers and sellers via electronic, voice and hybrid channels, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. Globally, we are a leading provider of proprietary OTC market data and analytics, with comprehensive coverage of financial, energy and commodities products. Our market data is independent, unbiased and non-position influenced.

Our clients include banks, insurance companies, pension and hedge funds, asset managers, energy producers and refiners, as well as risk and compliance managers and charities.

We are known in the market for our values of Accountability, Adaptability, and Authenticity. Employees are expected to learn, embrace and live the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties.

What you can expect:


Working with experts in broking and financial markets at all levels
Seeing first-hand how financial markets operate
Gain up to date knowledge of the products and markets in which you work
Depending on role - Work exposure including (but not limited to):
rotation across different desks dealing with various financial products
On-boarding processes
Understand pertinent regulation within evolving regulatory landscape

What we require from you:


You will be a penultimate year student in a full-time study.
A passion for working with people, demonstrate strong ability to build relationships and network
Possess excellent communication and collaboration skills. Able to work effectively with a diverse team.
Understands ideas and has a viewpoint on the markets and economy
An eye for detail
Comfortable with ambiguous, ever-changing situations.


What are you waiting for? Apply today!

Not The Perfect Fit? 

Concerned that you may not meet the criteria precisely? At TP ICAP, we wholeheartedly believe in fostering inclusivity and cultivating a work environment where everyone can flourish, regardless of your personal or professional background. If you are enthusiastic about this role but find that your experience doesn't align perfectly with every aspect of the job description, we strongly encourage you to apply. You may be the ideal candidate for this position or another opportunity within our organisation. Our dedicated Talent Acquisition team is here to assist you in recognising how your unique skills and abilities can be a valuable contribution. Don't hesitate to take the leap and explore the possibilities. Your potential is what truly matters to us.

Company Statement

We know that the best innovation happens when diverse people with different perspectives and skills work together in an inclusive atmosphere. That's why we're building a culture where everyone plays a part in making people feel welcome, ready and willing to contribute. TP ICAP Accord - our Employee Network - is a central to this. As well as representing specific groups, TP ICAP Accord helps increase awareness, collaboration, shares best practice, and holds our firm to account for driving continuous cultural improvement. 

Location

Singapore - 50 Raffles Place - Singapore

 Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail

Title: College of Engineering International Postdoctoral Fellow
Description Snippet:
About the job
The College of Engineering (CoE) International Postdoctoral Fellowship (IPF), supported by Ministry of Education, provides opportunity for young outstanding Singaporeans with passion to pursue an academic career at the Nanyang Technological University (NTU) by supporting their postdoctoral fellowship abroad at approved overseas universities.

During the period of the postdoctoral fellowship, the successful candidates will be employed as International Postdoctoral Scholar in the engineering schools of their choice. The appointment will take effect one month before they officially commence their IPF, for which they will be fully sponsored and granted paid study leave of up to two [2] years. Upon successful completion of their IPF, they will be appointed as tenure-track Assistant Professors in the engineering schools at NTU.

The successful candidates are expected to develop and contribute domain knowledge, research skills and expertise at the host university while fulfilling the requirements of the CoE IPF. They will also actively seek out collaborative research opportunities with NTU faculty and to participate in research projects, thereby deepening the strategic collaboration between NTU and the overseas university.

Fellowship Eligibility


Applicants must possess (1) at least a Second Upper Class Honours Degree of Bachelor of Engineering or Science, or equivalent qualifications, and (2) a PhD degree in engineering or science, from reputable universities including NTU.
Applicants must have proof of excellence in research.
Applicants should aspire to develop successful academic career.
Applicants are Singapore Citizens.


Further information on the programme - including the application form, programme structure, mentorship, service agreement, application process - can be downloaded here.

The application deadline is on 31 December 2022. The Evaluation Committee will only start reviewing applications after the closing date.

Do submit all applications via NTU Workday by clicking the "Apply" button.

All late or incomplete applications will not be considered.

If applicants have further queries, please feel free to contact Shi Lin (email:slmok@ntu.edu.sg).

Hiring Institution: NTU

Title: Intern, Public Relations (Corporate)
Description Snippet:
About the job

Position: Intern, Public Relations (Corporate) | (minimum 6 months, full-time Monday - Friday)

Reports to: Manager

Role Location: Singapore




This is a PR internship opportunity with a PR agency




ABOUT US

Golin is a global public relations agency that helps companies create change that matters. Throughout our 60+ year history, we have redefined the role of PR with best-in-class, data-driven creative that has earned worldwide attention and awards ‚Äì we are both PRWeek Global Agency of the Year and AMEC Large Research & Measurement Team of the Year for 2019, 2020 and 2021. Representing some of the world‚Äôs biggest brands, we offer a suite of services from content creation and production, influencer marketing, corporate and consumer strategy, and public affairs to name a few.




We‚Äôre proud to have made an impact in Asia for over 25 years, with teams in Shanghai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Singapore, Taipei, Jakarta, Mumbai, Delhi, Bangalore, Kuala Lumpur, Seoul, and Tokyo. Together, our mission is Creating Change in Asia for Asia ‚Äì from defining new era travel through our multi-award-winning campaign work to pioneering industry-leading tools, to purpose-driven legislation change, we make sure that the changes we make matter to business, society, legislation, our people and industry.




Golin Singapore creates impact for clients with a diverse team of specialists across data analytics, creative intelligence, content production, performance marketing, consumer activation, stakeholder engagement, and reputation management. We‚Äôre a regional hub of excellence that drives brave and bold innovation through a culture of empowerment, collaboration, and accountability.




Our ethos is simple yet powerful: we Go All In. For our clients. For our colleagues. For our agency. For our industry. If that sounds like something you could wake up every morning to help with, then read on.




WHO WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR

Curious, creative, and focused individuals ready to play a critical role in making things happen at Golin. Our interns get the chance to craft media pitches, work on media events and brainstorm for campaigns for clients in the corporate sector.




If you‚Äôre a strong writer and communicator, possess an eye for detail, are a whiz at organizing, and most importantly, think creatively and strategically, we would love to meet you!




RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Media monitoring, analysis, and reporting - Monitor and track client, competitor, industry, and cultural news and share it with the team
Campaign planning (brainstorming, business analysis, campaign analysis, ideation), including:
Support the team in research tasks and present the analysis clearly
Participate actively in brainstorming sessions to bring fresh, new creative ideas
Social and digital media campaign planning and execution
Draft media materials (e.g. press releases, fact sheets, briefing documents, etc)
Media relations ‚Äì including providing media support, coordinating logistics, and assisting with media material creation and outreach
Provide media outreach support and coordinate logistics with external vendors and provide on-site event support
Develop a deeper understanding of the Corporate Communications landscape, hone your language and nuances in addressing B2B/ B2G audiences
You will also receive training across media relations, writing, and campaign development in the span of your internship.




What you‚Äôll bring

Strong communication skills ‚Äì written and verbal
Teamwork. No man is an island
Tenacious and solutions-driven. Work well under pressure, remaining calm and professional
Actively listen to instructions and demonstrate an understanding of assignment expectations (deadlines and deliverables)
Demonstrate critical thinking, curiosity, and eagerness to learn
Meticulous and detail-oriented. Display the ability to identify, manage and resolve issues
Degree in Business, English, Journalism, Public Relations, Communications, or a related field
A plus if you have prior internship/working experience in PR.

Job Description & Summary

Our Risk Services team helps clients to analyse, assess and address a wide range of risks by providing insights and assurance which is invaluable in today's high-risk business environment. We also work with our clients to build trust across their digital/technology-enabled businesses and address areas such as the loss or misuse of important data, failure to react to changes in the market, implementing and reviewing systems or business processes and ensuring third-party providers are working as expected in managing and controlling their existing and future financial regulatory risk.
